The large bar area that offers a communal dining experience is a nice touch and look inside. I think that if they really upped the main entrees and pushed the creativity level that this place could offer very strong potential in a very tough and competitive dining area. Good job overall!
author: Ron M.

description:
I was there for Xmas eve brunch.   My friend ordered the Marlowe and I ordered the short rib.  I'm not sure how she felt about the burger, but mine was beyond delicious. A beautiful generous piece of rib, with polenta and onion, and broccoli.  It was better then I can describe.

My only complaint is the music.  My friend and I had to lean over the table to hear one another.  Not sure why an active restaurant has to add unnecessary noise.

I'd go back -- I want to try the deviled egg -- and will recommend to friends who happen to be in North Beach.
author: Lois L.

description: Park Tavern is a great neighborhood spot in North Beach overlooking Washington Square. I've been here several times and it never disappoints. If you get a chance to sit at the Chef's Table definitely do it so you can watch them make and plate everything. My husband always gets the Poulet Rouge- it's what they are known for. The sides with the chicken changes seasonally, but it's always a fan favorite. I love to PT fries and deviled eggs to start. Other than the Poulet Rouge, the portion sizes for the mains are pretty small. Recommend definitely getting some starters and saving room for dessert!
author: Carol Ann V.

description: Two friends and I had a birthday dinner here while visiting from out of town. The atmosphere is dimly lit, had an upscale farmhouse look and felt slightly like a modern contemporary lodge. Fantastic decor that left you feeling transported out of the city. We had a reservation but our table took an extra 20 minutes so the hostess brought free champagne which was a very nice touch. She was lovely. Our dinner was delicious. I highly recommend the deviled eggs as an app, the stone fruit salad as a starter salad and almost anything else they serve. Service was fantastic. My steak was slightly overdone so I received a correctly cooked one and wasn't charged for that dish. To top off the night, our server brought a delicious piece of cake with a candle so we could celebrate the birthday. Overall, a wonderful experience!
author: Lindsey P.

description:
If the food was better, it would be a good place for date night or dinner with friends. The restaurant has a good vibe and atmosphere, but it's too bad some of the food was a turn off. 

Brussel Sprout Chips: these were fried well and were pretty good. Might have been one of the better dishes we ordered. 

Beef Carpaccio: served with bone marrow and crostini. I didn't think the bone marrow added much to this dish. The beef carpaccio was good but not amazing. 

Roasted Lamb: my lamb chops were wayyyyy too salty, which completely ruined my dinner. My friend ordered the same dish and he said his was also really salty. We probably should have said something to our waiter but didn't bother to. I was really disappointed. The texture was good and the meat was cooked perfectly. It would've been great if it wasn't so salty.  

On the other hand, my boyfriend's fish was a tad bland and didn't have enough flavor.

I think my friend's Manila Clams was the best dish of the night. The broth was really flavorful and delicious. I regret not getting this dish.

We didn't try any of the drinks since we brought 2 bottles of wine with us and paid the corkage fee. 

I'm not sure if I would come back here considering how bad my lamb entrée was. There are so many other good restaurants in SF that there's really no reason for me to give Park Tavern a 2nd chance.
author: Mai Y.

description:
Took my boo here for a date night and it was SO YUM.

- wagyu steak: buttery, flavorful, and the mashed potatoes were so good
- octopus: perfectly cooked, crip outside
- deviled eggs: YUM - and the jalapenos weren't that spicy!

Highly recommend this place for a nice night out.
author: Sue C.

description: Love the Lemon Chips! It's is so special and crispy! The deviled egg is good too:) Also with great service! Might visit again soon!
author: TsaoWu C.

description: Beautiful ambiance and a lively crowd, I'll definitely be back to dine here. While we only came for drinks, I tried their deviled eggs and just died; it was decadent.
author: Brittany S.

description: Food was decent. No soap in the bathroom, which totally grossed me out. The manager was notified, but didn't seem that concerned. I hate to think of how many employees went to the bathroom without washing their hands. Probably won't go back.
author: Glory D.

description:
I had a hankering for some grits, so I decided to try the Shrimp & Grits from here. The dish, which had bacon bits and cheddar, was overall pretty savory, albeit a bit on the salty side. The firm and meaty smoked prawns were a crunchy, tasty delight. No grits, no glory! 

In addition to the grits, I had the opportunity to taste the Smoked Deviled Egg with bacon, pickled jalapeno, and chive. This was YUM-MY. 

The French toast plate, with cherry compote and mascarpone was so-so---I wasn't too eager to devour it. Not to mention it was too sweet for my liking. Definitely not one of the best, so I wouldn't recommend this. 

The restaurant was packed, so they must be doing things right! When it all comes down to it--the experience wasn't too shabby! I would come back--
author: Merica S.

description:
Brunch review. 

Deviled Eggs - 4/5 - 7x7
Trout toast - 3/5
Shrimp and grits - 5/5 - Very good 

Overall, best shrimp and grits that I've found so far. "As good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description: I consider myself quite a peaceful man. I don't complain much, and I can be satisfied quite easily. That being said, I have never been disrespected more than I have at this restaurant. The hostess was terribly rude as soon as my group came into the restaurant. Mid-conversation she turned away from our group to hug a co-worker and ask them about their day. She then scoffed and rolled her eyes at us when we asked a simple question.
author: Cole C.

description: Great place with better service! The Kobe tartare appetizer is one of the best ever. Duck and pork chop dinners were amazing! The staff is the best in the country
author: Joe B.

description:
Inviting and cozy environment akin to a well laid-out food-related  Instagram photo - Park Tavern provides a relaxed environment to enjoy a relatively focused menu of American dishes.  Don't have a reservation for brunch - no sweat - put your name on the waitlist for the first-come, first-serve shared communal table; best for groups with an even number. The seating is tight at the shared table so be weary of sharing juicy stories as those around you are likely listening in...

Smoked salmon Benedict - on top of the toasted rustic bread, laid a decent portion of smoked salmon that was light in flavor, not overly smoky in flavor  and a perfectly poached egg with classic hollandaise sauce. Note - if you're sharing, add another egg so each person cleanly gets a portion.

French toast with cherry compote - good texture, not overly seasoned with spices and adorned with delicious cherries that have been stewed in a light syrup
author: Julia K.

description:
The food was amazing!!! I loved every bite. Everything came out amazingly but The only thing I can complain about was my server. The entire time my friends and I were there, she gave us a horrible attitude and mutter things under her breath. She never told us when last call was for brunch and she grabbed my plate before I even finished. We were understanding since everyone can have a bad day but to be passive aggressive? It's uncalled for. Definitely one of the most unpleasant and uncomfortable dining experiences I've had. A shame. 


They have great customer service when you do reach out to them. I appreciate them addressing my concerns. Again, great food and drinks.
author: Penelope Y.

description:
Had a reservation at 5:45 on Saturday. The restaurant was empty. We were taken to our table and before we sat down the waitress was already asking us what we wanted to drink. We asked for a few minutes to settle in and we watched her roll her eyes and walk away. She returned literally 1 minuet later and again asked what we wanted to drink. Once again we asked for a little more time to decide. Then another waiter took over for her and we ordered drinks from him and watched the first waitress leer at us. We ordered dinner and that's when things got worse. The waiter spilled food on me with with very little apology. The bus boy tried to take our food away with fork and knife in hand. The waiter asked us if we wanted another glass of wine, with wine still in the glasses. We said no thank you and before we could say anything, took the wine glasses away. 

Bottom line is this, the food was quite mediocre at best the hustle to turn and burn the tables was unbelievable and the service is simply a joke! Avoid this restaurant at all cost!
author: Hillel A.

description:
This review is only for BRUNCH, 3.5 Stars. 

I loved my experience at Park Tavern for dinner a couple years back therefore I made reservations for brunch with my girls. Yes, they allow RESERVATIONS for BRUNCH!! Thats awesome! We did have to wait about 10 mins to be seated after our reservation time. We were a party of 6 and we started with 2 orders of their Challah. Its thicker toast on butter, cinnamon & sugar. I love toast and I love cinnamon sugar. It was good and crunchy but I felt like some areas of the toast did not receive any cinnamon sugar love. Since it's $7 dollars, I was hoping for more cinnamon sugar. We also got a side order of fries. YUM! Their fries are delicious.

I got the Pan-Fried Corned Beef Hash. It was pretty tasty, but I think the portion was small. If it wasn't for the Challah and fries, I wouldn't have been content. I'm a size 4 and this size 4 needs a little bigger portion. A few of my friends got the **Cast Iron-Baked Farm Eggs. They think its very yummy but yet again, the dish was very tiny. We end up walking over to Chinatown for some pastries. The services was good and some of my friends were picky but the server, she was great. I would come back for large parties because they have reservations for brunch. That a super plus! Parking on Sunday wasn't too bad but parking in this area can be hard.
author: Sandy B.

description:
3.5-star rating.

We were taking our dog to the groomer in North Beach, so it only made sense to grab brunch while we waited. I was able to get reservations at 10:15 a.m. on Saturday about a week before. When we got there, the restaurant was pretty empty but filled up by 11 and had a ton of people waiting. Definitely recommend reservations!

The decor is very modern and I guess rustic. Reminded me of Girl and the Goat in Chicago, if you've ever been. We got seated in a cozy corner table near the kitchen area. It was a bit chilly/drafty inside (it was also a typical foggy day in SF), and didn't seem to really warm up. The bf kept his jacket on, and I ordered tea to keep warm.

The menu is short and straightforward. I think it has a bit of everything for everyone's brunch tastes for a short menu. Our server gave us a rundown of the popular dishes, which was helpful. Service throughout was nice and attentive. They course out your meal (or try to), so they come around and clear the dishes and clean the table when you're done with one course. I honestly felt coursing out a brunch was kinda unnecessary =/ 

To the food!
- Avocado toast: Good, but nothing crazy special
- Smoked Deviled Egg: Very interesting flavors. I think the pickled jalapenos + bacon was an intriguing combo, not sure if I 100% liked it. The bf did not enjoy it :P
- Shrimp and Grits: YUM, but the shrimp was quite salty =X The grits definitely helped to balance it out (I don't think the shrimp were intentionally made that salty FYI)
- Buttermilk pancakes: They give you a really sadddd amount of syrup with the pancakes. Nothing super special about these pancakes either.

I was not disappointed with Park Tavern, but I was also not impressed. Maybe I'll come by again another time to try their dinner menu.
author: Doris K.

description:
Birthday dinner with family. Local 4th generation SF.  What a combination of failure from hostess to server who wore a contentious mask of snobbery and indifference the entire unpleasant evening. Please! Get another job if you don't like what you are doing, and not make guests suffer. The hostess refused to seat us at a more comfortable table even though it was not reserved and was available in the main dining room. She lied to my face and said it was reserved for a party of five, (we were a party of four, so no big deal right?) Fifteen minutes later she seated a walk in couple (2) at the table for five. We had requested a main dining room table for my birthday. We were sort of surprised as we had asked two different times to move and when it's easy to make a quick change  for a guest based on an easily open table you should do it if it's a chance to make a difference in your customers experience. Fast forward to our server who was an unbelievably callous and disconnected waitress. She snubbed us and her whole area the entire evening. No welcome . No explanation of the menu. No hi , welcome to park tavern , just this smug and unhappy attitude . I tried several times to engage her in polite small talk in hopes of getting things on track , how was your evening going ? Seems a bit busy tonight , hope your hanging in there , it's our first time here etc. she just blankly stares back. When inquiring about the menu and cocktails on both times she said "I have no idea" or " I don't try everything " or "that's new how would I know" Drinks came out at a slow procession and the entire dinner took 2 hours. When she dropped off my slice of cake with a candle for my birthday she just plopped it on the table lit candle and stomped off to attend other unhappy customers. Not impressed . I don't leave reviews like this. So many other places to eat.  Food.. while pretty enjoyable was really truthfully mediocre at best by SF standards. Atmosphere and ambience were on point with dark woods and good lighting and festive bar. Unfortunate that the wait staff let a potentially good experience rattle around as a gutter ball missing all the pins.
Maybe it was an off night or the stars were not aligned but this was just not an acceptable experience for us, your mileage may vary. Perhaps brunch is where  they excel. I noted all the Yelp hidden reviews (scroll to the very bottom of the reviews section) reflect very similar experiences with wait staff and hostess.
author: Eddie C.

description:
My experience was a 3.5 stars experience. 

My group started with the brussels sprouts, which was entirely dependent on fat. The fat crutch is old and tired.  The dish would have benefited from citrus or vinegar for brightness/contrast. 

I ordered the burger medium, which is how it arrived. Yay! The fries are great too. Solid burger, but nothing particularly memorable.

The octopus was initially tasty, but chewy.  It was not as tender as one would hope. Additionally, the more you ate the dish, the more you were salted out. Every part of the dish was aggressively salted, making it tough to eat more. 

Lastly, this place is dark, dark, dark.  Enter at your own risk. Muahahahahha.
author: P L.

description:
I wanted to find a classy restaurant to take my boyfriend to that serves memorable American food and came across Park Tavern through friends' recommendations and some thorough Googling. Nailed it!

We arrived ten minutes before our 5:30pm reservation on a Saturday night. The hostess informed us that they'd seat us at 5:30pm- my first impression was that she seemed a little grumpy for a welcoming hostess. No smile or no "Good evening!" It didn't bother us- we wandered to the bar to grab a cocktail and checked out the swanky ambiance. Dimmed lighting and classy, white tablecloth tables- I loved the vibe (perfect for date night and visitors if you're not trying to go to a fancy steakhouse but want that type of style).

We were promptly seated at a two-person table near the kitchen. I always love watching chefs at work, especially when there are huge flames involved! I'm addicted to pork belly, so we ordered the crispy pork belly from the Appetizers list, as well as the lardo-wrapped smoked shrimp. The pork belly was so divine- fatty and flavorful- order it! The shrimp was plump and good, but nothing too unique- you can skip it.

We split the $32 whole chicken as our entree, which lived up to its hype. Juicy, tender chicken on a bed of veggies- mmm. You won't regret it. That's pretty much one of their classic dishes and I can see why so many Yelp reviews rave about it.

For dessert (yeah I know, we eat a lot), we ordered the lemon cheesecake and ice cream sandwiches. Both were meh- the cheesecake too tart and lemony and a little mushy in texture, and I wish I knew the oatmeal cookies in the ice cream sandwich were crunchy and not warm/soft. You're better off enjoying an It's It from a grocery store if you're in an ice cream sandwich mood.

The overall service was very pleasant. Our main waiter checked in frequently and kept our table clean and our waters full. The food arrived at a perfect pace. The bill fit the quality of the food and service.

Overall, I would've given 4.5 stars if a) the hostess had a friendlier and warmer disposition, and b) if they had rocked the desserts. I'd come back here again to try the Marlowe burger and deviled eggs, though!
author: Tanya B.

description:
We had a great meal, the wine was amazing. The executive chef was working as expediter and honestly it was such an awesome experience watching the cooks and her interact. Our server was the perfect amount of attentiveness without being over bearing. 
Only reason for 4 stars and not 5 is the dessert wasn't very good. We got the ice cream sandwich (rock hard cookies, cold) and the lemon cheesecake. I would not recommend either. Other than that, this place was a knockout.
author: Diana H.

description: Park Tavern is one of many great restaurants from the Marlowe group. Personally, I think it is the best version of their fare that is offered here in San Francisco. The food is great but most of all the atmosphere and service are second to none. The classic deviled eggs are crazy good and the constantly changing menu always brings a fresh taste of what is local and in season. If you are looking for a friday night date spot then this is your place. If you have friends in town and looking to showthem what the SF food scene has to offer then this is your place. Centrally located in North Beach(Italian Neighborhood) with beautiful scenery and only a few steps from some amazing nightlife.
author: Anthony R.

description: A server can make or break a restaurant experience. The server we had at brunch on Saturday took a fantastic meal to the next level. Everything she recommended was amazing- I have had dreams about the french toast and shrimp and grits. She also surprised us with birthday cake for my friend and in general was a delight to talk to.
author: Kay D.

description: I have lived in the neighborhood nearly 5 years. Park Tavern has a lively ambiance and high quality food. My go to!
author: Christopher W.

description: The food was excellent from top to bottom. The Lemon Chips were one of the most unique and delicious things I have ever eaten. We mentioned that we prefer to eat Gluten Free and every part of the staff that came to take care of us knew of our preference. This was one of the best experiences I have ever had at a restaurant and would highly recommend to anyone.
author: Jim H.

description:
Park Tavern is definitely an "it" spot. Throw a birthday dinner here and be praised by all.

I got a fish entree and it was literally the best cooked fished I have ever had - so soft that the pieces literally broke apart in my mouth without any chewing. A friend got the chicken and it was masterful.

Solid, formal ambience right off of the beautiful Washington Square Park. You can't go wrong at Park Tavern.
author: Salma R.

description:
After reading reviews on Yelp we decided to give the Park Tavern a try. We had a group of five and were quickly seated (we did have reservations) and met by a friendly waiter who knew the menu and answered all our initial questions quickly and with great knowledge. We had to get moved after there was a ceiling drip and changed waiters. 

The group ordered two burgers, the bar steak, pea soup and the deviled eggs and fried lemon chips as appetizers. We were very impressed with the fried lemon chips and really enjoyed them and suggest that you try this for something different and memorable. 

The burgers were well constructed with a good taste and juicy. While nothing really special, I always appreciate a well executed burger. A good default if nothing else on the menu appeals to you or if someone in your party is less adventuresome. 

The deviled eggs were also popular with a mix of flavors that blended well and were a bit different that what you'd expect. 

Was it great? Not really but it is reliably good, high quality food and flavors that you will enjoy and come back for in the future. Sometimes you don't really want cutting edge flavors right?

They get extra points for good and friendly service.
author: Brian M.

description: Second visit.  Nice atmosphere, a little noisy.  Very good greeter, found us a table by specific request. Attentive service. Food overall very good, though not cheap. Sides were v good (and good for our vegetarian).  I had the fish which i found to be surprisingly small portion fir the price and a bit dry. Sides did not appear until well after main course arrived.  Not sure i would go again.
author: Dan N.

description:
Park Tavern, you da coolest. Housed in the midst of SF's beautiful North Beach neighborhood, this restaurant is a great go to spot for special nights out. I went here with friends and family for a graduation and had so much fun! Here were the dishes we tried out:

3/5: Crispy Lemon Chips: Burrata, fines herbes, sorrel & hawaiian black sea salt. I would skip this one unless you really love lemon. Otherwise it's an interesting taste but not worth the cash monay.

4.5/5: Deviled Eggs: This dish rocked but was overly hyped up for me. Worth trying if you love deviled eggs!

4.5/5: Poulet Noir: Some of the best chicken I've ever had. Definitely split-worthy if you are a light eater.
author: Nicole W.

description: Great food and fabulous ambiance. Like any other place in SF this place gets extremely packed on the weekends. But definitely worth the wait. We had the trout pate and I worried it would be fishy, but was surprisingly delicious. The polenta cakes were my favourite and my friends baked eggs with Kale was yum.
author: Trisha H.

description: Brussels sprouts chips were great as was the wagyu beef jerky. The beef jerky alone might be worth a visit. All the poulet rouge was also quite good. The PT fries were a little rich for me. All around solid spot
author: Michael C.

description:
Food here was not quite four stars however the ambience and the service made up for it.  We came here for a birthday party and since the birthday guest knew the owners we also had some free champagne and appetizers. It was a very fun evening. 

We started with brussels sprouts chips and truffle fries. They were amazing. We then did family-style dinner plates.

The whole game hen was delicious and tender.  The clam dish was also really good.  The pork and steak dish was just OK. A little lacking in flavor for a nice restaurant. We also had lamb although I didn't have enough of it to really judge.

We ended with ice cream cookies and a cheese plate.  I then I was so stuffed from the game hen that I didn't eat much

Overall the place felt very warm and festive and the service was great.
author: Lei H.

description:
Great service, awesome location and interior, and a really nice ambiance make this upscale American eatery worth a visit. 

Our server was very attentive, introduced several of his favorites, and checked in to see how everything is going. The menu is well-balanced - fancy traditional American food, with the CRISPY LEMON CHIPS ($14) and the "MARLOWE" BURGER ($16) standing out.

I cannot, however, neglect the HUSH PUPPIES ($10) or the PERFECT Manhattan - DAMN! That was good! (but number two was even better!) - yes, I had a driver ;)
author: Nick S.

description: Little delayed in my review but this place was great. Busy and bustling. Fabulous cocktails and great food.
author: Madison S.

description: Upscale place. We had a great party, and we were treated warmly, and the service never missed. The atmosphere was attractive. The meal was delicious. In general, the balance of good food, atmosphere and service was very appreciated.
author: Jose S.

description: Park Tavern is SO good. Before I was vegan, I was so pleased with the amazing meat and seafood options. As a vegan now, they have a Farmers Market Harvest, which makes this vegan lady happy. The cocktails are amazing (my besties LOVE the espresso martini), and the wine list is awesome. But most of all, the hosts, bartenders, servers, bussers, etc, are SO nice and make us feel so happy and welcome. For this reason, we come and visit Park Tavern at least twice a month, if not more!
author: Julia D.

description:
They have very different food than what is around the area which is awesome! The service was great! Drinks and food was amazing! 
I had, 
The deviled eggs
The devil on horseback
A few other things, 
And the May birthday cake for dessert!
author: Maggie W.

description:
It is with rare entousiasm, not to be seen in over a year, that I feel this place deserves a full 5 stars.  
I had the foie gras terrine, which was out of this world, a deviled egg, and the pork chop, which rivaled the best pork meat I've had in Germany. The pork chop was tender and flavorful and seemed ever so slightly smoked before it was roasted - an excellent touch. 
The only criticism I might have is that the bar takes a bit long at this place and I had to remind them to serve the side, which I got about 10 min into the entree. But the food quality simply trumped all of that and it wasn't the server's fault either as their model is to get the food out by whoever sees it sitting there. Full 5 stars for delicacies served.
author: M R.

description: I planned brunch here for a group of 10 as an engagement celebration after I proposed to my now-fiancee. It could not have gone more wonderfully! McKenzie was ecstatic to be able to take our reservation and help us out with bubbles when we arrived on our special day. Our server, Mike, was so friendly and helpful as well. The food was excellent - you've got to try the fritters as an appetizer! This is truly one of my favorite restaurants I've been to in SF, and the location is excellent, right across the street from Washington Square Park. I would highly recommend coming here with a group of friends - you will have an awesome time and some incredible food & service.
author: Patrick D.

description:
We met up with some friends here on a recent trip to San Francisco. They called a day ahead of time to reserve a table for 4 at prime brunch time (1pm on a Sunday), so we didn't have to wait. 

It's a fairly big place located right across from Washington Sq park. I really enjoyed the ambiance here- you can tell as soon as you walk in that your craft cocktail will be delicious and refreshing. Our server was friendly, quick, and attentive to our group. 

We are avid gin drinkers and ordered two McLaren's (Hendrix gin, cucumber, lemon and ginger beer). SO good. I highly recommend ordering the deviled eggs as an appetizer as well. Hands down the best ones I've ever had. 

I ordered the Cast Iron Baked Farm Eggs and holy moly was that a great decision. Also ordered and thoroughly enjoyed by everyone at our table: Marlowe burger, Crispy Polenta Cakes, and Shrimp and Grits. The plates returned clean to the kitchen. 

We all left very happy and full. A little spendy for brunch, but you get what you pay for. Highly recommend this place!
author: Paige N.

description:
This place is so cute! 
Beautiful setting over looking  the park!
Went for Friday brunch. 
Got the heirloom tomato/melon salad. 
It was amazing, sooo fresh. 
Tip: get the lemon chips
author: Rose G.

description: Delicious Sunday brunch spot. It was super busy, but the hostess found a seeat for us at the bar right away. Our food and mimosas were excellent, and our server was awesome. Their bacon is served on a super fancy bacon holder
author: Attosha B.

description: Great atmosphere. Comfortable dining. Grab a seat at the bar, order the Park Tavern Salad and a burger, and enjoy the ambience. The salad I had was on point -- ripe, buttery avocados with crisp and fresh gem lettuce. Green Goddess dressing was subtle but seasoned.
author: May C.

description:
I got offered to sit at the chef's counter and said yes with a grand smile!  The chef's counter has only 4 seats available and on the kitchen side.  It was a very pleasant view to watch the staff prep, cook, make it presentable and pick up the entrees ready to go, go, go. 

The ambiance to this place is dimly lit and they have an outdoor seating area that is great for a nice, warm, weather day.

Their beer selections are swell.  Belgium beer for the win.  Do order up their deviled eggs.  Smooth, but crisp from the bacon, it is a delight as an opening starter to the palate. 

That truffled Poulet is savory and delicious with every bite I took.  The presentation is a stand up chicken.  I love truffle flaaaaavor and when you put it on a juicy Poulet, it is perfect.  I couldn't get enough of that truffle buttery richness so I used the squash that was surrounding the roasted Poulet, to dip into the truffle jus and I was just in truffle, savory haven!  It is so mouth quenching-palate gooooooood! 

Their burger was yummy and guaranteed to hit the spot.  I used the fries and dipped that into the truffle Poulet jus.  

It was great service and we were well attended. 

Taverns were of the mediocrity to me, until I have encountered this and a few others.  Now, I look forward on dining at taverns because they are a great spot to whine down at, shy away from the crowd, if wanted, and have a great gourmet time!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
My best friend came to visit from Chicago literally just for 25 hours, so I wanted to bring her someplace good. I invited two of my other friends, so in total we had four people. The wait on a Wednesday night right around dinner rush was probably 20 minutes or so, not bad at all. When we walked in, the place was totally packed - small tables, large group, and everything in between.

The first thing we did upon being seated was check out their drinks. I didn't order anything because I was driving that night. My friends ordered a couple of their cocktails and gave thumbs up all around.

We asked our waitress for recommendations, and she recommended a couple of the starters as well as the Marlowe Burger. We decided on the Brussels Sprout Chips and the Crispy Lemon Chips. I will say the Brussels Sprout Chips were not my favorite just because I feel like you can get those anywhere, and cheaper, The Crispy Lemon Chips were amazing~ I could've eaten the whole thing by myself. Citrusy, herby, cheesy, how can you go wrong? Definitely recommend getting those. My best friend ordered the Marlowe Burger and she finished it all. She said it was super delicious, but she didn't end up finishing all of the fries. I ordered the Bar Steak, rare, with salad on the side instead of fries. That butter on top and the red wine jus elevated the steak to a whole 'nother level! I couldn't get enough. Surprisingly, one of the best steaks I've had in the city.

Our waitress stopped by frequently to check up on us and she also gave great recommendations. The ambiance of the place was cool, relaxed, and very SF in my opinion. Tie it all together with good food and great company, which means I'll have to come back here in the future!
author: Eryn H.

description: I was at Park Tavern on Friday night , August 17th with family from out of town.  We ordered drinks at the bar around 8.30 pm and when it came time to pay the bill - my daughter,  who is not American forgot to tip the barman.  Instead of politely asking if there was a problem, he became threatening and glared at her and spoke very loudly about not being tipped, he slammed a glass down on the bar and glared threateningly at her again.  She realized that she should have tipped and was going to but was quite nervous at his reaction and when we all looked back  - he was glaring at all three of us and talking to another customer.  I was shocked.  Park Tavern is my favourite rest and I eat there regularly, this type of behaviour is not acceptable and I honestly don't feel comfortable going to the bar again.  It was an honest mistake and could have been rectified by a simple question instead of aggressive behaviour which made us all feel nervous.
author: Anne-Marie C.

description: Stumbled across Park Tavern while looking for an reservation on Open Table. Decided to try it out since they had availability for the time we needed and great reviews on OT. Arrived for our reservation and were seated within a couple minutes. Our server came over promptly and brought waters. At our request, she reviewed the chefs menu for that evening which was a bone in T-bone steak with scalloped sweet potatoes, beet greens and a chimichuri sauce. We decided on that as the entree and started with the persimmons as a starter. The persimmons tasted fresh and were easy to cut. The whole almonds were a bit challenging to serve and even more so to eat using a fork, but it was a nice starter. Our steak was "misfired" so we got to try the deviled eggs & Brussel sprout chips. The eggs were great - topped with jalapeño and bacon. The Brussel sprout chips  were hit & miss for me and my date didn't enjoy them at all. The hard fried pieces were not good to me... the ones which had a bit of green left were the best bites & the lemon was a good edition. The steak & sweet potatoes came out shortly after and they were PHENOMENAL. The waitress picked an excellent Tempranillo wine to pair with the meal. The sweet potatoes were delicious- cheesy, sweet and savory. The steak was cooked a perfect medium and already cut off the bone in slices perfect for serving. We finished with coffee creme brûlée and it was perfectly portioned alongside almond biscotti. Will be back!
author: Alexa S.

description:
One of my dearest friends from LA was in town and I was pressed to decide a restaurant that'd satisfy all parties. This was a bit of a challenge because my friend classifies me as a discriminating gourmand with hipster tastes while he, on the other hand, is into more luxurious environs. I figured we'd give Park Tavern a try and thankfully I made the right choice. He got his chic ambiance and I got my good food. 

Being from LA and having lived on the East Coast where dressing up for Friday night dinner feels more commonplace, I've come to realize San Francisco is interestingly more casual than LA despite SoCal's "laid back" reputation. Silly as this sounds, I miss dressing up for nice dinners -- and this is certainly the case for my friend as well. It appears we found one of the handful of restaurants where male diners donned button-ups and female diners wore beautiful dresses and coats. BUT, the nice thing about Park Tavern despite its aesthetic formality: it didn't feel stuffy by any means! It was sophisticated but buzzing.

We had a late dinner reservation for 9:30. Our friends just flew in from LA but were ready to hit the bar. That said, as soon as we walked in (after being nicely greeted by a lovely hostess and friendly host), we saw our friends enjoying their drinks. My friend had the McLaren (gin, cucumber, lemon & ginger beer) and his boyfriend had Mary Etta's Bubbles (sparkling wine, framboise & lemon twist). Our other friends walked in and the six of us were escorted to our table close to the semi-open kitchen. While we decided on our appetizers and entrees we were given some rustic bread and butter to nibble on. I also decided to order a glass of a Demi-Sec Rosé (Gérard Bertrand, Crémant de Limoux, France 2013). This was a lovely, lovely, lovely rosé.  

Five of the six of us wanted their smoked deviled eggs which were fantastic to start the meal. The bacon and chives were familiar accompaniments but the pickled jalapeño was a fun surprise. My boyfriend and I also had the Marlowe Burger which they nicely divided in half for us to share. The horseradish aïoli made that burger for me. Oh, and they have pretty good fries: golden, crisp, and not too greasy or over-seasoned. We also ordered a new item on their menu: the pork belly with mustard seeds and (if I recall) black rice. The salty pork cracklings were out of this world. Also, at the insistence of two ladies we met in a Lyft on the way to Park Tavern, we ordered the brown butter brussels sprouts with parmesan and chili flakes. We both agreed this was good but not the best thing of the night. Finally, in terms of dessert, the six of us were stuffed yet we wanted a sweet bite to round off the meal. We split the September "birthday" cake which was lemonade-inspired. It came out with a lit candle on top so that was a cute presentation 

Our server was friendly and attentive as well as the other waitstaff. Park Tavern's service, food, and ambiance were spot on. It took my boyfriend and I awhile to check out this spot but we're both glad we did. Park Tavern is classic Americana.
author: James Z.

description: Great brunch spot in north beach! I've been once for dinner, but enjoyed brunch more. We made a reservation on OpenTable and were seated right when we arrived. We ordered the egg chorizo scramble, berries and cream parfait, deviled eggs and a burger. We were dying to try the sweet butter bread, but they were sold out. The avocado toast also looked delicious. 4 stars not 5 because service fell short, but we will definitely be back!
author: Nicola L.

description: If you are looking for breakfast you have to go here everything was good They had really good pancakes and French Toast
author: Jaxon M.

description: There was a long waiting list so we sat at the bar. We didn't know what to expect because we only came for drinks. Our server had asked us what we were in the mood for so he recommended us a few from the menu. My friends finished it even before I got all chance to take a picture of it. Everything was fresh and delicious! What made our experience so great was that our server was very witty and attentive. The place is a fancy breakfast joint with pretty cool decor. Food was well presented and tasted even better than it looked. We'll definitely be back!
author: Hoa V.

description:
Y'all, this is the place to get your brunch on in SF. I can't tell you how long it's been since I've had a perfect stack of pancakes until Park Tavern came into my life. We had a friend in town and wanted to go somewhere nice. This place is marked $$$ but honestly the prices for brunch are more $$, every meal option was pretty reasonable given the amount of food you get. 

I ordered a John Daly (tea-infused vodka with lemonade) to drink, very refreshing during this heatwave rocking SF right now. We also ordered two plates of their Challah toast that's covered in cinnamon and sugar. So freshly baked and sweet, I probably could have just eaten more of that if they let me. 

Everyone loved their meal, I can't wait to go back. And it's in North Beach which is such a great neighborhood to wander around in after to work off your meal. Definitely a must for brunch, and their service was amazing!
author: Kristen T.

description: Look up the word Stammtisch in the dictionary, that's Park Tavern for much of the North Beach area. It is one of the best restaurants in North Beach. Located on Washington Square in the old Moose's location, Park Tavern is where locals come to talk politicals, socialize, and enjoy great food. Don't miss the deviled eggs and Brussel sprout chips. The renown Marlowe Burger is served here. If you have never had one, do. The staff is excellent from host to bartender to server. The decor is contemporary and well done.
author: Greg G.

description: The menu was great, a lot of interesting twists on brunch but not too pricey. I had the baked eggs and oatmeal pancake, and both were delicious. Our table also had mimosas. The staff was very kind and the ambiance was wonderful.
author: Tamar K.

description:
A long awaited lunch was due and I had a few requirements for making today's lunch plans:
1) Option to make reservations
2) New place I haven't tried
3) A park nearby
I arrived fashionably early, as usual, and was seated immediately.  While I sipped on my water, waiting, the server was very attentive and checked on me a few times.  Feeling self-conscious that I had been stood up, I hesitated to order a Bellini and something to eat but my company finally arrived.

Shrimp & Grits - Grits were superb.  Shrimps were nice and big and perfectly cooked but it was a bit salty
Corned Beef Hash- The corned beef wasn't too salty, surprisingly in a good way, more potatoes would've been nice.

I love the location of this restaurant as there are lots of bakeries and good food in the surrounding area and a small park right across the street to take selfies, catch pokemon, or chit chat.  Great service.
author: Linda N.

description:
This is an excellent spot for brunch.

I went with a girlfriend last weekend to celebrate both of our birthdays that were a month ago. Parking is pretty challenging there so I opted to valet for $12. Expensive but I rarely do that, I didn't want to be late, and I had already circled the vicinity a few times.

The menu was fantastic: Classics but with a California twist. We started off with fresh berries and whipped coconut cream and coconut flakes. The dish had big, fresh berries and a hearty amount of them! She got a kale, cheese, and egg baked dish and I got polenta cakes with poached eggs. The coffee was delicious.

The service: Really good. Even though it was packed, the waiter stopped by frequently and was very nice and attentive.

We sat inside by the window but you can sit outside. It was a great experience we both enjoyed and I will definitely go back and recommend this to others.
author: Karen M.

description:
This was my second time here for dinner. We ordered the deviled eggs, brussels sprout chips, beet salad, demons on horseback, the chicken, the sea bass, the tuna, and the pork belly. Our faves were the deviled eggs, the brussels sprout chips, the tuna, and the pork belly. Fave overall was the pork belly.

For dessert, we had the cheesecake and bread pudding. Both were awesome. You won't go wrong with either.

The service was also impeccable. You can always rely on Park Tavern for that.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I went here with my girlfriends for brunch and absolutely loved it. I'm glad I booked a reservation in advance since the wait time was an 1.5 hours when we got there. We started with their Huckleberry Fritters which tasted like deep fried muffins with a sides of cream and huckleberry sauce. Definitely share since they're really filling. I ordered the Shrimp & Grits which was amazing, but maybe a touch too salty. It had large prawns mixed with smokey bacon over creamy grits.  

The decor and ambiance made Park Tavern a great place for a classy brunch!
author: Natalie R.

description:
You know what I love? Brunch places where you can make a reservation not that far in advance. Yes! Park Tavern is one of the rare options.

I met up with a new friend for brunch and after much deliberation and discussion with the server, I ordered the Salmon Benedict. Somehow, the order got mixed up and Pan-Fried Corned Beef Hash came out. We were a bit confused but it looked rather tasty so I accepted the plate and dug in.

When the server realized the error, he offered to get me a drink on the house. These days, I try not to drink too much more than I have to so I passed on the offer. It was a happy mistake; I really enjoyed the dish. It's hard for me to imagine that my original selection would've tasted better.

It was a great way to start my Sunday and I was getting ready to pay when the server insisted on removing the cost of the Corned Beef Hash from the bill. That was excellent service and of course we made sure that he received a good tip.

I can't wait to go back and have that dish again (and I will gladly pay for it).
author: Yi Z.

description: After looking around the city for a place to host our engagement party, we choose them beacuse of their beautiful private room "The Eden room". Best decision ever! I loved loved loved this place! The decoration, the food, the service...We really had a great time! I will truly recommend to anyone having a private event you won't regret it! We will definitely come back, but for a casual dinner next time.
author: Ethel A.

description:
I cannot thank the people of Park Tavern enough. This was the second stop on a proposal scavenger hunt. I made a reservation to arrive 15 min before the guest of honor. As I was seated, the brought sparking wine. So sweet. 

Then I got word the first stop was at least an hour late. I told them I was sorry. Offered to pay for the wine and gave up the table. They said, don't be silly. Today isn't crazy. Sit. Relax. Enjoy. 

And, they meant it. Everyone was so nice, despite me holding a brunch two-top for like 2 hours. It assuaged my internal guilt so much how nice they all were. The waiter didn't look aside even once while I sat sipping water and coffee. 

Thanks Park Tavern for being a part of her special day and one of the early dates leading here. But more than that, thanks for just being so kind and generous to your customers. I already come here a bunch, but this just cements my love for you.
author: Shannon N.

description:
It took me a while to write this review on Park Tavern, the sister restaurant to Marlowe and The Cavalier.  I came by for brunch one day and had their famous Marlowe Burger which was the first time I had ever it.  That brunch ended so quickly that I felt it wasn't right to write a review at the time.  So it wasn't until several months later that I came back with a bunch of friends for dinner.

First off for brunch here's their Marlowe Burger:

The Marlowe Burger --  http://bit.ly/1e2t9Rd
Caramelized onion, cheddar, bacon, horseradish aioli & fries
The famous burger delivered!  It's a good bun to meat ratio and the toppings work together really well.  It came with fries so that's always a good thing!  It's one of my favorite burgers in SF.

That was basically it for brunch.  When I came back for dinner with a few friends, this was when I got a true taste of what Park Tavern is all about.

PT Fries --  http://bit.ly/1x1RdLA
Truffle, Soft-cooked Egg, & Caviar 
This blew my mind!  There's something special going on when you dip the fries into the egg with caviar mixed in.  This should be a must order every time you come here!

Smoked Deviled Eggs -- http://bit.ly/WE1iDp
Bacon, Pickled Jalepeno, & Chive
These are probably my favorite Deviled Eggs ever.  Perfectly piped eggs with some bacon and of course the Jalapenos to give these eggs some heat.  This is another must order!

Poulet Vert --  http://bit.ly/1r8nZsQ
fines herbes, french fingerlings, thumbelina carrots, baby leeks & mustard jus
The Poulet Vert was impressive!  The presentation definitely turns heads.  The chicken was a bit smaller than it looked from the pics on yelp, but it was still good enough sized portion to satisfy me.  The chicken was perfectly roasted and the veggies and potatoes cooked in the chicken fat were pretty good as well.

Overall, that was a pretty impressive dinner set you should try when you first visit Park Tavern.

I visited them again one more time for dinner to celebrate my birthday.  And once again, they did not disappoint.  Although I loved everything I had the last dinner, I used this opportunity to try a bunch of different things, though we also ordered another round of the PT Fries and Smoked Deviled Eggs.

Braised Pork Cheeks --  http://bit.ly/1Hw9qpZ
farrotto verde, shaved celery & granny smith apple salad & apple cider vinaigrette

Demons On Horseback -- http://bit.ly/1x0lRsE
lardo-wrapped smoked prawns, remoulade & cucumber

Spaghetti Squash Carbonara --  http://bit.ly/1whNhoE
bacon, garlic, parmesan & cream

Seared Scallops --  http://bit.ly/1x0lTki
braised baby kale, peperonata, pine nuts, shichimi togarashi, finger lime & serrano ham

The one dish that surprised me the most was the Spaghetti Squash Carbonara.  It was my first time ever having Spaghetti Squash and it blew my mind how they managed to give it that pasta look and texture.  The Demons On Horseback and Scallops were pretty good too though they were very similar since both were served with some form of smoked pork.  And the Braised Pork Cheeks were very tender, flavorful, and was a great starter to share with the table.  Overall, my birthday dinner was just was delightful as the first dinner I had there.

I like the style of this restaurant.  It's big, spacious, and the decor is very classy but also has a casual vibe.  The open-airness of the restaurant is nice too when the weather is warm out.  The bar is very inviting as well.  I highly recommend Park Tavern if you want to have a big dinner party, yet it's also a very good place to have a date night.  I have yet to visit Marlowe, but if Park Tavern and The Cavalier are the descendants of it, then I have a lot to look forward to.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Start with the deviled eggs!
Next: Kale and brussel sprout chips
Don't forget the truffle fries.

A great addition to my favorite SF neighborhood.  [NB resident 1987 to 94]
Perfect combination of great food, ambiance, location and north beach mana.  
Breaking bread with friends gets no better than here.
Will be back.
author: Ted H.

description:
Brunch. On. Point! 

Ben and I booked an OpenTable reservation for Park Tavern about 2 weeks in advance, but it didn't seem necessary. Afternoon and last minute reservations were definitely available even up to a few days ahead of time.

Came here for brunch a few weeks ago and I couldn't have asked for a better day. There's valet parking in the front, but it wasn't necessary since it wasn't teaming with people for some strange reason.

We ordered (Yes, this was only for 2 people..and yes, we ate it all...):

1. Baked Farm Eggs - The pictures on yelp definitely won me over for this dish. I was a big fan, but it wasn't my favorite.

2. Smoked Deviled Eggs - the BEST bite of brunch..maybe it was because we were famished..or maybe it was because it was just that good. I'm going to go with the latter..

3. Crispy Polenta Cakes - Ben ordered this before and he really liked it, though he said this time it wasn't quite as good as he remembered. Iono about him, but I thought they were pretty effing good. Plus, you put truffle on ANYTHING and I'm already a fan. Between the Farm Eggs and Polenta Cakes -- I'd pick the polenta cakes!

4. French Toast - YUM! I was so stuffed by the time the French Toast arrived, yet I managed to eat my ENTIRE half of the order we shared. Was the best I've ever had? I think Olea would give them a run for their money..but it was definitely up there!

5. Avocado Toast - there is 1 piece of toast and GENEROUS slices of avocado on it - they were not shy at all. Probably not the best in value, but there sprinkle some kind of magic on the avocado toast here that I'm not sure I could ever replicate! Great to try at least once!

Overall, a great place for brunch..but not necessary a place you would come for bulk and value. Happy Brunching!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Had an awesome breakfast  with my family while visiting San Francisco for my daughters 30th birthday trip.  Service was excellent and attentive, food delicious.
author: GreenpointGirl D.

description:
Really happy with this find! Its owned by the same group that also owns Marlowe in SoMa (another great date night restaurant) and their menus are very similar so i would recommend trying both!

Everything food item on the menu looked great! I tried the burger, miso cod, steak tartar, entree steak and PT fries. PT fries are a must! The miso cod didnt do it for me as i was expecting a bit more of a buttery miso / salty taste and it seemed to taste a bit more like a curry. However, I am absolutely coming here again. Great atmosphere and decor- feels trendy and contemporary.
author: Isabelle P.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE! Park Tavern has THE BEST deviled eggs. Great area is the heart of North Beach near Washington Square. Pretty much anything on the menu item is great and the service is always on point. 

What I recommend: 
- smoked deviled eggs
- PT fries
- brussels sprout chips
- demons on horseback
- seared scallop 
- roasted alaskan halibut
author: Jenn L.

description: Great weekend brunch spot or happy hour hangout.  Their bar serves up solid standard drinks as well as elite cocktails that go that extra mile...for example, I had a Bloody Mary garnished with housemade beef jerky and pickled green bean (delish!).  The shrimp & grits is fab and another fave is the deviled eggs appetizer.  Overall, good service and quality fare and drinks.  There is outdoor patio seating for fun time people viewing (as the location is directly across from Washington Square Park).  Great example of what North Beach has to offer!
author: Mitzi A.

description:
We brunched so hard here! 
 Avocado Toast
 Deviled Eggs
 Brunch Cocktails 
     
Make Reservations tho
author: Mindy K.

description:
Came here in 2015 trying to hit up Mamas across the way but the line was waaaaay too long and we already made plans for the day to explore Muir Woods and do a Sunset Sail we found on Groupon and didn't have time to wait 2 hours to eat! There was a still a wait but the no line and it was only 20 min.

Pros: we were looking for brunch so the mimosas were a perfect addition, avocado toast was really delicious, and for my first time trying a duck egg this wasn't too terrible. The white part was a little plastic-like but the yolk was perfect and delicious. My fiancé really enjoyed the mangle burger and even let me have a bite too! The meat was cooked perfectly.

Cons: the wait, missing breakfast and having to order off the lunch menu rather than more brunch options.

Overall: the food was good, the service was great as well, always refilling our water and checking on is, they had a good crowd inside so they're definitely doing something right!
author: Brittany M.

description: Came back for brunch - the polenta cake benedict remains fantastic and one of the best egg dishes in the city. We enjoyed the pancakes as well, which were a bit on the eggy side but good none the less.
author: T K.

description:
Atmosphere:  Upscale rustic

Service:  mediocre to poor.  When I walked in, I stood in front of the hostess for a full 30 seconds while she stared down at her phone.  No server acknowledged me for several minutes after I sat, so the manager (Lindsey) took it upon herself to take care of me.  

After I finished my main course, a server finally buzzed by and asked if I was "alright." He was friendly enough, but made it seem as though I was interrupting his work, rather than making me feel like I was worthy of his time.  He didn't introduce himself, so i have no idea who he was.  Lindsey never property introduced herself, either...I described her to the server and he gave me her name.  
No one offered to refill my beverage the entire meal.  It seemed that he was trained to say nothing more than, "you alright?"

Now for the food:
I ordered the Savory Clams...a relatively light dish, quite labor intensive.  Arrived very quickly.  Slightly spicy & acidic.  Nice combination of flavors with fresh clams, Spanish chorizo, garlic, stewed tomatoes, and crostini.  

I also ordered the Brussel Sprout chips.  Two words to describe them:  greasy and lemony.

Considering the price and level of service, I would not recommend or return.
author: John D.

description:
This was the second time that we were visiting Park Tavern and once again we had a great time having wine and cheese platters there :) 

Love the ambiance and how there is almost double row of bar area. They have great selection on appetizers and wine. Always busy which is a good sign. I am  planning on going back to try the food sometimes.
author: Elly M.

description: This place is awesome!! Both the food and the service are incredible. The staff clearly understand that we have many restaurant choices in the area. I have stopped by for dinner 3 times in the last week, every time the service has not only been outstanding but just downright friendly. So, the food is crazy good and presented very well.  Start with the smoked deviled egg.  I can't overstate that.  I've also tried the Brussels sprouts chips (what a great idea, just the crispy outside leaves with a few interior sprout cores), the poblano peppers (Oh yeah, perfect amount of heat for me, could be too hot for some but also has chunks of chorizo!) and the heirloom tomatoes (can you say coconut creme?). Each of the three entrees I tried was excellent. Pork chop (medium rare for me, perfect!) Octopus was incredibly tender and the tuna I had tonight was seared with a beautiful rare center and paired perfectly with garden fresh pole beans and Yukon golds. Don't pass up this fantastic neighborhood spot.  Awesome!!
author: Dusty W.

description: THE SMOKED DEVILED EGGS. You have to try these, so so good. Huckleberry fritters were delicious, housemade chorizo with eggs and county style potatoes were a hit at our table. My favorite other than the smoked deviled eggs was the cast iron baked farm eggs with kale, shitakke mushrooms and gruyere- it was perfect.  I've had the Marlowe burger, it's served on a soft brioche bun with a horseradish sauce, It is a great option closer to the lunch hour. This place does it right for lunch and dinner but Brunch is a MUST if you've never been.
author: Leigh Anna G.

description: A staple location in SF....North Beach on Washington Square Park.  A bustling fun place to gather for a drink or dine on some delish dishes.  We have tried Marlowe in SOMa, a sister restaurant and we're looking forward to spending our anniversary dining at Park Tavern, having heard raves about the Poulit Rouge!  Dang....it did not disappoint.  What a dish.  The salads were filled with treats in each bite.  We had the Park Tavern Salad and the Chicory Salad....ample portions and wonderful to the taste buds.  My husband ordered the steak, which he found fair...but he dug into my Poulit and devoured half of it before I could stop him.  The GM was so sweet, he poured us two glass of champagne I. Honor of our anniversary, we were impressed.  Thank you Park Tavern for aiding us in making a great night.  We will be back.  BTW....the burger looked amazing!
author: Nancy M.

description: I don't usually do reviews and I've been going to a lot eateries in SF, but the pork chop was absolutely delicious. They did me a favor and switched out the spicy greens for brussel sprouts and it was out of this world. Highly recommend the burger too. This place is top notch. (P.s. this was from 2013. I still agree with my review!)
author: William K.

description: We stopped in for drinks before walking to dinner. It was pretty easy going and comfortable. Full but not crowded. Several people were sitting on the patio and that's a great view of the park. Drinks and service were good, nothing spectacular.
author: Susan H.

description:
Came here for brunch with a couple friends on Sunday. Luckily for us we were able to book a reservation on open table a couples days beforehand. 

As vegetarians we had the oatmeal pancakes and avocado toast. Oatmeal pancakes cake with butter and syrup already drizzled so if you're watching your sugar intake make sure to ask for it on the side. The avo toast was expensive ($10) for one thin slice of bread. Wish they gave a thicker slide of bread. 

The only reason I am not giving 5 starts is that there are barely any options if you are vegetarian but doable if you come in a group.
author: Chandni D.

description:
It was my first time here, so I wasn't sure what to expect. But I can honestly say that this is the BEST brunch spot in San Francisco! No joke! They accommodated our very large party of 15 (we were there to get ready for the Women's March SF), and they were so incredibly gracious, helpful, and kind even though we took up one entire part of the room and had some late arrivals. 

Now for the food: Every single brunch entree was sheer perfection, and our drinks were divine. I am still thinking about those cast iron farm eggs (mmmm). Boyfriend ordered the pancakes, and savored every bite.

And the staff, you ask? 
Our hostess was super attentive and incredibly helpful, and a huge shout out to Chef Jennifer Puccio - those deviled eggs were mouth watering (was she the woman who came out to greet our table? I wanted to say a personal thank you to her but did not get a chance).

I think I can speak for all of us in our group when I say that we will continue to make Park Tavern our brunch home for the rest of our SF lives. 

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!
author: Ann M.

description: This was an excellent place for brunch! The food was so good! We ordered 4 kinds of toast - avocado, 3 nut butter, challah, and fruit jelly and they were delicious. For our main course, we ordered the polenta with a poached egg and an arugula, mushroom salad with shaved parmesan! We definitely made a good decision by coming here! Make a reservation!
author: Joey M.

description:
Yum
Yum
Get in my tum!! Was looking for a place for dinner in North beach that wasn't Italian. This place is sooo good. Have the crispy Brussels sprouts and the pork belly apps. Soooo good. 
Then we had the giant roasted chicken ...it's not actually called this but it's so delicious and not to be missed. Also the black miso cod. 

Amen
author: Tanya S.

description: Great food and good times.   The fries are to die for as is the Octopus... can barely tell from outside the place is bustling and fun inside
author: Tj E.

description:
I made a reservation for Brunch four days prior. I wanted to choose a nice / fancy-ish place for my best friend's birthday and we have been eyeballing Park Tavern for a long time. 

First off, this place has a really nice and warm ambiance about it. The circular light fixtures with yellow bulbs, large sofa seating, large open windows, and exposed wooden structure is only part of the reason why I fell in love with the interior of this restaurant. Secondly, the service is on point. They are filling my water to the brim constantly as I am drinking it and our waiter was super funny and patient with us. (C'mon, we are three kids at a fancy-ish restaurant, you can only imagine).

So here we being with our "fancy-ish" meal:
1. Jam Jelly Baguette - The baguette was extremely crunchy and chewy. The variety of jams included: cranberry, blueberry, orange and butter. The orange one was my favorite. It was the first time I've had an orange jam where it wasn't too sour nor sweet, it was right in between and it was delicious.

2. Dungeonous Crab Toast - They packed a thick layer of crab on top of a lightly toasted white bread. The white bread was light and thin and crunchy on the outside, I actually didn't like how the crab overpowered the bread.

3. Farm Eggs - Nice presentation. Baked with 10% eggs on top of 90% spinach. Fair taste, not too salty but couldn't taste the eggs.

4. Smoked Salmon Benedict - Packed with a strong tasting salmon. Tasted like capers to me. The egg wasn't as runny as I had hoped. 

5. Cod Sandwich - Perfectly cooked. Seasoned marvelously. Smelled amazing.  Amazing potato chunks. Delicious. 

I would have to say that the food did not impress me. Everything somehow came out to be too salty or not salty enough. I felt like the food was way overpriced for what it is. But the service was amazing and the ambiance is beyond comfortable. Maybe the dinner option might have a better chance of winning me over.
author: Linda K.

description:
I really enjoyed my experience here...everything from the ambiance to the food and the service made for a fun and interesting brunch.  I had the following:

Polenta Cakes (with eggs)
Rubarb Fritters

Everything tasted great and I could really appreciate the quality ingredients.   I had friendly and attentive service and would definitely come back.

This place is very popular so arrive prepared with a reservation or a wait.
author: Ken G.

description:
5 stars all around for our dinner at Park Tavern. Although the restaurant is quite large, my wife and I were seated in a corner which felt more intimate than the size led on. We were celebrating my wife's birthday and the waiter made sure that her special night was memorable. The waiter started the night by bringing two glasses of some delicious champagne. Being that we always study menus prior to arriving, we knew exactly what we wanted when the waiter returned to take our order.

For appetizers, we ordered the the waygu beef jerky, and the PT fries. I don't normally eat beef jerky and probably wouldn't eat any gas station jerky but this beef jerky was delicious. Tender, chewy and salted just right, we couldn't help ourselves but finish every last piece. The PT fries were simply OUTRAGEOUS! OMG! Each bite was better than the last and I honestly wished we ordered 3 more orders of these fries. Park Tavern also supplies a basket of bread which we surprisingly didn't each too much of because we were obsessed over the fries and jerky. 

For dinner, I ordered the Poulet Noir. All I can say is that that chicken might have been some of the best chicken I have eaten in my entire life. It was life-changing. A whole roasted bird, slow cooked in truffle butter. Does it get much better than that?? I really don't think so. Plus, the chicken comes with this amazing stuffing that is covered in chicken au jus. My wife raved about her Sole, and the meal was just perfect. 

We had our heart set on ordering the cookie sandwich dessert but simply couldn't eat any more food. The waiter then surprised us with a birthday dessert of their lemon cake. Not the biggest lemon cake fan, but the dessert was good in its own right. I can't rave about Park Tavern enough. They went out of their way to make my wife's birthday extra special. 100% coming back here whenever we return to San Fran. The service and the food were impeccable! If you're thinking about where to go to dinner tonight, look no further! Come here!
author: Josh K.

description:
For a bar- restaurant I think this place is great !

The quality of the food was really good overall. I had some clams cooked in beer that were over seasoned. But the 7 other items I tried were all very good with out a doubt.

Service a good overall too. I don't remember anything extra ordinary 

I would certainly go back on a date, work dinner, happy hour or birthday! Good for all of the above
author: Kev M.

description:
Heard such great things about this place we were very excited to try. We got seated at the bar in a weird spot (right where the waiters come to pick up drinks) when there was hardly anyone at the bar... But it ended up being fine. Drinks were great, good wine selection. We started with the asparagus salad which was awesome! For dinner, we had the bar steak and the Demons on Horseback (bacon wrapped shrimp). Both were really good.

We had a bit of a mishap with some of our food (hence, my three stars... Won't explain because I don't want to hurt the restaurant) but the wait staff and restaurant manager handled it very well. Shout out to Brian for being an awesome bartender.
author: Julia M.

description: Bloody Mary Review - Park Tavern's PT Bloody Mary is a mouthwatering morning pick me up made with horseradish, Russian Standard vodka, a savory house bloody mary, and just a touch of beef broth. Served in a mason jar, this beauty comes topped with a tasty pickled green bean and a damn fine piece of house-made jerky. Why go? House-made jerky. | Price: $11
author: Shelley B.

description:
One of my new favorite spots in the city. I've been here twice so far and I already can't wait to go back! I believe that Park Tavern is run by the same people as Marlowe.

This place is pretty live and the decor is very nice. It's super dark in the restaurant which is only a downside for me since I have to keep flashing every time I take a picture of the delicious food...

First things first, GET THE PT FRIES. As I get older, I stop craving unhealthy foods now like chips, sodas, but especially fries. But these fries are so good, I don't even feel ashamed after I eat them. They come with a soft cooked egg topped with caviar and truffle sauce. I can't even put into words how this combination tastes. You just have to order it.

Both times I came here, my friend and I shared a Poulet Noir, which I believe is the best item on the menu. It's a whole roasted chicken topped off with this delicious thin brown sauce. The chicken is seasoned perfectly and the meat is just so tender. The menu changes here, so the first time we had it, there were beets and other mouth watering vegetables that came with it. The second time, we had this amazing root vegetable stuffing. Honestly, I can't even say which one was better because it's just so hard! This is a must order.

I've also tried the Pan Seared Red Snapper, which was excellent. It came with black and white risotto, which was interesting and it was what really made the dish good. The brussel sprouts are a good side dish to get also. I would skip the Beef Tartare and the Marlowe Burger, which I didn't find that great. We also tried the Pumpkin Bread Pudding, which was I enjoyed except I wish it came out hot fresh out the oven.

The service is top notch. We were served by the same server both times we came here, and she never kept us waiting. She was super friendly and attentive.
author: Derek T.

description: Amazing deviled eggs, baguette and avocado toast! I tried the burger because of the other Yelp reviews. But I've had way better elsewhere. The truffle fries were good though. Shrimp and grits were way too stay. Bubbly champagne was very light and smooth..have to be careful because it goes down really easily!! They gave me coconut cake since I was having brunch for my bachlorette party. And it was soooo delicious!! Creamy, thick and the coconut flakes were fluffy!! It wasn't to sweet, just how I like it. Friendly servers as well too!! Such a great place for finger foods. I hope to back when I visit again!
author: Michelle P.

description:
We ordered the farm fresh local vegetables which is $27. And the duck.   

Very disappointing vegetable dish, it is considered an entree, so definitely not worth it.   The farm fresh local vegetables was lumpy  pickled veggies.  There were one mushroom.   We were expecting farm fresh vegetables, and paying $27 was not worth it.

The duck was a bit fatty, though flavorful. Again pickled cauliflower, not my thing I guess.
author: Doris A.

description: Food is kinda good...staff sucks...seriously when dropping a G for dinner and bar tab the Bartenders shouldn't have an attitude....."can you tell the difference with grey goose"? Hey jackass, just make the drink!! I highly suggest a place with more friendly staff. I would come back but bar manager needs to get his shit together....leadership starts from the top.
author: Jeff V.

description:
We pounced on two spots at the communal table (you have to pay attention if you want a spot!). Ambiance was elevated without being stuffy or pretentious, though the average outfit was dressier than that of San Francisco. Service was incredibly friendly for a busy Saturday night -- I really enjoyed our waitress. 

Crispy pork belly with forbidden rice was out of this world. French fries went perfectly with the creamy horseradish sauce for the burger. Cocktails and wine were serviceable; they were nothing flashy, just really really solid. I'll come back!
author: Catherine J.

description:
I went to Park Tavern on New Years Day brunch and got there about half an hour early, to be greeted by a line of people already! They take reservations but we didn't get one in time and was hoping to be seated upon arrival. When the restaurant opened, the host was very efficient in getting the line in the door quickly, whether they had a reservation or not.

We choose to sit at the bar over the community table and had a great experience. Service was quick and everyone else around us also seemed to be happy with their food.

Food:
- Smoked Salmon Benedict:This was delicious! The horseradish sauce on it paired well with the smoked salmon and all the flavors worked excellently together. The only thing I'll say is, if you are famished, this might not be enough for you. It's nothing fancy; it's exactly what is on the menu, so I was satisfied.
- Chorizo & Eggs: I only had a bite of this, but if I was looking for a scramble, this is what I'd get next time. It was a generous serving and had great flavors as well; oftentimes, the egg is overpowered by everything else in the scramble, but this seemed well balanced.

Ambiance: 
- After ordering my food, I found myself looking around the restaurant for a few minutes. The environment (especially during the holiday season!) felt very warm and cozy. It wasn't too loud in the room either, even with many people around us.
- I would suggest sitting at the communal table or the bar for an intimate experience (the communal table made it easy to talk intimately across from one another), if you don't mind having people on both sides of you. There is also some side-by-side seating by the chefs, looking at the open kitchen. Otherwise, there are more formal tables in the larger room of the restaurant that looked good as well.

So far, this is my favorite of the Weinberg restaurants (I've been to Marlowe and the Cavalier). I definitely plan to come back here for many meals in the future!
author: Amanda W.

description:
They sat us promptly.  Friendly wait staff.  Good time, good food as always.
Beware of the corkage fee of $35.  We had drinks, glasses of wine and they still saw fit to charge $70 for corkage of two bottles I know were not on their wine list.
author: Jim S.

description: Love Park Tavern. Been here 5 times- lunch, brunch & 3 dinners. Food is consistently good & fresh. Today I had the Park Tavern salad, Brussels  sprouts chips & roasted veggie focaccia sandwich. I am now vegan, so I had the salad & sandwich without the cheese. Loved them all.
author: Al G.

description:
Service was great and pleasant. We had a reservation here for a Saturday evening and it was my first time here. 

The food was superb. My favorite was the poulet, shrimps, pt fries, and the Brussels sprouts. 

The fried cod balls we got was very salty that we did not finish the plate. The Pork chop was so-so because they could have done a little better on the seasoning. 

The atmosphere was great. Very low dim lights with black colored furniture. This was a nice ambience for dinner talk with the girls or family. 

We didn't try their wine or cocktails because we were all driving that day. 

The price range was not too bad. Within reasonable price for its item.
author: Jenny L.

description: Food is amazing, not *that* expensive for SF, and the portions are pretty reasonable! The polenta cakes are great, and the french toast is delicious :)
author: Frances W.

description:
Came here with a friend, as we were down the street for a anniversary party, and needed to get some grub before we headed home. This place looked intriguing, and it was packed, so we thought we would give it try. We did get a last minute seat at the bar, so that was a place. We ordered the brussels sprout hears for an appetizer, and the pot pie and manilla clams for dinner. The Brussel sprouts we mushy and weirdly tart. The pot pie was off somehow, like the whole thing tasted stale. The manilla clams were uneventful, lacking flavor. All a major fail. The service as good, thank goodness. But that was about it. Food for what we got was way, way overpriced. Major, epic fail. 

I think this place is so packed because it is modern, spacious, and in the heart of North Beach. If you want to socialize and drink, great place I guess. But don't bother eating food here. Save your money and go somewhere else.
author: Sonia A.

description:
If you come here for brunch and you like truffle oil, you must get the crispy polenta cakes. The polenta is incredibly savory, crispy and seasoned perfectly (as opposed to most polenta, which is typically served bland and mushy, at least in America). Each polenta cake is topped with a perfectly poached egg - clearly made in a sauce pan instead of an egg poaching machine, with that perfect runny consistency even though it's completely done cooking by the time it gets to you. The arugula and parmesan salad it comes with (excellent, real, shaved, parmesan mind you) was the perfect complement to the poached eggs and polenta. 

This is literally the perfect breakfast. It cannot be made any better. On my death bed, I would like a bottomless feed bag full of this exact dish surgically attached to my mouth hole, so I can eat this exact meal to death. My recommendation to you: put this meal into your face immediately. You can thank me and/or the chef later.
author: Mark S.

description:
My friends and I had a lot of time to kill waiting for our table at Tony's pizza so we decided to grab some happy hour drinks here. The decor and ambiance are great--very upscale casual. We sat ourselves at a long table in the bar area and settled down with some drinks. I just had a beer (forget what I had but I think the name had the word "monky" in it) but some of the others tried their cocktails and declared them to be well-made and delicious. I wouldn't mind coming back the next time I'm in the area! 

STEPH JUDGEMENT: Nice classy place to grab drinks in the area.
author: Steph H.

description: Oh my do NOT waste you time here (at least for brunch). The decor is very nice, by that's the end of the positives. We went for brunch and the service has horrendous, but more importantly the food was just plain bad. I did enjoy the challah cinnamon sugar toast, but the baked egg dish, avocado toast, and the trout toast were all incredibly bland. I would strongly NOT recommend this place.
author: Sara P.

description: Great night, very vibrant scene.  I had the pork chop medium rare. It was amazing and the polenta cakes were really nice. Sis in law had the beef tips, we shared and they were tasty. Service was fantastic.
author: David H.

description:
Looking for a bougie and pricey brunch spot where you don't need to wait? This is it! We got to Park Tavern around prime brunch time and the communal table had tons of seats available. 

We ordered the berries and cream, grapefruit brulee, and avocado toast to share. I got the salmon eggs benedict for my main dish. Usually restaurants give two eggs with two slices of english muffin. But at Park Tavern, it was half the size I expected.
