So far, I would tell anyone considering this place to keep walking a little further to Mama's at Stockton and Filbert. There may be a line, but it's definitely one of the best brunches you'll get in in San Francisco.
author: Brodie J.

description: My fiancée and I planned a New Years Eve breakfast in North beach and a stop into Saints Peter & Paul church as a start to our New Years' weekend.  The line at Mama's restaurant was prohibitive so we crossed the street to the Park Tavern. The brunch menu is original and inviting, and the food lived up to our every expectation.  The atmosphere was charming.  The service was impressive and personal. So what makes me take the time to share this experience with you?  Unfortunately, the manager was the most indifferent, cold and rude person I've ever met in the position of restaurant service.  THE RESTAURANT WAS LIKE AN ICEBOX!  Every girl at my surrounding tables was wearing a ski jacket and some with hats and scarves! I asked the waiter if we could possibly have some more heat.  I'm sure he passed on the request, but was unable to accommodate us.  When I had the opportunity to speak to the manager,and told him that his decision to FREEZE his customers when they are paying $19.00 for eggs was extremely short sighted. His response was a totally indifferent, "the heat's been on since I came in." Now that may be true, but the front door was left open the entire time we were there. I'm sure something could have been done, and if not at least a manager deserves an explanation to a patron ( I'm sure I was not the only one) who's eating her meal bundled up in a ski jacket as to why the warmest place in the restaurant is the bathroom!!  His response and attitude was SO un North Beach, an area known and loved by locals and tourists for its beauty and charm!  If he's so unhappy with his job, caring for his patrons, please do us all a favor and quit.  This otherwise wonderful restaurant deserves much better!
author: C W.

description: Always a neighborhood favorite! Their cocktails are phenomenal, and the food never disappoints. My husband had the chicken and we were fighting over half o it! I had gnocchi and the twice baked potato, nothing was greasy and the flavors were great. If you are looking for a nice dinner that won't necessarily break the bank this is it!
author: Amber M.

description: Park Tavern is great. I went here with a group of 6 for a business dinner the other night and we had a great time. The food is fantastic, the service was on point and we all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We started with the deviled eggs, the brussel sprout chips, the burrata and pepper tart and the sunchokes. All were very good. I had the pork chop as my entree. It was very good as well. My only minor complaint there is that it was a little fatty. I would have liked a slightly leaner piece of meat. It was cooked very well though. We order one of each of the sides (twice cooked potato, brussel sprouts, spinach, broccolini and french fries). I could not stop eating the french fries. They were SO good. Extra crispy but still moist on the inside. Delicious! For dessert we had the smore and the birthday cake. The birthday cake was cute because they brought it out with a candle in it. The smore was good, but not the best I've ever had. This was a business dinner, so I didn't have to pay for it personally, but I can imagine it would get pricey for a date night. I think it's definitely worth the splurge every once in a while though. I would definitely come back.
author: Kerry K.

description:
Yum. Everything we ate (Brussels sprout chips, Grilled pork chop, Twice baked potato, and Apple/Fig Crisp) was delicious. The decor and presentation are all very well thought out.

We had no reservations and were sat at the bar. The bar staff were extremely attentive. Every few minutes someone was either checking in or filling something.
author: Rob H.

description: We came to Park Tavern upon the recommendation of San Francisco's most famous hotelier. He warned us that it was loud inside, and it certainly was. But the food and service were the epitome of what any restaurant serving innovative American cuisine should strive for. We went for the amazing broccoli chips, the deviled eggs and truffle fries to start. All were great. The grilled pork chop was fantastic. Next time we're in town, I'll be back. This place is a winner. You won't go wrong here.
author: Mark B.

description:
Our waiter took 30 minutes before he came back to take our order.  The deviled eggs were so-so. The chicken was super veiny and had little flavor. The foie gras was good, and so was the bread. 

Probably wouldn't come back to dine. Plus, a guy inside had his dog in the booth next to us. That was a first. 

Overrated.
author: Kyle W.

description:
Pros:
Creative dishes
Delicious
Healthy Options
Excellent service (friendly and fast)


Cons:
Bring a large wallet

+1 for chef creativity. There are lots of delicious new dishes that you absolutely have to try. 

Brussel sprout chips?!?! aaaaamazing!, who makes chips out of brussel sprouts

Lemon chips, burrata, & Shelley's fennel - This could turn a caveman into a vegetarian. Soft fennel on a crispy lemon chip with a creamy sauce to top it all off.

Steamed muscles we're good.... I dig I guess
author: Leo P.

description:
So few are the times I go to a restaurant I have never heard of, have no expectations for and are completely blown away! Park tavern did just that. Before the service even started I immediately felt at home in the warm ambiance of this large, yet intimate dining area. I wish I remember our servers name but suffice to say she was impeccable. Extremely friendly and when we had some questions on wine she gladly sent over the sommelier who was great as well. We tried the deviled eggs, duck pate, twice baked potato, burrata and tomatoes, and the steak. All the food was prepared very well. I loved the twice baked potatoes! The combinations were very inventive and I was impressed when each order came out. Another thanks to our waitress who was very conscious to stagger when our orders came out providing a perfectly seamless dining experience.  
      Never did I think that a dish lacked a certain "somthin".  Do yourself a favor and take your next date night to park tavern!
author: Mark N.

description: Celebrating  New Year's Eve Eve! A friend had recommended this place as having some of the best food in SF right now, so we popped in shortly after they opened at 5 pm. Sitting at the bar, we were served right away by Mark. He was engaging and attentive, offering good tips and wine tastes. The bar filled in quickly as did the restaurant. We ordered the burgers and simple salad, both excellent. We will definitely be back--either early as we did that night or with a reservation--this place is happening and prepare to wait if you do neither.
author: M F.

description:
I'm not sure what has taken me so long to write a review for Park Tavern, but I can easily say that it is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco along with Gamine which is located in Cow Hollow. I love both of them for very different reasons. 

I've been here for both brunch and dinner several times (both amazing), so bear with me while I walk through the menu.

Beer and cocktails- My boyfriend and I love craft beer, and if you have read any of my other reviews, you'd know that I love Sudwerk out of Davis, CA. The Sudwerk Pilsner is on draft and is also featured in the Michelada at Brunch. Holy Moly does the Michelada leave a fiery sensation in your mouth, but the combination of the pickled jalepeno and the beer make it an amazing combination. The other three cocktails i've had are the Kentucky Mule, Dirty Martini, and the Country Lawyer. All I can say, is that the bartenders are fantastic and poor some amazing drinks.

BRUNCH: Boyfriend and I usually like to order several things when we go out to eat, so I'll give a tidbit of our favorites.  I'm not an egg person, so I'll give his opinion second hand.

Avocado Toast: SO good. I've tried to recreate this at home several times. The combo of the avocado, chili, and lemon is nothing short of amazing.

Grapefruit Brulee: Carmelizing the grapefruit definitely cuts the tartness of the fruit, and the sugary goodness just melts in your mouth.

Pan Fried Corn Beef Hash: BF loved the poached egg, and I mean, you really cant go wrong with corn beef hash. 

Banana Coconut Fritters: delicious, but they are a bit on the heavier side, so be aware of that when ordering a lot of food.

DINNNER: If you only get to make it here once, here is what I'd recommend trying.

Brussel Sprout chips: These are flash friend brussel sprout leaves? that are tossed in lemon and salt. I'm almost positive that every time I've been to Park Tavern, we've had to order more of these chips. They have them at Marlowe (their sister restaurant) as well. SO good.

The "Bar" Steak: It's the perfect amount of steak and salad without feeling like I overate and leaving me with enough room for dessert. (I opt for the salad over fries because I like to pretend that I am healthy.) 

"Poulet Noir"- This is hands down the best item in my opinion on the menu. For a first timer, order the baby hen intact. It comes sitting up and literally falls off the bone and has an amazing truffle taste. DISCLAIMER:it IS a little annoying dismantling the chicken, but we later learned to order it already chopped up. It just looks so pretty when it is still intact. 

I've never had the lamb or porkchop, but i've heard they are both amazing as well. 

Long story short, food and drinks are awesome, atmosphere is great, servers were great---Park Tavern= great.
author: Mona A.

description: Really really good service and I love the unique menu options! We came for brunch and had the kiwi/orange/berry fruit plate, cast iron baked spinach and poached egg, blueberry French toast and a Bloody Mary. Everything was very good, I especially enjoyed the Bloody Mary and the fruit plate--it came with a shot glass of juice that we poured over the fruit and it was so good. The French toast was very very sweet and the cast iron bake was good, but pretty simple and had a lot of spinach. I look forward to going back and trying their twist on toast as well as other options on the menu.
author: MissM R.

description: Really enjoyed the avocado toast and the pancakes. Great location across from the park. Ideal brunch spot.
author: Emily H.

description:
Second impression:  Great atmosphere, great crowd, good drinks, but food pretty bad.

I soooo want this to be my go-to nice place in the neighborhood, and maybe we ordered wrong but almost everything we ate was over-seasoned.  And we love salt/spice!!   Positives:  deviled eggs were great, as was my "Old Cuban" run drink.  But then..... sole was a paltry cut and indistinguishable in taste from the artichokes,etc. on the plate.  Spinach side dish was garlicky to the extreme; basically inedible.  Fries over-truffled and the egg that accompanied it would have been salty enough with the caviar, so why did they crack sea salt on it too?  Brussel sprouts side dish was drowning in butter.  Left a lot of food on our plates even though we weren't particularly full.

Service was fine, and I do love the atmosphere, so I'll try it one more time and try to find a favorite dish so I can enjoy the positives of Park Tavern and ALSO enjoy my meal.
author: Anne M.

description:
I love going bar hopping to the little dives in North Beach, but when I'm in the mood to have an upscale, grown-up experience this is the place I come. It reminds me of the bistros I used to frequent in downtown Manhattan - great food, sophisticated decor, attentive service, dim lighting. Frankly, it's civilized and so is the crowd. I wish I could say that about more places in San Francisco, but there you have it.

The bar area is a favorite of mine - it's got plenty of seats as well as some additional communal tables if you just want to pop in and grab a snack and a drink with a few friends. The brussel sprout chips are to-die for along with the rest of the appetizers.
author: Britt M.

description:
Came here for a big birthday celebration and was not disappointed. The restaurant had a great vibe, great food, and great service, so its my new favorite at the moment. I can still remember the fun times I had when this was the old Moose's back in the day, but that electric energy of the crowd still exists at the present day Park Tavern. 

Our group tried pretty much every starter on the menu plus the special Spicy Steak Tartare! The highlights were the fried brussels, steak tartare, hamachi crudo, demons on horseback, deviled eggs, and fried oyster cesar - all outstanding.  

For our mains the standouts were the pork chop, ahi tuna, and burger. The only item that was really below par was the lobster and crab bisque. It was so salty it verged on bitter and this is coming from a gal who likes her sodium. After a taste I thought my hands were going to swell up to the size of baseball mitts! 
As for everything else - they had a very comprehensive wine list and a few cool beers, like the red rice Japanese ale. The service was on point and very efficient. 

The evening capper of the Birthday cake was excellent. What better way to celebrate than having the restaurant offer cake?!? Love it and can't wait to come back!
author: Stacy T.

description:
We love Marlowe so were really excited to hear that Park Tavern was opening in North Beach!  We went on Friday night and really enjoyed the experience there.  

Favorites:  Fried green tomato appetizer, mussels entree, polenta with nectarines cooked in a personal cast iron skillet drizzled with balsamic vinegar (sounds a little strange but it was WONDERFUL...I couldn't get enough of this!).

I like the fact that there are so many appetizer and small plate options to share.  They have a limited number of entrees but a good variety.  The service was great and they are very in tune with customer feedback.  We look forward to going back!

Oh - and they valet  - which is critical since it's ridiculously hard to find parking in North Beach otherwise.
author: Elaine P.

description: AWESOME.  Really great brunch, great service, great atmosphere.  Everyone down to the runners take pride in their jobs and you can tell.  It is top notch.  Well done!
author: Mister G.

description: I grabbed a quick dinner here with a friend before we had a meeting and was very pleased.  Everything from service to ambiance was great (a little on the loud side bit not too bad).  We only got entrees and I had the sea bass which was cooked to perfection--sauce was delectable.  I can see this being a great place for a date or drinks with friends--will definitely be back.
author: Tanichka B.

description:
Park Tavern is simply the kind of inviting restaurant that you just want to spend time in.  There are a lot of lengthy reviews so I'm just going to give my 2 cents:
-Sat outside and being right next to the park there is a lot going on and fun things to watch.
-The Dungeness crab & lobster bisque. Just get it and thank me later.
-Great customer service, handled a valet issue very well and they get that extra 5th star as a result.  I don't care if the food is great--when the service is bad, that's a no go.  Thanks Park Tavern for being very diplomatic & accommodating!
Going back at the end of the month and cannot WAIT.
author: Lola C.

description:
Great take on a spot that was always so busy.  The new food and the folks running this new up and comer, got it going on.  
Fried pork belly was phenomenal.  Fried Caesar oysters were also phenomenal.  Raw meat with capers and Hawaiin pink salt was THE best carpaccio style dish my palate has ever had.  I had more but let me not bore you with my yelping, just go and be adventurous!
author: D B.

description: The service staff was pretty decent. The food was terrible. Some of it was removed from the check, which goes back to the service being decent. The PT fries were so salty they were inedible. I could taste the salt on my lips for over an hour afterward. The soup, by contrast, had almost no flavor at all. It obviously wasn't tasted after production. I was disappointed, to say the least.
author: Catherine R.

description:
Love!  Love!  Love!

A bit of a similar feel but soooo much better food (and pricepoint!) than 25 Lusk.   Great place to hang at the bar and eat at the bar community table.   Also, a dining are, but that wouldn't be my "go to" at this locale.

Food was off the hook.  Fried brussell sprout chips (not healthy, but super tasty).  amazing burrata cheese on some crispy crunchy fried lemon rinds with basil, good mussels, and the best part of the meal?  Heirloom carrots....for real!  Ridiculous combination of pickled, heirloom carrots, some pesto and pine nuts.  Seriously, the carrots were over the top.

Staff?  Super helpful, friendly, yet professional.  Great suggestions.  Great service, even at the community table in the bar.

My new go to.  GFs.  Couples.  Date Search.  Awesome food and drink.  Please do well and STAY PT!
author: Elle S.

description: Pt fries- uh mazing. loved the truffle fries and the egg and cavies dipping 5/5. Pork chop- best I've had. Better than nopas and  portion was huge. Duck - fancy, well made. 4/5 Marlowe burger- great truffle flavor and juicy meat. Bun was a little soggy 4/5. Brussels chips- nicely fried and tasteful 4/5. Deviled eggs- absolutely gourmet. Loved the oil infused egg with the bacon topping. Best I've had 5/5. Chocolate brûlée - delish. Nom nom. Not too sweet. Just right. 4/5
author: Carrie T.

description:
Very innovative take on domestic cuisine. 
Service was excellent.
Food was very good, though the black cod tasted fishy.
The halibut was awesome.
Will try again in hopes to raise rating.
author: M E.

description:
Easily made reservations for an early Sunday evening dinner. Ambiance and decor were great- but it was almost too dark for me to read the menu, and that's not usually a problem. Also, having an open kitchen onto the dining room is fun, but we left smelling strongly of fried food- clothes went straight into the laundry basket.

Reviewing as a vegetarian in a meat-centric restaurant so our menu choices were limited to begin with. We ordered the County Line salad with avocado crostini- greens (only greens) were lovely, as we expect from one of our favorite farms. The fava bean hummus was not great- I'm a fan of fava beans, but in this puree they were a bit too earthy tasting. 

Our 'second course': the twice baked potatoes came out bubbling in a mini cast iron pan and were good and very cheesy (probably too much cheese for my dining companion but I enjoyed it). Also had the smoked  Brussels sprouts hearts and kabocha squash- really  looking forward to this one as I was hoping it would be the most hearty dish we ordered, but it was so overwhelmingly salty and fake-smoky tasting that I actually sent it back. Our very kind and efficient server offered to replace it, but we weren't all that hungry at this point and declined.

So not the best food, but an enjoyable atmosphere and great service. I would return to try some of the yummy sounding cocktails and maybe get a cheese plate or something. I imagine for carnivores the menu may be more tempting- I would love to see at least one vegetarian entree done well. Our server did recommend brunch for more vegetarian choices so I'd try them then as well.
author: jean k.

description:
Hue L., our NYF, and I (and a special guest) had our "monthly" dinner here last night.  We had 8pm reservations on a Friday night.  Our NYF and I were about 15-20 minutes late, but Hue L. (and his special guest) were already there ensuring our table wouldn't be given away (and enjoying drinks while they waited).

Since we were late, and we weren't sure what the parking situation was in the area, we decided to valet the car.  $11, in case you wanted to know.

We were seated and sat around for a while before our waiter came and got our orders for appetizers (and drinks for me and our NYF).  

Drinks: I got the McLaren (Hendrick's gin, cucumber juice, lemon, ginger beer), which I actually liked - even though I am most definitely not a ginger fan.  It was light, cucumber-y, and tasty.

Appetizers: We all split the brussel sprout chips because almost every review on Yelp has raved about them.  I'm not the biggest fan of brussel sprouts, but these were actually quite tasty.  We all also each got a Deviled Egg (one without bacon for our vegetarian special guest). I think the bacon definitely added to the flavor though.  The bacon and the extra little kick from the jalapeno.  Yum!

Entree:  Hue L. ordered the scallops (caramelized sea scallops, roasted cauliflower, braised baby fennel & grapefruit).  Our NYF had the tuna (Hawaiian tombo tuna, crispy sunchokes, white anchovies, baby artichokes & salsa rustica).  Our vegetarian special guest had the soup (caramelized onion & wild mushroom soup, slow-cooked swiss chard & poached egg) and polenta (Anson Mills polenta, Seville orange & red cabbage relish).  I had the pork chops (Italian butter bean pistou, dinosaur kale, toasted garlic & chili flakes).  The biggest plate went to the smallest person (that's me).  It was huge.  I didn't expect two pieces of pork.  I managed to *almost* finish my dish.  Yay me!

Desserts: Our NYF and I shared January's Birthday cake (Chad's Jamaican rum cake) and Hue L. and his special guest shared the tcho chocolate crème brûlée.  The birthday cake actually comes with a long, skinny candle.  How festive!  And, hey, my birthday's coming up!  But, the cake was really good.  Moist, slight rum taste.  I'm not a big cake fan, but it was really, really good.

Total for four people w/ drinks ~$180 pre-tip.

Final Note:  The food was good, but not great for the price.  Also, it's WAY too loud in there.  The tiling is not conducive in muting the noise.  And yes, the smell of pot wafts in every now and then when people open/close the door.  Blech.
author: Kris L.

description: Had dinner with a girlfriend here, and I think it was pretty below average for the price and high reviews posted here. It was on a weekend night, so they were really busy and service was not stellar. We waited about 45 minutes, but that was okay considering we did not have reservations. I had the pork chop and she had the steak. Both of entrees were just okay. My chop was a little too undercooked and didn't have much of seasoning or sauce. It was a little too charred too. We also had the brussels sprout chips, which was a tad too oily for me.  It was an unique appetizer, but I wouldn't order it again. We had another appetizer too, but I can't remember what it was.  So evidently, it wasn't too memorable. The best part of my dinner was the two glasses of wine, but I would of enjoyed the wine a little more if my entree came a little sooner.
author: Lilian T.

description:
Make sure to make reservations! This place was crackin as late as 10pm on a sat night!

Service was fantastic and the ambience was delightful. Very lively, crowded and drinks flowin everywhere! 

Food was fantastic as well. To start the bread was warm and the butter was room temp! Major points in my book! For my meal I got the deviled eggs and the smoked buratta, fig and prosciutto salad. Both are highly recommended!  My bf got the Marlowe Burger which was cooked to perfection and the flavors were so well balanced with the caramelized onions and the crispy bacon!  We split the twice baked potatoes which were to die! 

We went here for date night but it would also be fun for a small get together!  Pretty reasonably priced as well! Will definitely come back here!!  Yummy!!
author: Kelly B.

description:
I wanted to write a review for a couple of reasons:  1) to warn all future possible Valentine's patrons that there is an $80 set menu for the big day, 2) because we had fantastic service, and 3) the food was delicious!

1) Menu:  We made the reservation months ago so we didn't know that there would be a pre fix menu.  It was only weird b/c I didn't find out until the night before.  Do not fret though!  The menu was great and delicious.  It was a 3 course meal and they had some additions on the side (i.e. their famous deviled eggs from the 7x7 Big Eat List.

2)  I have always shyed away from going out on Valentine's Day b/c I figured it would be overcrowded and hard to get taxis, etc.  I used to work at a restaurant, and on Vday it was a zoo.  This was not the case at Park Tavern.  They all worked effortlessly.  The food was quick and great (more below) and our service was awesome.  We sat outside because it was a gorgeous night and our waitress was awesome.  I wish I remembered her name so I could give her the kudoos she deserves but I don't remember.  But thank you waitress outside.  

3)  The only reason they didn't get 5 stars is because of the food.  Don't get me wrong it was great, but there was some over seasoning on our app and my boyfriends main meal (the steak) was just okay.  My chicken was fantastic.  The deviled eggs were awesome.  My tuna carpaccio was heavy handed with the salt (weird, right?).  

Alright that''s all I have.  I just wanted to make sure I warned future Vday patrons of the pre fix menu!  Enjoy.....
author: Laura B.

description: Great restaurant with great food and decor.  Reminds me of NYC.  Dinner was great, brunch was ok.
author: Kevin P.

description:
This is one of my very favorite restaurants in the city. It is the perfect trifecta of good food, great ambiance & excellent service.  I've never tried a dish I didn't like...the chicken (poulet noir), the Marlowe burger, the fish, pork or beef option...all good.  However, I always enjoy the side dishes and appetizers the most whether the deviled eggs, roasted vegetables, salad, or brussells sprout chips.  Oh, and the cocktails are pretty amazing too; I always get the Washington Square.

I've been here with my husband, with a group of girlfriends, and even with my children (all for dinner) and it's great each time.  A note about bringing kids here. It is not really a kid restaurant but we wanted a nice restaurant to celebrate our 7 yo daughter's birthday.  The staff was so nice to our children and the food was accessible enough that even our picky eating son found plenty of food to enjoy.

But what makes this restaurant stand apart is their service. We've always had friendly, attentive, knowledgable, professional staff who must have good management.  When things go wrong here, they take care of you right away.  Even if you do not complain or expect or even realize that something has gone wrong.  I write this review now, even though I haven't been to Park Tavern in months, because it still stands out to me.  Sometimes it takes getting bad service at another restaurant to realize how much you appreciate a restaurant with good service!  As an example, one time we ordered dessert and the homemade ice cream had not set.  Instead of just letting us know and asking us to order another dessert, they provided a complimentary dessert...this really wasn't necessary but of course, appreciated.  Another time we made a reservation and they had to cancel it.  Recently this happened at another restaurant and we just got an automatic email from OpenTable. At Park Tavern, they called and followed up with an offer to pay for dinner at another of their restaurants or provide us with a gift card for dinner at PT for another night.   I have NEVER even heard of such great service and then to be able to actually experience it, is really very amazing.
author: Courtney T.

description:
I knew Park Tavern sounded familiar- the lightbulb didn't go off until I saw "Marlowe burger" on the menu. Jennifer Puccio, executive chef, does both places, and I'll be damned if I forget how incredible that burger at Marlowe is.

I came here on a Sunday brunch around 1pm. Shockingly, there were reservations open and some of the tables were free as well. 

FOOD: Banana coconut fritters with a tart raspberry jam were incredible. Not greasy whatsoever, this confection (clearly not calorie-free) was the perfect beginning to a brunch. I ordered the Marlowe burger after much debate between going savory or sweet (there's a smattering of carb-winking items stuffed with sweetness on the menu). The burger is large and comes with fries. I suggest you order it medium, as the medium-well was almost too done. My dining partner ordered the eggs with spinach. Portions were large. 

ATMOSPHERE: The cavernous square shape allows booths to be placed within a square to the left of the bar and then free tables within that central square. It's very NYC restaurant. Decor is pulled straight out of the Restoration Hardware catalog-- many pieces I've seen in the showroom were in the dining room at Park Tavern. Y'all can't fool me! It's got a cosmopolitan yet French  countryside vibe- full of creams and dark chocolates. There IS outdoor seating, not much, but it's available. And because you're in North Beach, expect to see the shellacked faces and overpriced brows of Marina females, with heels and gloss, sitting not three feet from you. You get used to it if you're here long enough.

SERVICE: They're quick but I feel that three servers confuses the matter of tipping. 

PRICES: It's not super cheap. But you know this going in.
author: C. P.

description:
Wow. Hats off to the chef of this place AND the designer.  Not only is it a GORGEOUS space but the food is orgasmic.  

I've been here twice, first time was for a casual dinner in the bar.  The brussel sprouts made me want to join the Park Tavern church (if there was one) . They were DELICIOUS.  The place was packed! Good lookin crowd too

This morning I went for breakfast.  I had crispy polenta cakes with poached eggs, arugula and mushrooms.  WOW. No salt and pepper needed.  Every bite was amazing.  

I absolutely love this place.  Great service. Amazing food. Beautiful interior, down to the last detail (no skimping) AND the prices are totally reasonable.  

We have a winner!
author: Fresh M.

description:
Took my girlfriend here for her birthday, and we had a great time.  For starters, the service was amazing - super friendly and very helpful.  The waitress checked in a lot (but not in an annoying way) to make sure we were doing okay.  Also answered any all questions were had regarding anything on the menu.  

And of course, the food was delicious.  We started off with the deviled eggs and sprout chips, followed by the "Poulet Rouge" (like a cornish hen) and Black Cod.  For dessert we had the chocolate creme brulee.  

Atmosphere was dark/trendy and fairly loud - so if you're looking for a quiet place to sit there and chat, this is not the place.  But if you want a nice night out in the city with good food and service, Park Tavern is a perfect choice.
author: Doug I.

description:
Came in for a dinner a couple of nights ago and loved the set-up! Our seat faced the large windows and provided us w/a great view of Washington Square Park.

Cocktails and service were great!

For starters we had the:

Infamous deviled eggs - definitely lived up to the hype! Next time, we're just gong to order 20 of these alone!

Rabbit, duck and foie gras terrain - didn't pair well w/the mustard and pickles. The dish itself was very acidic and the flavors weren't well balanced. The terrain was a little too salty for my liking.

Oysters Caesar - way too fishy! While the concept is nice, I'd rather have fresh raw oysters w/o the grit, slime and fry.

For our entree we shared the game hen. It came in a cast iron skillet and was extremely tender! The sauteed spinach, potatoes and butter stock sauce were perfect compliments to the dish! 

The dishes ended up being 2/4 but I'd definitely come again.
author: Cheryl P.

description: First time visit. Got the corned beef hash. It was pretty good but it left me wanting more. The portion was quite small for what what you pay.
author: Evan L.

description:
I always have the good intention to "yelp" places but never really get around to it...Park Tavern is the first restaurant that has actually motivated me enough to take 5 minutes out of my day and write a review!

I LOVE this place!  Hippest, hottest restaurant in SF right now by far!  Not to mention the food and beverage selection is absolutely amazing- they stick to classics (with a twist) and are always adding new exciting dishes/drinks to the menu!  GREAT wine selection!  Priced well for fine dining in the city, too!  Service is excellent...not pretentious but still has a very VIP atmosphere- extremely accommodating!  Make a reservation if you don't want to wait (it's busy because they are doing something...or everything right)! 

They recently opened a lounge area upstairs that I have been dying to pay a visit also!

My faves: Deviled eggs are literally the best I've ever had (bacon and truffle oil...duh?!)!  Brussell sprout chips are a must!  Fries with caviar, need I say more?  At brunch...POLENTA CAKES- to die!  On a nice weekend, the outside sidewalk seating is awesome.

If you are local or visiting, it is a must try!!
author: Rachael M.

description:
Pretty surprised to see such positive reviews for this place. Went in for late dinner last night and was underwhelmed. With tip, we spent 90 bucks for two entrees, one appetizer, and one glass of wine, which I felt was steep.

The good first - service was friendly, and reasonably together for such a new place. It's beautiful in there - I loved being in Moose's, and they have lightened up the decor and made it even better. My friend ordered the mussels which were a very generous serving, and had a great flavor.

The bad - the watermelon/prosciutto appetizer that everyone is cooing about did not work for me - the flavors with the truffle and the lemon zest were too disjointed. I also was not crazy about the scallops (which, by the way, set us back 27 bucks). 

I will definitely go back to enjoy the decor with drinks, but (big) if I ate it would be some of the "safer" options (the Marlowe signatures like the burger and the brussels).
author: Sophie S.

description:
I love Marlowe and their new American comfort food. When they opened up their super-sized Park Tavern in Washington Square, I knew it was going to be awesome.  You can fit probably 10 Marlowes in the old Moose's space. My party scored a table on a Friday night at 9pm.  I really liked the dark wood decor and open kitchen.

The bar was packed and lively. They had a handful of interesting cocktails, so I started off with a Washington Square with hangar vodka. Later on I also had a Golden Gate, made with shochu. I forget what else they were mixed with, but both drinks were inventive and tasty. They're definitely going to bring in a lot of thirsty bar hoppers with their cocktail program.

We went all out with the appetizers and shared pork rinds, fried oysters, fried pork belly, beef jerky, and brussell sprout chips. All the fried stuff was amazing, especially the oysters. I'm not a fan of brussell sprouts, but I enjoyed the crispiness. We also shared a bunch of side dishes, including the polenta, potatoes, and peppers.

For my entree I had the lamb chops and merguez sausage. The lamb was medium rare and perfectly cooked for my taste. The sausage was a flavorful bonus, but I thought the greens with the dish were way too salty. I finished off the meal with an awesome Fernet ice cream shake. It sounds funky, but I recommend it if you like Fernet.

The service was excellent and cheerful. You can tell they were all excited with the opening. I look forward to visiting them again soon.
author: Jermaine R.

description: Avocado toast and farm egg spinach were simply delicious. cool atmosphere and friendly staff. Awesome brunch spot!
author: Anji S.

description:
Ever have a really great meal experience and SWEAR that you'd immediately write that Yelp review...yet it gets pushed off until tomorrow? I'm overdue on submitting other reviews, though this one couldn't wait. 

I'm sure you're wondering why 5 stars? Was the meal perfect, you ask? No...and stop looking for perfect, by the way. A wise person once said that perfect is the enemy of good, and last night's meal at Park Tavern was GOOD, heck, it was GREAT. 

As much as I wanted to dine here, I've been relatively passive about coming to this place, and it has everything to do with making time to get out my 'hood and do the North Beach thing. My passivity came in the form of lazy attempts at getting seated after having a few cocktails at Tony Niks, only to wander down to Park Tavern and ask for a table...on a Friday night. I know, I know, a man can dream right? I was often too hungry for the 45 minute wait and often settled for a slice of Golden Boy Pizza instead. The half-assed attempts continued, off-and-on, for a good TWO YEARS - whenever I was in the neighborhood, and through it all, the Park Tavern hosts ALWAYS had a good and funny nature about the absurdity of some dude waltzing into their joint on a Friday or Saturday night expecting a table for 3 or 4 without reservations, with a wait under 60 minutes. (OK, I never expected a wait under and hour, but the answer is always "no" unless you ask.) In a town with restaurants and foodies who sometimes take themselves too seriously, hats off to the Park Tavern hosts for always being professional, happy, and funny. 

Soooooo...I broke down and actually made a reservation. Me and my companion got a nice table, and man, I really loved the energy in this place! It was the right kind of "loud" where it was a good background buzz, yet we were able to carry on our conversation with straining our voices. Jeff, our waiter, was very attentive and knew the right times to check-in on us. Anyways, I highly recommend the Demons on Horseback (only a poet can describe this app) and Devil Eggs!! Patrick (one of the managers), hooked us up with the Twice Baked Potato, which is something else I encourage everyone to try. I confessed to Jeff and Patrick my 2 year journey and they used the Twice Baked Potato as their way of saying "welcome...and please come back". I shall come back, dear sirs!  My entree was the pork chop - cooked medium - served on a bed of "brussel hash" mixed with some sort of savory sausage. Very hard to disagree with all this pork goodness!! With a meal so good, I am going to sleep like a king tonight. Oh yeah, my lesson has been learned and I will actually PLAN to come back to Park Tavern and make reservations in advance. It was worth the 2 year wait. Thank you!!
author: A.D. A.

description:
The location is wonderful, we sat outside on a rare warm night in SF. As the hostess sat us down and gave us our menus I realized it was really hard to read the menu...oh bc the lights weren't on. After about 15 mins, no one had come out to take our drink order or turn the lights on. So I went to ask about the lights, they went on, then after 10 mins, they went off again...this happened all night.
 
When we finally ordered, the appetizers came out fast and the waiter was polite but we never got the warm rolls everyone keeps raving about. The ikura and fish dip, mushroom soup, and arugula salad were decent, but nothing stood out. (much like Marlowe, their other restaurant, that we live 2 mins from)

We waited another 20 mins after we were done with our apps, and watched our waiter help other tables, and our main course still hadn't come out. There was no apology, no explanation, no acknowledgement that there was a very long wait between courses. 

The steak was was a little tough, not too flavorful, and just disappointing. I thought about giving them two stars but the apps were good and the ambiance is great, they could work on their service a bit as well.
author: rebecca c.

description:
The food here is so good!  There were so many interesting things on the menu and I had a hard time picking without ordering way too much food.  
Meal Recap: 
smoked deviled eggs: DELISH
cornmeal crusted oyster "caesar"  - interesting play on a ceasar salad, was very good
PT fries - this is where its at!!
summer squash/5 minute egg/burrata/prosciutto vinaigrette - pretty good
"poulet rouge" - It was good, its hard to ignore this dish because it looks amazing

Overall, I'm looking forward to going back.  The service was great and the drinks were well made.
author: Jay K.

description:
Wow is this a great place. The food, cocktails, decor and service are all top notch and I'm thrilled to have this fantastic addition to North Beach. 

As a North Beach local who knows much about the history of the place, I'm particularly impressed with the subtle yet classy nods Park Tavern gave to previous owners and restauranteur-legends Ed and Mary Etta Moose. A well placed photo of Ed next to the bar and namesake drinks on the menu. Even the nod to history is worthy of 5 stars. 

Bravo, and you can expect to see me on a bar stool there often!
author: Jonathan J.

description:
This appears to be the happenin' place in San Fran. Sadly, there are only twenty or so tables and most are squished very close together. Unsurprisingly, the bar was packed with yuppies and middle-aged business partners and their loud reverie carried into the main dining room. Bottom line: don't come here expecting a quiet, romantic dining experience. 

The menu is short and simple, as is the main kitchen with only about six chefs prepping, cooking, and dishing food. I had the pickled carrot appetizer and hanger steak entree. Both dishes were good, but not exceptional. Our server was fantastic and extremely knowledgable about every aspect of the menu and restaurant. Everyone seemed to be having a good time.
author: Ryan T.

description:
We showed up here on Tues nt, we no reservations w/ my buddy from NJ. Their friendly hostess said an hr wait for a table But we could sit at the 'chefs table' in the back if we didn't need a table. We said Yes and this began our dinning adventure. Our waitress helped suggest dishes and everything we had from their bread to their desert was simply amazing. The best part might of been their starters- brussel sprout chips were a first and good. The entree , Game Hen, baked for 1/2hr was the best ever , it had stuffing and sauce in the pan which was the best fowl dish i've ever had.
The service, staff, and cooks were all friendly/helpful even though this place was packed. My buddy from NJ said this was his best meal in SF he can recall .
Thanks to PT for a wonderful dinning experience. A
Also, they have Valet parking which was very helpul since its really hard to find a spot in north beach on any nt.
author: Stephen C.

description:
Mmmm! I loved Park Tavern! The decor is awesome, and the lemon chips and burrata were pretty incredible. I have a fear of frying things, but I will be putting my lemon tree to good use trying to overcome that fear and recreate this dish.

We also saw Willie Brown... I haven't seen his review on yelp, but it's probably coming...
author: C B.

description: I visited Park Tavern for brunch. They have an interesting menu, which delivered for us on taste.  The wait (almost none) made it far superior to Mama's just across the way.  Plan to go again...
author: Amy L.

description:
PARK TAVERN on Washington Square in North Beach is *phenomenal*. I treated 2 of my Real Estate home-buyer clients to dinner there last night & WOW! We sat at the bar & totally enjoyed their cocktails, the ambiance, the vibe, their service; their fun, smart & generous bartenders; and THE FOOD! 

Between the 3 of us, we probably tried about 6 different cocktails, which were all incredible (with fresh ingredients & all). Their wine list was awesome as well & they serve ACME bread to boot! 

We shared the following: Fried oysters w/lettuce wraps; prawns wrapped in lardo w/buttermilk & cucumbers; salmon appetizer w/beets (that was too dainty & the beets were over powering, IMHO! That's the only thing I would skip next time!); cornish game hen with spinach & the smoked deviled eggs. 

WOWZA! It was an epic meal. If you go there, ENJOY IT! It is a fine establishment :o)
author: Sara W.

description: Such a classic San Francisco restaurant and location. Seated promptly and service was excellent, not too pushy. Started with the brussel sprout chips and burrata, both of which will leave you wanting more. For an entree, I was deciding between the pork chop and sole but after heavy apps decided on the fish. I could not have been more pleased with the flavors and textures that this dish represented. Excellent food, ambiance and location make Park Tavern an experience you won't forget.
author: Jessie S.

description:
I was torn between three and four stars here. My concierge had arranged a reservation at a different restaurant, but my friend's husband was intrigued by the gnocchi here and asked if I could switched the reservation. The restaurant said they were booked for reservations (we were a party of four) until 9 p.m., but that we were welcome to come in and try to snag seats at the communal tables. 
   We were quoted a 45 minute wait time, which is standard for any decent restaurant at prime dinner time. They have a fantastic cocktail selection and very friendly bartenders. The wine list had a nice list of options as well. 
   After waiting for an hour, my friend asked the host how much longer it would be. She was told the reservations were running a little behind and it would be another 20 minutes. I understand it's hard to predict when tables will get up but it was getting ridiculous. After two hours, we were sat with no apology. While we certainly could have chosen to leave and go to another restaurant, it was ridiculous. 
   On to the food. The deviled eggs and gnocchi were well received at the table. Two people got the burger, one got the steak and I had the sole. The sole was very good, the steak got rave reviews, and the burger had lukewarm reactions. Desserts looked delicious. 
   All in all, the food was very enjoyable, but absolutely not worth a two hour wait. While I would eat here again, I would never try without a reservation or with a large group.
author: Ivana S.

description: I love to sit at the bar, just get there early. Cocktails are a little pricey but they are done well. I have had most items on the menu throughout the seasons. I have never been let down. The staff is always helpful and no matter who comes to your table they are pleasant and kind. From appetizers to entrees the portions are good size. The food is prepared to your liking and quite delicious. Great for all times of year.
author: Nickers S.

description:
I've been three times in a short period of time - it hasn't disappointed. I love this place for a few reasons:

1. The drinks are delish and the bartenders are top-notch. They are attentive, even with a bar packed with people. Wine selections are great and I like that they offer carafes for certain wines.

2. The way the menu is laid out. It makes it super easy to find something for exactly what you're craving.

3. The ambiance is great and it's excellent people watching. The overall crowd is skewed older (40+), but you get a nice smattering of young professionals as well. 

4. The food is so good and perfect for sharing. 

I've been twice with just one other person, and deviled eggs, brussel sprout chips, burratta and one entree were more than enough. With three people, we did the same, but added a side and we each had more than enough to eat. 

My picks: deviled eggs (cut it in half though, since the flavor is so powerful that you'll need two bites to savor the full flavor. Stuffing the whole thing in your mouth is just tragic.), burratta with fried lemon and basil - yum!, polenta side, the steak and the burger! 

I'd skip: the brussell sprout chips don't do it for me. Not because they're not yummy, but because they have a funky aftertaste to me. The scallops entree - they were fishy.  

Pro tip - make a reservation on OpenTable. If you don't get the time you want when you make it, check back a few hours before. They usually have openings at the most desirable times.
author: Cristin Z.

description:
I'd been here a couple of times when it first opened, and the food was ok, but not as solid or consistent from dish to dish. Glad to see this time around that they have graduated to being a great restaurant.

Amazing fries, demons on horseback, flounder for main course. Really amazing. The dessert made of chocolate and coconut that we had tasted like a bounty bar, so it was indifferent -- they gave us some small desserts on the house that were not on the menu and were much much better.

Only downside, the side chanterelles with sunchokes. It was not good. It was hard to believe that they came out of the same kitchen. Why do this to chanterelles, they are such a great ingredient?!

Oh, and I like the ambience: on the nice side, but modern, stylish and laid-back, not stuffy -- good for both the younger and older crowd.

Park tavern has become a truly wonderful restaurant, and correcting perhaps a few small things on the menu (see above) would make it one of SF's very finest, I think.
author: F K.

description: This has become one of our favorite SF restaurants.  The lemon chips are amazing.  They are so light and tasty, it is a good thing they are portioned.  Like Lays....you can't eat just one!  I had read about the deviled eggs and couldn't wait to see what all the fuss was about.  They are simply the best deviled eggs ever, very savory!  Since they are sold individually, you should try one, I promise you won't be disappointed.  Next we had Demons on Horseback, which are prawns wrapped in lard...a taste explosion in your mouth.  This last trip we shared the Marlowe burger which was extraordinary.  Can you tell we love this restaurant?  The drinks are also made with fresh juices and quite tasty.  And saving the best for last...the service is top notch.  Very friendly, knowledgeable about the menu and attentive.  This restaurant deserves 10 stars!!
author: Julie S.

description:
I'm giving this place a 3.5 stars because this was likely the MOST expensive brunch I have ever had.  Dont go with the pitchers, thats where they get you!  Parking was a hassle so we valeted, but it was great with a view of Washington Square Park.

We started with orders of the toast with dungeness crab, and avocado toast. Both delicious.  We also ordered the ginger scones-- if you like ginger you'll love it--warm and moist.  

I ordered the eggs with crispy polenta-so delicious!  The hubby had the Marlowe burger, which he loved as well.  Great place if someone else is buying :)
author: Namita A.

description: My wife and I came here for a Sunday brunch.  We'd made a reservation and were seated immediately.  In short, the place was fantastic.  We started with the almond and cherry coffee cake, which was amazing (that was our appeitzer).  My wife had the brioche french toast, which is great.  They had made a mistake with my order (cast-iron baked eggs with jamon serrano and spinach, but with no cheese) so we got to course the meal.  The eggs were great, though a bit too much spinach.  The highlight was our "dessert", which was the avocado toast - simple but delicious.  We're both keen to come back for dinner soon.
author: Marcus P.

description: This was our first time here and it was amazing! Every item we ordered was great. The best fries we have ever had. Each on was both soft and crispy.  Our new favorite restaurant in the city!
author: Liz H.

description:
We really enjoyed our feast here.  Great service.  Great food.
$100 a couple for appetizers, entree and dessert with a couple of beverages.
Glad to see this space is doing it right.
Cheers.
author: Kev M.

description:
Get the Boozy Smoothie!!!

Nice atmosphere, tasty drinks, decent food, acceptable service.

Went with a group of 12 for Easter brunch, and was lucky to snag seats at the communal table at opening.

Now I know it was Easter Sunday and we had a large group but I still think it took a somewhat unreasonable amount of time to get our food. At least some status updates from the staff would have been appreciated. Perhaps its because we were seated at opening and all the orders went in at once. 

Nearly every person in my party ordered the crispy polenta cakes, veal schnitzel, or shrimp and grits and the ranking from best to worst was grits, polenta, schnitzel. It was all about the sauces here, with well executed dishes but nothing too mind blowing. Someone actually sad, "if I had all the ingredients I could definitely cook all this at home," and I agree. With all that said, I am still dreaming about the Boozy Smoothie and plan to dedicate my weekend to recreating it.
author: Krystle S.

description: Great brunch spot! I love the atmosphere and sometimes I have dreams about their avocado toast.
author: Darah P.

description:
This place is happening! All smiles, fun vibe, happy staff, and just GREAT eats! The newly opened Eden Lounge upstairs is perfect. Have dined here several times now, and it's always been great. They have also hosted a couple of charity events, which speaks volumes to me...and not just because they served their tasty morsels.

Oh, and along with Boulette, one of my favorite brunches in SF.

Best bloody Mary in town.
author: Matthew K.

description: Brunch: Have hosted friends and family from out of town for brunch here on several occasions. Delicious food, excellent service and well-paced delivery. Definitely the type of place to make a reservation and plan to catch up leisurely, not a venue for bottomless mimosas and waiting in line.
author: DJ W.

description: Great service! No wait! Brunch items were incredible. We had the deviled egg open face chicken sandwich and the poached egg on polenta cakes. The open face sandwich was good, but the polenta cakes were amazing! We also started out with the avocado toast which was delicious but a bit pricy for what you get. Overall, definitely a repeat!!!
author: Rohan W.

description:
Stopped by here on on a Friday afternoon as Park Tavern recently started a "Three Martini" three course lunch  from 12:00-2:30.  Love the concept but just stayed for some snacks at the bar which were delish.  Deviled eggs and bacon wrapped prawns can each be ordered individually which is definitely a plus in my book as a gal who just wanted some munchies.  Eggs are usually not my forte but I could have eaten 10.  Fortunately (but unfortunately) no bread is served before 5:30 so I had some of the bar's $7 beef jerky to fill up.  It was excellent.
I will be back with more of an appetite and the hankering for three day time cocktails.  Oh, yes, and I must check out dinner which I heard was quite a scene.  Day time was empty inside but I did make friends with the only patrons (3) at the bar.

Note- I was very happy to see many Roses on the wine list, reminded me of St. Barth's
author: Em H.

description:
I had a great experience at Park Tavern last night for dinner. The service was excellent and everyone was super friendly.

We didn't order any entrees, but the mixture of small plates and appetizers were all wonderful.

The highlights include: 
Deviled eggs, with a perfect amount of kick 
Demons on horseback - How can you go wrong with shrimp and bacon?!
Brussel sprout chips - I was surprised with the large amount.  They were very tasty and the right amount of crispy.
Almond Joy ice cream dessert - a nice small portion for a few bites of sweet at the end of the night

I wanted the seasonal burrata dish to have a little more flavor, as well as the sunchokes, but they were both above average dishes.

I will definitely be going back and having another one of their Mary Etta's Bubbles cocktails.
author: Neila M.

description: We had a birthday brunch reservation at 11:15am on Sunday.  When I arrived at 10:55am I was told "to find something to do."  When I returned at 11:10am, the hostess would not acknowledge me yet, she bent over backwards to accommodate 3 hipster men who came in, without reservations, and to set up the chef's table for them and seat them immediately.  She would not even look at me.  After we were seated, we had a good meal, the baked eggs were yummy and the shared avocado toast was delish!  If not for the hostess, I would have given 4 stars.
author: Pam C.

description:
Spacious restaurant that evokes old-school SF with its dark wood and intricate floor tiling.  The crowd is an eclectic bunch including families, old-timers, hipsters ... basically, foodies of all ages.  The common thread is everyone seemed to be having a great time.

First thing you notice is how loud the place is.  Definitely raised voices needed for conversation.

As for cuisine, it's standard American but with unique twists on classics.  The appetizers sounded more exciting so we ended up ordering a bunch of those rather than any entrees. A couple of standouts:

- Deviled eggs with bacon, pickled jalapeno and chives: I don't think I've ever met a deviled egg I didn't enjoy ... but some are better than others and the ones here are some of the best. 

- Lemon chips with dill pollen, burrata & Shelley's pea tendrils: this is probably a dish you won't find anywhere.  Literally thinly-sliced lemons that are fried ... extremelyl delicate and not overly sour as I had anticipated.  Very nice.

- PT fries with shaved black truffle and parmesan, served with a soft-boiled egg topped with caviar.   At  over $17, probably the most expensive fries I've ever tried but they were decadent and delicious.  

- Demons on horseback (lardo-wrapped shrimp) - you can never go wrong with this combo.

- Brussels sprout chips - a must-order side.

The only so-so dish was the foie gras terrine were just ok (definitely have had better) and the crab dip (which, honestly speaking, may have been good but it was somewhat forgettable compared to other standouts).

The Country Lawyer cocktail (bourbon, vermouth, benedictine and chocolate bitters was outstanding (so good that I went and bought the bitters the following day just so I could make the drink at home).
author: F. P.

description: I love this place. The staff is friendly and professional and the food and drinks never disappoints. The brussel sprout chips are a must. My favorite is the bar steak, and my husband always order the pork, but the deviled eggs, demons on horseback and burger are all lovely too. Let the bar staff mix you a Moscow Mule and just enjoy.
author: Daisy B.

description:
birthday dinner #1
 
haven't been here in 6 months and was thinking about their chicken..

ordered:
-smoked deviled eggs:bacon, pickled jalapeno, chive.. loved this and wanted more

-parisienne gnocchi:wild mushrooms, truffle, sugar snap peas.. good but i wasn't able to eat a lot of this

-pt fries:truffle, soft cooked egg, caviar.. same as last time..saltier after every bite

-marlowe burger: caramelized onions, cheddar, bacon w fries and horseradish aioli.. nice burger. i liked the bun. 

-poulet noir: black truffle, butter braised spinach, roasted peewee potatoes.. so tender and juicy just as i remembered my first time here

-herb crusted petrale sole: heirloom squash, pea tendrils, mint, prosciutto, white wine veloute..i really wanted to like this but it failed terribly. after the first bite, the crust tasted familiar but i couldn't quite figure it out; about halfway through i finally came to the conclusion that the herbed crust tasted like a mashed falafel on top of the sole. their were way too many flavors that just didn't go together 

-tcho chocolate creme brulee: chili, lemon zest, sea salt and chocolate biscotti.. same as last visit

-afternoon delight: captain crunch ice cream, cereal milk creme anglaise, captain crunch dust.. i liked this and the creme reminded me of the cereal milk ice cream at extraordinary desserts in sd

im not really sure if i go back again anytime soon.. if i do it'd be for the poulet noir
author: Raquel T.

description: Fantastic drinks, fantastic service, fantastic food. Great place for any meal with friends, or for a romantic outing. It is pricey, but it's just that kind of place. I would feel comfortable sending most people here knowing they would have a good experience.
author: Jimmy L.

description: Park Tavern has great atmosphere and great bar area, the service is great the food can be great at times but mostly average! I have got the SMOKED DEVILED EGGS,  BRUSSELS SPROUT CHIPS, CRISPY LEMON CHIPS & the bone marrow all of which are great. what is a let down in this place is main dishes, Marlowe burger is good but it is not the best burger in the city! for main dish I also have had POULET NOIR which is different but not amazing. and the ROASTED DUCK BREAST which is average! desert changes so most of the time is ok but I have had the best cheese cake here so get it if it is on the menu. For brunch I highly recommend the veal schnitzel if they serve it that day...
author: Arash H.

description:
Went here the other night to celebrate a friends birthday and big were we happy! Everything was so good. I have never had deviled eggs before and now I want more...bacon and jalapeños, how could you go wrong?! And the PT fries, so good! They come with caviar, which I passed on, but was told it was good. I had the steak frites. Flavor was amazing. And it was an actual portion size, not something that your paying money for and looking at your plate and thinking where the heck is the rest of my meat!
The birthday boy had the Demons on Horseback and said that it was so good and the hint of bacon was perfect!
If you have a birthday and let them know you get a piece of complimentary birthday which was chocolate and red velvet cakes layered. You can also order a piece of the cake even if its not your birthday!
I cannot wait to come back here in the future!!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Six words aptly describes Park Tavern:  good cocktails, good service, bad food.

The Country Lawyer (a bourbon based cocktail) was excellent.  My waitress was prompt, attentive, and engaging.  If only the food wasn't disappointing I could have regaled you all with tales of the latest great North Beach restaurant.  Sadly, the arugula salad that tasted like a lemon bomb, the oily beef tartar, and the uninspired and bland tuna prevent me from doing so.   

Park Tavern is definitely a scene, a place to see and be seen.  Check it out . . . just make sure to grab a bite to eat someplace else beforehand.
author: Oski B.

description:
Picks:
Mojito ($12) - was strong and perfectly balanced, they know how to make drinks here.

Excellent, complimentary warm Acme epi bread.

Brussels Sprout Chips ($6) are a classic dish moved over from Marlowe, light, greasy, perfect.

Lemon & basil leaf, burrata ($12) featured homemade mozzarella cheese that was slightly runny along with deep fried lemon wheels that made an interesting but workable combination.

Manila clam chowder, shaved bottarga & chives ($12) was creamy and full of flavor, all in all very good.

Deviled Eggs, bacon, pickled jalepeño & chives ($1.50 ea) are a must order. We were not fans of deviled eggs, but with one bite we were believers.

Petit "Poulet Rouge" Bloomsdale spinach & Peewee potatoes ($24) was a Cornish game hen presented at the table facing upright with a tableside sauce pour. This chicken was very tender and juicy and a must order. The Bloomsdale spinach and kiwi potatoes were also excellent. This dish gives Zuni Cafe a run for their money.

Grilled pork chop, Italian butter bean piston, dinosaur kale, toasted garlic & chili flakes ($24) was cut in two and perfectly cooked to a juicy medium rare. A must get for pork fans like us.

Creekstone NY Steak, red wine jus, Mangalitsa butter & french fries ($29) featured two triangles of medium (slightly pink in the middle) tender meat with angular charcoal grilling embedded on the surface. Excellent french fries and a very robust sauce.

Special of the Day: Brussel Sprout Hearts ($7) were sauteed with lemon and cheese, a very nice side dish.

Dessert:

Fig & apple crisp ($7) Whole lemon gelato took about 15 minutes to arrive, hot out of the oven, but worth the wait due to the very fresh fruit and tasty crumble. The gelato was first class.

Birthday Cake - November ($7) Casey's carrot cake was the cake of the month and a great version of the classic. Better than most people expect.

Pans:
Mendocino uni, butter lettuce, chili & avocado oil ($11) - Simply did not work. They need to perform some surgery on this dish.

Full blog post:
http://www.foodnut.com/844/park-tavern-restaurant-review-san-francisco/
author: Ellen H.

description: Amazing food, and service... Seated promptly ... Food was very yummy..I tried my friends baked eggs.. You can probably skip that but every other dish was amazing and presentation was good too! They don't sell mimosas by the carafe but u can just get a bottle of proseco m a carafe of orang juice n it was plenty for the 6 of us!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
New favorite restaurant in sf. We've been trying to get to park tavern for a while now but unsurprisingly it took forever to get a saturday reservation. Annoying. Worth the wait though as park tavern lived up to the hype. One of the coolest atmospheres I've seen in a while, a great bar area and scene to have a cocktail before dinner. The vibe of the whole restaurant is lively but cozy and classy, hard to explain but pretty much exactly what I'm looking for. The hostess was very friendly and even offered us a few choices as to which table we wanted.

As for the food, top notch! Everything we tried was absolutely amazing, the only exception being the burrata which was a bit strange and not very good. Deviled eggs, amazing but I actually like wayfare's better but these are awesome as well. Demons on horseback were also a pleasant surprise that I would order again. For entrees we ordered the mussels and pork. Mussels were good and the cream sauce was something different that you usually don't see mussels in. The pork was some of the best I've tasted in a while. So tender and flavorful!! Amazing. We also shared the twice baked potato and brussel sprout chips. Both I'd consider must haves. I would say the dessert was a little bit of a letdown but by this point we were so full I didn't care that much. 

Bartender, hostess, waitress were all very nice and accommodating. Prices aren't cheap but fairly standard for sf dining. Parking is tough but they  have valet if needed for 10$ or cab it. Will definitely be back ASAP had a fabulous time!!
author: Kate N.

description: Park Tavern is the best place to celebrate. Great cocktails, the deviled eggs truly are delicious and the chicken is amazing. The first time I came here the stuffing with the chicken was amazing (crispy but juicy), but the next time I came there were just some vegetables which was a bummer. Hopefully it's seasonal and the stuffing will be back soon!
author: Lauren O.

description: We came here for brunch on a Sunday. we thought the menu was pretty creative. We got cast iron baked farm egg with Gruyere and crispy polenta. Both were really good but we were especially pleased with the polenta. The mushrooms that came with the polenta was amazing. Open the for service was great. One of the waiters took note of the water table that we had and was kind enough to fixed it for us.
author: George H.

description: Yup! They're doing it right. Tavernish and wonderful.
author: Mike J.

description: We had a delicious brunch here recently. The ambiance is great, even if the tables are a bit close together. Every dish we had was wonderful and the service was excellent. The avocado toast was definitely the highlight! Parking in this neighborhood is, of course, a challenge but they offer valet parking if you need it.
author: Diana G.

description: Overrated as everything in SF - but the oatmeal walnut pancakes are amazing and unlike anything I've ever had. Easily amongst the top 5 best pancakes in the US.
author: Satyan C.

description:
honestly i was a little disappointed with the food here.. my cousin recommended this restaurant to me, and read the yelp reviews so i expected a lot more than i got..

Brussels Sprout Chips -- were good, very greasy
Pork belly bites, horseradish aioli- tasty however, some of them were just battered deep fried chunks of fat with no meat
Deviled Eggs, bacon, pickled jalepeño & chives-- one of the best things.. maybe we should have listened to the waitress and gotten more than just 2


Seared scallops, roasted cauliflower, braised baby fennel & grapefruit --meh nothing special.. didn't finish them

my friend got the pork chops-- all he said about it was that he's had better somewhere else...

maybe the food was just too rich, or maybe we just ordered fatty foods, or maybe we didn't order the right dishes, but i didn't finish my food, and i left hungry
author: Bon N.

description:
Loved this place.  I had some friends in town, so wanted to have a nice dinner in a place that could accommodate a 16 month old.  From start to finish, this place delivered.  When I called to confirm that they had a highchair for my friend's kid, and inquired whether it was ok that someone in our party (the bf) would be running late, they didn't bat an eye, and basically said "we're here to serve you."  The excellent service continued throughout the night; our waitress was very accommodating of our little group.

The food was to die for.  My friend and I started with the crab and lobster bisque---yummy!!!  Not too creamy, had some bits of crab and lobster, and I loved the puff pastry that came with it.  For the main course, both she and I got the filet mignon.  OMG, so tender and juicy.  And the potatoes that came with it were heavenly.  My boyfriend scarfed down his mussels, and my friend's husband seemed to really enjoy his scallops.

The atmosphere was perfect.  Lively, sophisticated, great decor, all overlooking Washington Square Park.  I was amazed at all of the bustle, even for a 6 o'clock reservation.  

Park Tavern lived up to and exceeded the hype.  My new favorite.
author: Danielle B.

description: Went there for brunch. The food and drinks were good, but a little pricey compared to some similar places. We ordered the baked eggs over spinach and the chorizo and eggs and then had the chocolate crime brûlée for dessert. No complaints other than it was hard to get the attention of the servers, but they were setting up for a private event hat afternoon, so I think that was an anomaly.
author: T.J. H.

description:
Ok... super salty food!  Deviled Eggs were good, but my burger and fries were way too salty... and this comes from a person who likes salt.  Others at the table seemed to like the mussels.

Lobster & Corn Chowder Soup was good.
author: Samantha J.

description:
I am sooo glad Park Tavern came to our hood.  First off, I was expecting some serious delays, even though we made a reservation.  The restaurant was still relatively new (back in March) and it was Saint Patrick's Day, so there was A LOT going on (not to mention the Bachelor - yes, the reality TV bachelor - was there with what's her face)..

Our large party was seated promptly and we were greeted with glasses of champagne from our super friendly, knowledgeable, and timely waiter.  I had noted on Open Table that it was my dad's birthday, so they brought this out for us!  The appetizers and salads were amazing, as were the entrees.  As for the space, I LOVE the modern tavern feel and the openness of the restaurant.  We loved it so much that we're going back with a group of 8 for a post-graduation celebration.  So excited!  Definiitely make a reservation and go for brunch too - the menu looks delish!
author: Spice O.

description:
Wow.  What a busy place.   But very friendly staff.  And, I guess friendliness rubs into patrons too.    It is like a big happy family at the bar and communal tables

Avocado sandwich is AMAZING
author: Madhur B.

description: I love places like this. The vibes are awesome here. We had dinner here but sat outside since we had our frenchie with us and it was great. The beers on tap can satisfy any beer lover. The entrees were solid. But what was most memorable was the bacon deviled eggs!!
author: Cindy T.

description: Ordered some App's and cocktails while waiting for a table at Tony's...soft shell crab was decently fried but the shrimp app sort of in a Louie sauce was overcooked.  The bar was packed and it looked like the old Perry's on Union crowd...I'm dating myself but you know what I'm talking about....this place has fallen off a lot since Cavalier opened!
author: Gregory C.

description:
Had a wonderful anniversary dinner here.  Porcini mushroom, truffle salsa verde & parmesan was my highlight.  

The only gripe was it literally took them 35 minutes to bring desert after we ordered so we ended up having a 2.5 hour dinner.  Not a bad place to spend a long dinner though.
author: Robby W.

description:
I came here with some friends on a Friday night and it was jam packed! We waited around for some bar seats to open up but someone always got there before us! Oh well, we got drinks anyways. The bartenders took a really long time to make our drinks. I got the Washington Square and this drink made my face pucker so hard that the creases on my face overlapped, I looked like a Chinese shar pei. I love me some sour patch kids but this drink was too sour for me. My next drink was the Mclaren. That was a nice change. I really enjoyed this drink, it was refreshing. 

For appetizers, we ordered the local halibut and brussels sprouts chip. The halibut had a party in my mouth, there were so many different flavors but it all tasted really good together. For $12, you only get 4 pieces. This dish is overpriced but it's a must try item. The brussels sprouts chip was very addicting. Once you start eating it, you can't stop. One small complaint, the salt and oil were unevenly distributed, I had a few chips that were either really oily or extremely salty. I had the steamed mussels for dinner and it was incredible! I ate every single mussel, finished the grilled bread, and even ate more by dipping the house bread in the sauce.
author: Laura L.

description:
This is my new favorite restaurant in SF. It has a great menu and wonderful service - the perfect combo. The menu is solid and delicious every time. The service is impeccable. 

Dinner is amazing and brunch is too. Go here. You will return again and again.
author: Heather M.

description: Brussel sprout chips were tasty though perhaps a tad salty. Deviled eggs have a nice spicy kick at the end. I may try to recreate them. The poulet was juicy (assume it was brined). I would suggest sharing it as a Cornish game hen for one is a bit much. I opted to cut it myself. I suggest asking for a large plate so you can properly carve it.
author: Tu T.

description: Food mediocre. Our server was very slow. Salmon was undercooked. Restrooms dirty. Very odd rotating service. Scallops overdone and salty. The salad overdressed. They need a new chef. Such a great location to have such tourist grade C- food and experience.
author: Tertiary D.

description: Great find in North Beach when your not looking for the typical Italian fare- menu is constantly updated and the place is always busy.  Great service and great food.
author: Adam S.

description:
I came here twice in the same week - one time with my girlfriends and one time with a guy.  This place is awesome because it can cater to both.  

Food - burratta on chips delicious, deviled eggs were also really good.  the steak was also delicious.  strawberry rhubarb crisp o.m.g.

Service - just wonderful.  knowledgeable and friendly staff.

Drinks - AWESOME. i love whisky and their old fashioned and sazerac hit the spot.

I'm from NYC and this place totally has the feel of a nice chic NYC lounge.
author: Nancy M.

description: Dined with five others and we all had a wonderful experience.  Loved the Brussel sprouts, lemon slices and shrimp appetizers.  Good combo of flavors. Main course was the pork chop.  Very tasty, but was luke warm when delivered.  For sides, enjoyed the twice baked potato and Brussel sprouts.  Finished off the meal by sharing the birthday cake and lemon cheesecake parfait.  Awesome.  Plus excellent wine selection.  Royalty was among us as Mr. Mayor (Willie) was at a nearby table.  Restaurant is loud so turn up the hearing aids!
author: Mike N.

description: amazing boozy bunch. deviled eggs, french toast, and drinks were great. the kind of place you get sucked in to staying for hours. awesome area to walk around afterwards (killer glute workout).
author: Megan A.

description: I really like this restaurant. The ambiance and the food are very nice. I had the carrot soup and garden salad and sea bass. All were delicious as although I loved the salad even though it was a starter. It was very busy even on a Monday night. Reservations are a must! The location by Washington Square Park is very pretty and valet is convenient.
author: Olivia O.

description:
We had  our annual company dinner in the upstairs room and the service was warm , professional and very accomodating to our needs.  Everything went amazingly well, since it is not easy to serve 50 people.

The evening started with the deviled eggs which are amazing as reviewers have said, as well as a shrimp and also a steak tartare appetizers! 

Our dinner was served on long tables family style with our  first course being he burrata and lemon chips, the PT Fries  and the  baby lettuce salad with an amazing mix of, grapes, fennel, radish, avocado and the dressing had just the right touch of tarragon.   All were amazing and disappeared quickly

The main dishes were the red snapper, chicken and sliced New York steak ribeye and the sides were brussels sprouts and creamy, cheesy,  twice baked potatoes.   We have some in are party who were vegetarian and they served a casserole for them. All of these including the special vegetarian entree  were wonderful.

Dessert was a scrumptious pumpkin cake with cream cheese frosting that is now a new favorite of mine.
author: Steven H.

description:
Reviews have raved about Park Tavern and 7x7 Magazine named it one of the four best new restaurants from last year.  All the hype is true.

Facing Washington Square, the restaurant is in a prime location.  The interior is hip and clean and I dig the white floor tiles.  You can see the entire kitchen and the waiting staff is friendly and helpful.

The must eats: deviled eggs (probably the best I have ever had AND they are topped with bacon), burrata with lemon chips, and the poulet rouge.  The chicken is somewhat disturbing in its presentation and is sitting upright, waiting for you to slice it and eat it.  It made me guilty to be a carnivore but it was so tasty.  The cocktails are good and strong, especially the Ed Negroni.

The deviled eggs take the cake though and I could have ate them all night.  I want some right now!  The lemon chips are innovative and I'm hoping they catch on as a great dried fruit that can be purchased in stores.
author: Chad S.

description:
Being from out of town, I rely on Yelp, Open Table, and other review sites when choosing restaurants. So, upon reading an article on San Francisco's best new restaurants, I decided to give Park Tavern a try and was glad I did.

First off, I didn't make my 8:30pm reservation until 6:00pm that same evening and had no trouble at all, whereas all of the other SF go-to hot spots were completely booked days in advance (my own fault, I know). I'm assuming this is because Park Tavern is huge, and also it's still pretty new.

Upon arriving, the hostess was extremely friendly and helpful.
