Our table wasn't quite ready yet, but she made sure we were seated within a few minutes and even offered to take our drink orders while we waited. The place was insanely packed and loud, and I could definitely tell she was a pro at her job.

We started off with the deviled eggs which were INCREDIBLE. The lobster bisque was also amazing. Some of the other dishes we tried, however, weren't as great, like the arugula salad which was drowned in truffle oil and the filet mignon which was insanely salty (and I like my food over-seasoned, so you can probably imagine how much I felt like I was eating a block of salt). Overall the food was great, though, including dessert. I had the birthday cake which comes complete with a lit candle. Drinks were also amazing. In fact, their margarita is the best I've ever had-- seriously. And, the coffee comes in an adorable mini French press and is served with a cute bowl of sugar cubes.

Service and ambiance were great. I loved the Washington Square/North Beach location, the decor (love the wallpaper and tiles), and the bar area. Overall this is a great place and I hope to see it on even more "best of" lists next time I visit SF.
author: Ryan B.

description:
The atmosphere beats any restaurant in San Francisco. It's sexy, classy, lively, and well-designed. It's probably my latest favorite dinner spot in SF! 

The food is good though I wouldn't RAVE about it, but I liked the devils on horseback, mussels, burger and five cheese potatoes. My most exciting discovery was a Montepulciano for under $30 that was divine and inexpensive.

Go here for a date, dinner with friends, celebrations, drinks....any occasion!
author: Jenna Q.

description:
We had read good things about the place so we booked it for a 50th birthday dinner for a friend.  We were seated promptly. The atmosphere was fine.

I made sure early in our interaction with the waiter that we were not in a hurry that evening.  We took out time looking over the menu and would mentally back into what we would be drinking that evening based on what we wanted to eat.

This was the first clue that something was amiss.  The waiter kept pushing us to order drinks before we were ready.  We ordered some cocktails, in lieu of considering champagne just to get him away.

We decided on four appetizers, the brussel sprout chips (very nice, but too salty), the seafood gnocchi (good), and the venison-steak tartar (very good). The deviled eggs were to die for.  

At this point he really pushed us to order our main course.  We were not allowed to linger over our cocktails to consider our choices between our conversations.

Our cocktails came and very soon after the appetizers.  We assumed that in 2 minutes the bread would arrive as how does one eat steak tartar with something to put it on?  The waiter disappeared and it took a good while to get some bread.  

I had ordered a French onion soup.  It came not 30 seconds after the bread hit the table to eat the Tartar.  We did tell him we were not in a hurry; he ignored it and did not cadence the courses at all.

The French onion soup was a small cup with a near solid mass of onion and reduced mushroom with a slice of bread and cheese on it.  There was almost no liquid in the "soup" at all.  The flavor was nice, but soup it was not.

We ended up ordering some win after we finished the appetizers and the soup.  Almost as soon as the wine got ordered the main course hit the table.  The wine lagged behind the meal and again felt rushed just as everything had since we sat down.

The main courses were short ribs (excellent), sea scalps (very good), and I had mussels and clams (not good).  The broth-sauce that the sea food came in was so rich and heavy you could not taste the mussels and clams at all. I had to ask for more bread even though most people who have a giant bowl of this sort want to dunk as the waiter did not pick up on that fact. The mushroom side dish was fine.

We had the chocolate birthday cake, panna cotta, and the seasonal crisp for desert. The crisp was excellent. The panna cotta was very good.  The chocolate birthday cake was a solid hunk of chocolate more akin to a dense brownie than a birthday cake.  

The food consistency, meaning very good to excellent across the board should have been attained for a restaurant of this caliber.  It was hit and miss at best.

The service was amateur hour. It had all the trappings of formal service but none of the substance.  The waiter failed to perceive that we were interested in a slow well cadenced evening.  The course delivery overlapped. Basics such as bread had to be asked for.  The waiter did not check in regular intervals after the deliver of each course to see how things were going.

All in all, I do not think we would go back.
author: sondra g.

description:
4 1/2 stars.  Cut down on the salt and add some desserts and it'd be 5 stars.

Great interior--adding it to my list of man restaurants.  

Started with the burrata with fried lemon chips--incredibly unique, fresh and delicious.  Followed by brussels sprouts chips--soooo good! They should serve those in every bar!

Burger was okay--a little heavy on the horseradish.  Fries were a little salty.

Roast chicken was one of the best chicken I've had (probably tied with Zuni).  Crispy, spicy skin.  Served with kale.

Mixed drinks were good.  Only two dishes on the dessert menu--neither appealed to us.  Sad.  Had to go around the corner for some gelato (so not that big of a loss).

Looking forward to going back.
author: M. C.

description:
Food, drink, and ambiance is all 5+ stars.  Parking is 0 stars.

-Luther Vandross jams
-Smart lighting and use of space
-Masculine, sexy decor
-Wine by the glass (list) pleases all; cocktails/beer for others
-Approachable, but true-to-SF menu

SF style restaurant with an LA, see-and-be-seen feel
author: Gracie L.

description:
Nice location, nice atmosphere.

Sat at the bar and got great service. Cocktails were solid.

Apps:
Brussels Sprout chips - solid, not amazing
Demons on Horseback - ok. They sound better than they are

Entrees:
Marlowe burger - a solid burger. Not quite up to NOPA or Spruce
Bar Steak - A little small (8 oz) for the price. Perfectly cooked but a bit bland

Dessert:
Bread pudding - delicious
Creme brulee - very good

All in all a solid meal, but I suppose my expectations were too high. I don't feel any particular need to return.
author: Bill R.

description: Can't go wrong with Park Tavern. Great for date and groups. Drinks at the bar or dinner/brunch. Burger & Brussels are AMAZING.
author: Katherine L.

description:
We went here for a work dinner last night and WOW! I was more than impressed, I have never been here and heard bits and pieces, but I left very happy! Since there was a big group of us, they did it kind of tapas style which was great because we got to try a ton of things!

Starters:

-Deviled Eggs, bacon pickled jalapeno & chives -Amazing!!! One of my favorites
-Warm house smoked nuts with Blis vanilla maple -Delicious, I wish I could snack on these all the time
-Brussel sprout chips -Also amazing!
-PT French fries, parmesan, truffle & black pepper -To die for

So all the starters we pretty much amazing. I could have had an entire meal of them.

First Course:

-Tuna conserva, grilled country bread & arugula -Very tasty
-Lemon & petit pea tendrils, burrata -I love burrata, the lemon chip was an interesting addition
-Market vegetable crudite, green goddess dip -Nothing amazing, but good snack

Second Course:

-"Poulet Rouge" with lemon thyme jus -This was tasty
-Seared local albacore with salsa rustica -Not overly impressed
-Butter braised spinach with roasted pewee potatoes -Delicious
-Brown butter parmesan roasted Brussels sprouts hearts -One of my favorites as well 
-Twice baked potatoe, creme fraiche, cheddar  & scallions -These were one of my other favorite things

Dessert:

-Chocolate Pudding -To die for!!!!

So ya it was an amazing dinner and I highly recommend it!!!!
author: Jenny I.

description:
Went here on a Saturday w/ my boyfriend when he was in town. I tried to get a reservation through Opentable for 2 for a 7:30-8:30 timeslot and that was impossible. The only time slots they had open were for a 6 pm slot and then something around 9ish. Yep. They are THAT busy. I ended up calling in and we were able to get a seat at the chef's counter at 7:45 for 2. So, if you have a small party (1-4 people) and don't care TOO much about where you sit, try calling in and seeing if they have any space at the chef's counter.

When we went here, the restaurant was REALLY busy so service was only okay. Our server did come in and check in on us and apologize for not being super attentive. Water was consistently refilled though. We got: lobster & crab bisque, deviled eggs, pork chop, and the petit chicken. The appetizers were AMAZING. As was the pork chop but the petit chicken was only okay. It was cooked well but was sort of bland. The spinach and potatoes at the bottom was also oily and meh. Cool concept though. Honestly, I'm super excited to go back again and will go soon!
author: Jennifer W.

description: Easily one of my absolute favorite restaurants in San Francisco. Never disappoints. Try the pork chop, deviled eggs and cocktails.
author: L B.

description:
Ahh, the old Moose's space has finally been resurrected with respect!  The space is grand and very well-done, and still warm and cozy.  It's fun people-watching with an eclectic crowd both young and older.

The food is hearty, interesting and delicious.  I think the menu doesn't do the dishes justice actually.  The flavors and combinations are more drool-worthy than they read on paper.  Also, great cocktails...

Only complaint is the cheese plate.  Three cheeses that you have to order together... None of them that interesting to me, and two of the three are definitely not loved by all (a washed rind and a blue).  C'mon.....  More interesting cheese and a la carte, please!!
author: Melanie C.

description: My family came in on a packed night, we made reservations for 9pm (that was the soonest we could get in). Hard to park so we used their valet. Once we sat down we had an amazing meal with amazing service from Patrick. Although busy there was no lack in service at all. Every dish was unique and balanced. It was hard to choose from their menu because everything looked amazing. The decor was subtle and sophisticated. Very up and coming. I'd recommend this place to anyone and will be going again when I visit San Francisco. I will also request Patrick as a server because he was as excited about the menu as we were and made amazing sincere recommendations.
author: Sammy W.

description: Very elegant and relaxing. Great brunch. Great coffee. Great company (well, you need to bring your own). Go on Sunday. This Sunday!
author: Dave L.

description: Just stumbled on this place when we were walking around North Beach. Went in for lunch after we saw the line at Tony's. Food was very, very good. Pretty place too and just across from Washington Square Park. Definitely would go back next time we are in S.F. to try their dinner fare.
author: Barry M.

description:
Oh My Lovely Park Tavern, more than 12 visits and counting!!!  

For dinner, the lobster bisque, deviled eggs, wild nettle soup, pork chop, burratta with friend lemon chips, and PT fries are deeeeeeelicious.  

For brunch, the buttermilk pancakes, crispy polenta cakes w/ poached eggs/mushrooms/parmesan, the grapefruit brulee, and veal schnitzel w/ poached eggs are purrrrrrrfect. 

SERVICE = OUTSTANDING
BAR SCENE = AWESOME

MANY THANKS to owner/proprietress EXTRAORDINAIRE ANNA WEINBERG and chef JENN PUCCIO for bringing their outstanding restaurant scene to Washington Square Park.

(BTW - Park Tavern + Tony's Pizza + Original Joes = HOLY TRINITY!!!!!)
author: J. SOMA S.

description:
Was great the first time I came when it opened 2 years ago.  Still Solid as usual but not the same excitement anymore.  This is my second time here and the Brussels sprout chips are getting old.  Maclaren still great.  No specials this time around so I got the steak.

Service was good but they do book up quickly around dinner, so we settled on a 5:30 appt and was done around 7.  

Still a great place, but the excitement from the first visit is somewhat diminished.
author: Cee G.

description: Took my boyfriend here for his birthday and WOW! The service was great from the beginning. Great wine recommendations from our server. The appetizers (we had cheddar cheese and then fried sunchokes) were incredible!!!! So much flavor and great portions for apps. Then I had the bar steak which was so much food and so yummy and the boyfriend had the NY steak which was also SOOOO yummy!!!!  The only thing was the bone marrow we got was actually just bone and not any marrow (oh well- the rest was DELICIOUS). They comped us 2 desserts for his birthday which was so nice! The restaurant was clean and management was always around from what I could tell. The two hostesses were very pleasant. Will be back soon.
author: Alexandria K.

description:
It's official: I'm a h-u-g-e fan of Park Tavern!

Over the course of three visits in the past three weeks -- once on a Friday at 8:30 with a reservation for a table of 5, once on an early walk-in at 5:30 or 6:00 on a weekend with two young children in tow, and again on a weeknight with a reservation at 6:30 for a group of 7 -- the food, service and atmosphere have been consistently excellent.

It seems to always be bustling but never overwhelmed or claustrophobically crowded.  The front of the house is well-staffed and very professional. And the food is delicious and interesting in a comfort food sort of way -- each dish just a slight degree or two away from what you'd typically expect to see on a menu.

Is it among the ranks of the restaurants with the absolute best of cuisine that SF has to offer?  No.  But in the totality of striking the right mix of everything a restaurant experience should be when you want to be in the hands of restaurateurs who at the top of their game for a warm and festive evening out with friends or family? Absolute, knock-it-out-of-the-park (no pun intended) yes!

Living just a few blocks away, it's a terrific and deeply welcomed addition to the neighborhood.
author: Charlie Z.

description: Wow... just wow! The deviled eggs are a must! Make sure to get those because they are incredible. The demons on horseback were also very good with the smokey taste and incredible sauce. The chicken was fresh and excellent, but just a tad too salty. My hamburger was very tasty because of the tint of horseradish. Overall, every meal was impeccable and I would love to come here again!
author: Shana G.

description: Good service, got our food out nice and quick on a crowded Sunday brunch. Relaxing, trendy decor too, reminds me of brunch spots in NYC. I came here with 7 other girlfriends after wedding dress shopping and man we were hungry! We split the avocado toast to start and tried the corned beef hash and potato, the smoked salmon eggs benedict, and the brioche french toast. Loved all the dishes, especially the brioche french toast. The persimmons gave the dish a nice flavor. I'd recommend splitting the hash and the french toast so you get some salty and sweet. Would love to come back to try the deviled egg sandwich, sounds delicious (maybe could rival Il Cane Rosso's in the ferry building?)
author: Joyce H.

description: We loved it. Great vibe, delicious food (loved the chicken, served whole and roasted on a pillar similar to an angel-food cake pan), and fantastic service.  Just a wonderful evening in a charming setting.
author: Edward F.

description: Nice atmosphere, no wait when Mama's is an hours wait.  This is just as good brunch place.  will definitely come back for more menu items when we hang out here after a walking tour of the city.
author: Tony T.

description:
Good location. Like the ambiance. The food is good as well although I found the dishes to be little on the heavier side.
But other than that this is a solid 4 star place in my opinion.
author: Neil B.

description:
Came here for easter brunch and it didn't disappoint. As someone who used to be a North Beach local, I'm really happy to see that they've completely turned this space around. The rustic woods and blue-grey walls made this place masculine and warm. 

We started off our meal with the warm baguette with goat milk butter and a variety of jams. It was delicious. Everyone in our party agreed we could eat this as our entire meal. 

Then we also tried the following items:
Raspberry & Blueberry Dutch Baby - This was delicious and we saved this for our 'desert' item. The berries were a good combination of sweet and tart. 

Butter Lettuce & Maine Lobster salad - This left little to be desired. It had a nice flavor but we couldn't find much lobster on it. Not worth the $17. 

Crispy Polenta Cakes with Wild Mushrooms - The flavor of this plate was amazing, especially if you are a mushroom/truffle lover. I'm usually not a fan of grit-like texture and runny eggs, but the combination of ingredients on this plate were great. 

I enjoyed the entire experience - the decor, the meal, the company. 

The next time I'm in town I'll be back for lunch and/or dinner.
author: Amy T.

description:
My family and I visited Park Tavern after my fiancee graduated from a master's program. The decor is new and nice, with darker accents and a modern tavern feel, but I would say a bit soul-less. Our service wasn't great - our waitress was friendly but was  mia for most of the meal. Granted it's not a big deal, but the people at the table behind us had left, and the table wasn't cleared of a big pile of dirty plates for at least 20 minutes. 

Unfortunately the food was also nothing to rave about. Two people ordered the pork chop, which was a huge piece of meat on top of veggies that basically amounted to pure mush. Another individual's fish stew was too salty to eat, and the cornish game hen, for all the hype, was unfortunately nothing special. Maybe we ordered the wrong thing? The appetizers - Jerusalem artichokes and salted fish on toast - were delicious, though.

Overall the experience was disappointing for the price class; I would recommend this restaurant for a drink and appetizers.
author: M. B.

description:
This place was really, really great. Keep in mind that it is packed full, even in the bar area. You will definitely need to make a reservation. Thankfully we did, and we were seated right away. 

I had the famous brussels sprouts chips, and even though as a rule I hate brussels sprouts, they were amazing. They are served in a bowl as individual leaves and perfectly seasoned with oil and salt. If only my mother made them this way when I was a kid, I would have eaten them constantly! 

For an entree I had the Angus filet mignon, which is served over spinach and potatoes, which are baked and sliced but have a crispy skin. The steak was perfectly cooked, tender and full of flavor. Absolutely delicious!

My only note was that the waitress could have kept a closer eye on our table, as I emptied my first glass of wine and had to hunt her down to order another one. Our water glasses were always full. 

Overall, a great experience and I will definitely go back.
author: Lori M.

description:
Hands down, this is some good people watching. 

On top of that, the food was pretty yummy too.

Our group came in with the idea of having the pork belly...to our dismay the pork belly was not on the menu. SAD PANDA.

However the other food was still great.

We had the chicken fried cipollini onions, the burrata and the Brussels sprout chips.  Yum, yum and super yum.  My favorite was the Brussels sprout chips. they were crispy and had a good flavor and were fun to eat.

The cocktails were also good--i had the McLaren which was ginger beer, Hendricks Gin, cucumber and lemon. normally i am not a cucumber fan, but the drink was tasty and refreshing.  

For my main i had the chicken, and by the chicken i mean A CHICKEN.  It was a whole chicken, and it was GOOD.  the potatoes were well cooked and the chicken was amazing. Since I couldn't eat it all in one sitting, i brought it home and even the leftovers were good.

My dinner companions had the scallops, the steak and the pork chop.  All three were tasty.

Last but not least we had the birthday cake dessert...in honor of my bday, and it was a nice carrot cake.  It was good, but in terms of carrot cake, I have definitely had better.

But the place was fun, and we had a great time. I'd definitely go back.
author: Lu E.

description:
Park Tavern has my favorite brunch in the entire city. There are so many delicious carb-laden delights too choose from that I always have trouble deciding what to get. I wish I could eat three brunches in a day just to try everything. Five stars for the brunch!

For dinner, the menu has some solid items and they are executed professionally, though for me they do not have the same allure as the brunch items. Service is always top notch and the space itself is pretty neat with the high ceilings with exposed wood beams. The location across the street from the park is quite pleasant for outdoor seating on nice days.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Went here one night with a group of girlfriends for after work drinks and snacks. I was way intimidated by the crowd when we first arrived but after huddling by the bar for a few minutes we were able to grab a spot. Customers and staff alike were so good-natured that the hubbub seemed more festive than chaotic. Phew!

We ordered the fried tomatoes, fried pork belly, deviled eggs, brussels chips, a salad and... ? It became a hazy, salty, greasy swirl as the wine flowed. We let their wine guy pick a couple bottles for us and we couldn't have been happier. Why don't I EVER write these recommendations down??

Can't wait to try their dinner and see how the menu develops  - I'm hoping my first impression holds up and it becomes a place I can take anyone. Down home food done upscale, woohoo!
author: Jessica M.

description: I don't get over to North Beach often, as it's a pain from my neighborhood (read: not served by the subway), but when I do, it's for brunch at Park Tavern. With it's black and white decor, old fashioned feel and throwback service, it's as close as I come to a white linen tablecloth brunch. The egg dishes are absolutely divine, and the french toast (which I prefer to split with a tablemate) is not to be missed. Oh, and as an added bonus for those of us who care, the crowd tends to be better dressed than at your typical SF brunch establishment (see white linen tablecloth comment above).
author: Marie F.

description: Crowded. Noisy. Found the last two stools at the communal table. Service was excellent.  Food was superb.  Deviled eggs were creamy and delicious.  Layered with flavors.  Even the snipped chives on the plate were yummy with the bread. Green goddess salad with pickled peaches.  Crisp, flavorful and a generous portion.  Scallops were magnificent. Accompanied with an unusual mix of tempura mushrooms, grilled bell pepper and a black flecked dressing that surprised with every bite.  Beautifully split plate so we could share.  Its been a while since I have enjoyed every dish in a meal so much.
author: Ash A.

description:
Absolutely NOT SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS, and only barely for vege-quarians.  

I'm only giving it two stars for dinner - but I'll give one more star, as it's a great place to go for drinks (if you can get a seat!)

I really want to love this place; we live in the neighborhood and walk by it all the time.  It's cozy (if a teeny bit dark), with lots of black tiling and dark wood.  There are cozy booths around the perimeter and a great bar to sit at.

Went there last night for 'date night' with hubby.   As with another reviewer, I was unimpressed with the 2 Hawaiian rolls we were given (with dishes whisked away practically as soon as our hands had left them - no refills as with other places).  The butter has pork fat in it, and so we were given an additional one for me without the fat.

If you want to be complete vegetarian the menu is severely lacking - the veggie on the table next to me ended up with the tiny appetizer of heirloom baby carrots as her main course.  I opted for the steamed mussels & fennel sausage, leeks, crème fraiche, white wine with two WAFER THIN slices of grilled bread - and picked out the sausage on to hubby's plate.  Tasty but disappointing as there were several mussels that were closed up, and therefore not fit to eat, but still served to me.

On the upside if you are a meatatarian the mini chicken "Poulet Rouge, Bloomsdale spinach & Peewee potatoes" looked impressive and husband said it was delicious!

We shared a tasty fig and apple crisp for dessert - the apple peel was a little tough but it was yummy.

Wait service was friendly - very prompt, even if they were a bit rushed on a Thursday.  However it is LOUD in there, date night was a fairly shouted affair.
author: Beekay M.

description: Standouts include their wine (love they have glasses or carafes to order) and the appetizers - brussel sprout chips had fresh lemon taste, demons on horseback good but a little salty. Best dinner item I sampled was the chicken, which I would recommend getting versus the fish dishes (ok). Really liked the ambiance - beautiful interior, very noisy at the bar but the restaurant area is less so.
author: Abby H.

description:
I truly want to give Park Tavern four stars because the ambiance is pleasant, the service is great and I could imagine how fantastic the food could taste....if it weren't so damn salty!!!

Now, I love salt. In fact I can sit and eat a bowl of rice sprinkled with just salt and be a happy camper. But the intense amount of sodium I experienced at Park Tavern last night was unbearable. We started with the duck liver mousse, which was very good, however we noticed it was quite salty. We moved on to the persimmon, buratta and coppa salad which was excellently balanced and quite refreshing. At this point the food seemed quite promising. Then came the lobster bisque and the steak tartare and both dishes were insanely over seasoned. By the time we were done eating I felt as though I'd been licking a salt block like a farm animal might. I'm not over exaggerating when I say that I could actually feel my blood pressure rising by the end of our meal! It was pretty unbearable. I was even fearful that dessert might be salty and we agreed that we wouldn't order any dessert described having "sea salt" or "fleur de sel." We ended up just skipping dessert due to our fear and left the restaurant with disappointment. Had the food not made me want to immediately drown myself with a gallon of water, I would have recommended it, absolutely. But I can't see myself returning if the food remains a salt bomb.
author: Regina C.

description:
We went here for our annual holiday dinner with another couple. We enjoyed the food and atmosphere. My only complaint would be our server. She rushed us through the meal, even though there were open tables. She asked for our order within 3 minutes of sitting down and before we have even ordered drinks. If they are trying to compete with Wayfare, they are going to have to get better staff. 

All in all, I still recommend Park Tavern. We will return and look forward to trying the cocktails.
author: Cheyenne C.

description:
After dining in this space years ago as Moose's and then seeing Joey & Eddy's short stint in Washington Square, I was certain that this spot was cursed! However, after dining at Park Tavern I'm convinced that they have the right formula to make the most of this awesome location!

I was most impressed with the overall aesthetic of the restaurant. It's one of the most beautiful restaurants in SF. It's classic, yet modern and although it's definitely fine dining, it's welcoming and not the least bit stuffy. Both old San Francisco and younger generations will appreciate this fabulous new hot spot.

Great drinks, tasty nibbles and impeccable service. What more could you ask for?!

I can't wait to come back!
author: Lauren T.

description:
Went here a few weeks ago with a group of girls and we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly!

We shared the Kampachi and the Salmon from the raw starters list -- excellent! And elegantly presented.

One of the event planners who did Park Tavern's opening gala had hooked us up and so they surprised us with little glasses of champagne as well as an order of the deviled eggs. What a nice surprise! I never would have ordered the deviled eggs myself but they were EXCELLENT. And I love that they were cut horizontally instead of vertically :-)

For my main course I had the "Grilled sea scallops, roasted cauliflower, vadouvan, golden raisins & almond" -- the scallops were cooked to perfection and the combination of flavors was scrumptious.

Would definitely recommend this place!
author: Sydney L.

description: AMAZING! Really that about sums it up. The food is just fabulous! The service was phenominal as well. Its quite busy on the weekends so may not be the best spot for a quiet, intimate lunch but as far as quality and a fantastic experience....this is the spot.
author: Miriam L.

description:
A Huge Thank You "Jennifer" for the BEST Filet Mignon I've had in the City, it was a  very nice portion with every piece melting in your mouth, and so tender that you could cut it with a fork!!!  

The twice cooked potatoes were awesome and the mushrooms tied the whole meal together, just a Great memorable meal that won't be soon forgotten. Our server Ora (Sorry if I misspelled your name) was wonderful, she took her time and never once rushed us, and Thanks Mike for putting us at the table we mentioned on our first visit that we just loved, thanks for noting that, as it was a nice surprise. Brian and James, thank you for the awesome libations as always, you guys are the best, and with regards to the hostesses, you ladies topped everything off with your wonderful greetings coming and going!!!
author: Rich L.

description:
I love, love, love Marlowe, so when I heard that the Marlowe team was taking over the old space on Washington Square Park I was stoked!  Not only is Park Tavern about 6 times as big as Marlowe, but they have kept all the Marlowe classics that we love.  

Being a huge Marlowe fan, I had to get the Marlowe burger - it is my favorite burger in the city after all.  I was kind of disappointed by the bread because some Yelp reviews had talked about a special hot roll and we were served simple Acme epi, which normally would be fine, but not when I was expecting something else.  My friend had the deviled eggs and raved about them.  He also had the burrata app with the fried lemons and loved the combo of the lemon, basil and creamy cheese.  The brussels sprout chips were as wonderful as ever.  My other friend had the whole hen over spinach and the presentation really was impressive.  

Park Tavern's idea of serving a monthly birthday cake is really cute, but unfortunately the November cake is carrot cake - seriously?  Who likes carrot cake?  I'll have to come back to try a cake people actually like.  But Park Tavern is still a great place in a neighborhood full of mediocre tourist traps.  The restaurant is very homey and comforting and the service was great.
author: Dana H.

description:
I love Park Tavern. The ONLY bad thing about it, is that it's soooo busy that you can never get a table.

I have eaten here twice and my boyfriend and I are obsessed.

Modern, fun, large space. They have a dining room and a bar area with a communal eating table.

The deviled eggs are like little bites of heaven.
 The brussels sprout chips are so light and delicate.
The wild arugula salad is perfectly dressed.
The Steamed mussels were awesome with their light, fresh, sauce.
The Marlowe burger was impressive, well cooked, I think the horseradish aioli threw me off a little, but it was still delicious.
**FAVORITE is the Petit 'Poulet Rouge'  or roasted chicken**

Get a table way in advance!
author: caitlin k.

description: I didn't get to try the food, after waiting an hour for a table for lunch, I asked when I can expect to be seated (we have a baby and it was getting close to her nap time) to be told rudely "it will be ready when it's ready".. Understandably that was enough to not bother waiting any more.
author: Cyndi M.

description: Just like the original spot, the Marlow Burger is exceptional, but this spot has the added benefit of being a bit more professionally run.  The bartenders seem very seasoned.  I was given, without asking, a glass of water and as I went to cut my burger in half with a butter knife, was offered a steak knife.  Fries were perfectly done.  Burger is just the right size; not too messy.  Bun holds the juices and sauce well.  Beer was not quite cold enough and they could use better glasses for bottled beers (they just used a water glass), but those were minor and didn't bother me enough from enjoying the meal.  Not a cheap place, but classy burger and a beer will run you $24 all in.  Oh, and they did include that scam health care fee, which I hate, but again, not enough to lower a star.
author: Marc S.

description: The deviled eggs and a burger for a late night meal pretty much hit the spot.  A good add to NB from the Marlowe folks.
author: Laurel B.

description: Great service, very professional! Extensive creative cocktails menu. The crispy polenta cakes were so creamy with perfectly poached eggs and rich wild mushrooms. Drinks were creative, fun and tasty! The ambience/stylish and modern decor was just as good as the food and service. Very friendly, stylish and yummy!
author: Stacy R.

description: Excellent food on Washington Square in North Beach.  Good choice, esp if there's long wait at other nearby popular spots.
author: Craig G.

description: The decor and ambiance are absolutely wonderful. We tried the lemon chips with burrata for the appetizer - delicious and refreshing! For drinks: Double Isaac and Country Lawyer, both strong with full flavor. Dinner was fantastic as well with large portions. We ordered the mussels and steak -traditional French and New American flavors together. The only thing that took away from the experience was our waiter. He didn't do anything wrong; he just performed his duties only. For such a nice restaurant, decor, food, we expected more. We would definitely go again, though.
author: Pick P.

description: Food was good, nice ambiance and the service was good. Comparable to a lot of the better brunch places in the city.
author: Anup K.

description:
Good service and atmoshpere. The food was delicious and not over priced. I came here because of the Thrillist best brunches and it is one of the best brunch of SF. 

I will recommend it to my friends and probably come back again
author: Antonin L.

description:
Really enjoyed the restaurant. Great location, the place is amazing inside, very chic and sophisticated at the same time.  

The food was tasty for the most part, however there were a few misses:

The good: The warm bread rolls, the fried green tomatoes, the brussel sprout chips, the defiled eggs,  the pork chop (probably one of the best around), and of course the burger. The chicken looked good and tasted good, it was just a project unto itself to eat the thing, and the coconut cake was amazing 

The not so good:  The pork belly bites, usually anything with pork belly is a hit, however all we got was deep fried fat, it was pretty gross. The salads, they tasted ok however they are tiny portions, a few bites and it's all gone.

The table service was fantastic. the front of the house service was fine, just be warned that if you and your dinner party arrive on time and prior to a celebrity (in this case Tyler Florence) you'll only be sat after said celebrity is taken care of...a bit rude, but the food made up for it. Can't wait to go back.
author: Dilly M.

description:
Since I'm a fan of Marlowe and I happened to be hungry and in North Beach the other night, I tried Park Tavern.

I was alone, so I only managed to eat 3 dishes, and 2 of them weren't very good. But the 3rd was so good that I'll reserve judgement until I explore more of their menu.

I started with the raw Alaskan halibut, a "flavor-decorated sashimi" type dish, 5 small pieces of the fish sprinkled with flavor add-ons. Rather uninvolving I thought, compare this to the Hamachi shots at Alexander's. Simple sashimi either needs to be the highest quality fish such that adornment is unnecessary, or throw so much flavor at it that it's an explosion. This is somewhere inbetween, and reminded me of the pathetic "look at me I'm fancy food but really I have no taste because nobody actually put effort into this dish" hors d'oeuvres they often serve at upscale catered parties.

I downed that with a glass of the Laurent-Perrier Brut, lovely and toasty.

I next had the Manila Clam Chowder, which imnsho completely missed the target. There's not much need or way to re-invent creamy clam chowder; there are hundreds of recipes and variations, and the whole thing is a known quantity. Stick with traditional preparations and just use high quality ingredients.

Park Tavern seems to be trying to re-invent clam chowder, so the soup is not as creamy as traditional, and the clams are whole, not chopped. The problem is that the clams are very salty and well, clammy, so chopping them distributes both the flavor and the salt throughout the chowder. What you get at Park Tavern is instead a relatively weak base with occasional whole clams that commandeer all your taste buds in a salty, under the boardwalk kind of way. I give them a B for effort, but the end result should be scrapped.

But then we get to the pork chop, which was not only the best pork chop I've had in 15+ years, but was cooked perfectly, exactly the way I asked for it. Too many restaurants overcook pork because of old school fears of trichinosis, and even a brined chop can be very tough. I specifically asked the waiter how tender the chop was, and told him how much I hate dry pork. Well, there was no need for concern because it was buttery smooth, perfectly pink, and so good I was gnawing at the bones afterwards. I'd go back just for that chop.

I didn't try the desserts, but the very limited selection seemed perfunctory, as if they don't have a dessert chef.

I'll have to try the Marlowe burger to see how it compares.



Edit September 2013: I've now eaten at Park Tavern probably 5 times since my first review, and they keep getting better. I've raised my rating one star in appreciation, it's my go-to restaurant in NB. I've had so many good meals there now, I guess they keep vetting the menu to remove things that are not so good and keeping the things that are. The last time I was there 3 of my party had Marlowe Burgers, but I didn't, they all thought it delicious, and one of them had been to Marlowe and tried it there.
author: Rob C.

description: Came for a company party.  Great appetizers & drinks.  My steak was overcooked though. super bummed.....  I'd like to come back and check out their brunch.
author: CherryIcee S.

description:
Scallops with Cauliflower, nice presentation, fast serving, small portion. Cauliflower too salty.

Wine and Drinks nice and good selection.

Creme Brule, burnt to death.
author: Wolfgang I.

description:
I was looking forward to the opening of Park Tavern for months and could not have been happier to finally go check it out last weekend. So glad there is finally a little variety in eateries lining Washington Square Park!

I love the ambiance; dim lighting, view of the park, seating arrangements with a long family style tall table by the bar. The staff were all attentive, friendly and offered great suggestions. I remember hearing complaints about the service when Joey and Eddie's occupied the space so it was great to find that was not the case.

Sat at the long table with two dinner guests; we were right in the thick of conversations, cocktails, and delicious food...it was perfect for a Saturday evening girls dinner.

Starters:
1.Deviled eggs 
- Delicious! Served as singles so we ordered 1/each. Love the bacon on top and will go back for more :)
2. Burrata 
- Pretty good...I am a big burrata fan and may just be being snotty but It was tasty and I would recommend it; just not the best I have had.
3. Prawns
 - Very tasty...the sauce was a little spicy (how I like it!) and made for a good sauce to sop up with the table bread.

Entrees:
1. Pork Chop
- Really liked the dish as a whole, well prepared and enjoyed it. We all 3 shared each of the starters and entree's. 
2. Arugula Salad
- The server mentioned this salad was popular and I can see why. It was flavorful and since none of the other dishes we got had much green it was refreshing to include a salad.
3. Mussels
- Yum! I love mussels and thought these were really good. Loved using the broth to dip table bread in and the sausage was a nice touch.

Great first experience and can't wait to come back for more!
author: Amanda S.

description:
Had dinner here last night. Wow! This place is hoppin' on a Wednesday night! 

The one negative of our evening was the long wait we experienced before we were seated. This was most likely due to the fact that this is a newer restaurant, and there is a shortage of this type of fare in the North Beach Area. It was just full to the brim with people! We arrived exactly on time for our reservation, but our table wasn't ready for about 20 minutes. I was about to get upset when, out of nowhere, a glass of champagne appeared for my troubles. We're back on track!

Shortly after, we were taken to our seats and our server gave us a rundown of the menu and the specials. We couldn't hear her though - it's fairly loud in there - definitely buzzing.

We ordered:

Demons on horseback - believe the hype, yummy
Scallops - very nice
Steak and fries - very nice
Twice baked potato - The top layer was great, but the bottom was burned. Fail. 
Caramelized onion and mushroom soup - interesting flavor, but prob wouldn't order on a regular basis.

Oh, and I've had the Marlowe burger at Marlowe, and it's nothing short of fantastic!

It's a great atmosphere in there (especially with the beautiful Christmas tree they have up right now), and the food is pretty solid overall with interesting twists. Definitely worth trying :)
author: Baby Bear G.

description:
I have only been for drinks, so I'll have to remember to update when I go back to eat.  We did try to make a reservation but couldn't get in, we tried to make it on Saturday afternoon for Saturday night, so next time we'll try earlier!
I went with a couple of friends on a Saturday night.  We were lucky enough to get some barstools at the bar.  The bartenders were awesome, a lot of fun!  They were joking around with us and having a good time while getting the drinks out quickly and well made!  
The setup is cool.  The bar is on one side with a long bar to sit at, a long communal type table behind it and a couple little tables.  No TV.  
The dining room is next door but visible through the bar.  The kitchen is also open in the back of the dining room.  
I will definitely be back to eat, the menu looked very good, and all of the food going by us looked yummy!
author: Stephanie J.

description:
We ate here last night and it was perfection  We arrived about 8:30 pm with no reservations and the place was packed.  The hostess offered us the "chef's table" which we ended up loving and would even ask to sit there next time (it's not for everyone though as you do sit on stools with no backs, but we enjoyed the quieter area and watching them cook)

We had a carafe of the Gruner Veltliner and it was delicious.  Our server was very knowledgeable about wine choices

We had the deviled eggs, the halibut with corn and sea beans, this incredible bowl of Manila clam chowder, and the Park Tavern Waldorf salad (the only neg of the evening due to its skimpiness).

By this time we were too full for any entrees.  We did notice the hamburger and the fried oysters were the most ordered items that evening.

We managed to fit in the huckleberry cheesecake parfait and loved it

We can't wait to go back.
author: Foodlover B.

description:
A delightful setting for my birthday meal with two long-time friends.

The deviled eggs are certainly the hit, and I'm glad I ordered two. The steak crudo and pork belly bites are serviceable but hardly standouts. The clam chowder is quite unique, and I'm still - to this day - unsure whether I would select this soup again. By the time the pork chop and cheeseburger arrived, I wasn't as hungry and thought they were almost unnecessary for our meal.

The decor is bold and bright, giving the sense of old-time glamour and spaciousness. The draft beer selection is above average. I left in good spirits, and my bike ride home to the Panhandle was super easy on this unusually warm night back in late September.
author: Randy M.

description:
Park Tavern is a pretty good restaurant with fabulous restaurant prices.  

My husband and I ate here with friends on a visit to San Francisco.  The place was packed in the bar area, so I was pleasantly surprised that the tables weren't too close together.  

Cocktails were good (I had the Washington Square - yummy!).  For starters, we shared the brussel sprout chips (meh) and the smoked deviled eggs (yum!).  For my main course, I had the "Marlowe" burger (which I was told is one of their signature dishes).  It was good, but nothing to write home about (I guess I had to know what a $15 hamburger tastes like and now I know it tastes exactly like a $6 hamburger).  My husband had the cab steak, which was also good but average good.

Overall, I had a good meal at Park Tavern, but would probably try someplace else next time I'm in SF.
author: Rachel P.

description: Very poor service and sub par food. Went there for a late lunch on Friday afternoon. We waited 15 minutes for our waiter after being seated. After receiving our meal the waiter never returned to check on us. When my daughter joined us (about 15 minutes after getting our meal) still no sign of our waiter. After she sat with us for 20 minutes she went to the hostess and asked for our waiter. Another waiter showed up and finally took her order. We didn't see our original waiter until he gave me the check. I won't be going back.
author: L R.

description:
Excellent service. We waited a bit longer than expected and they gave us complementary appetizers.

The food was very good. The group had the burger, poached eggs + polenta, french toast.  All were good to excellent although the french toast wasn't anything particularly special.

Overall, a really nice brunch experience and great atmosphere.
author: BRIAN Y.

description:
Food was great. Atmosphere was great. Waiter was great.

The three stars is solely for the host. We had a reservation for 9:30pm, arrived early, and was told we would be seated right on time. While it was only 9:40ish when we were seated, I guess my face was not doing a great job of hiding my frustration. The host came over, offered to screw over a table who "checked in first" because they seemed "much happier" than we did. He offered us a round of champagne when we were seated, but the attitude the entire time was not appreciated. I understand that things run late and you can't help it if people are taking longer than expected, but there is no need to be rude. 

Luckily our waiter was fantastic so that initial experience didn't ruin our whole night.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Park Tavern exceeded my already high expectations for it. I went here for my grandma's 80th birthday brunch and was truly impressed. The ambiance and service at the place are spectacular. The food is original and quite delicious. My only hope is that they might add a few more items to the menu. I was also unimpressed by the brunch drinks. Their Bloody Mary was way too spicy and I am still not sure what they were trying to accomplish with their Tequila Based Bloody Mary as it came out in an odd green color and had a rather odd flavor to it.

Ordering Advice:
I see that people have been writing about the toast below. I actually found the toast to be quite delicious. It is a little bit expensive and rather basic, but there is something quite original and truly delicious in the toast creations that they have made. If you are in a large group, they are a great starter.

For main courses I would recommend the duck pate sandwich and the polenta. Both were so delicious.

I will definitely be frequently attending brunch at park tavern in the future.
author: Bennett D.

description:
Went here Friday night and got a table for 2 with no wait even though the place was packed - Score!

Ambience: 

Very noisy, maybe not the place for large groups.

Food: 

Deviled Eggs - You can only taste the bacon, no deviled egg flavor.

Oyster Caesar Salad - Very Good! Oysters perfectly crunchy on the outside and creamy on the inside. Fun idea too.

Bread/Butter - We were talked up on the butter/pork fat - I did  not care for it. Hard to describe, not creamy just bacon fatty, but not salty.

Burger - Total disappointment. Fries and horseradish aioli were good. But there was very little beef, and no beef flavor. Lots of bacon.

Clam Chowder - Soo good. No potatoes or starch, just creamy, salty with very fresh tasting clams. Highly recommend. 

Service:

Our server Rachel was awesome! Very helpful recommendations, very attentive, made our visit great.
author: Yessica W.

description: Fantastic atmosphere!! Split some apps and a burger with my boyfriend to make the meal affordable, but everything was delicious! Next time I might splurge and get their signature chicken dish - it looked so good.
author: Allison S.

description:
Park Tavern is in a prime location overlooking Washington Square Park, itself a crown jewel in the charming neighborhood of North Beach.

The difficulty in getting to the restaurant is eased by their valet parking, which is all but a necessity in North Beach. Easily worth the eleven dollar fee plus tip to not put yourself through trying to find parking anywhere in that vicinity.

We began the evening by sipping on a PT Old Fashioned and an Ed's Negroni while perusing the menu. These drinks were strong and gave us the impression that Park Tavern is going for an old school, no-nonsense approach to their cocktails. While the bartenders could certainly whip up one, don't count on seeing anything featuring egg whites on the drink menu. It also made me realize how firmly ensconced I am in new school cocktail culture. Guess I'm a wuss.

For food, we started with the NY Steak crudo, horseradish, arugula & parmesan, and the PT fries, shaved black truffle & parmesan, truffle aioli, soft boiled egg & Osetra caviar. The presentation of each was great, the fries arriving in a small urn and the crudo plate sparsely yet artfully decorated with steak, arugula and parmesan. We would have preferred that the dish arrive with a third more steak than it did, but the quality was high. Those fries were *really* good. Every bit worth the twenty dollar price. With the shaved truffles on top, dipping the fries in that egg and caviar was pretty darn divine.

We followed those nice starters with the Petit "Poulet Rouge", Bloomsdale spinach & Peewee potatoes, and the Angus Filet Mignon, twice-cooked potatoes, creamed greens & black turnip mushrooms. The standup chicken ended up requiring a lot of work to consume, but it was moist and flavorful. The filet mignon was marvelous. A generous portion that was soft and juicy, with a wonderful flavor. The juice alone elicited several 'MMmmmms' from yours truly. Both chicken and steak lay in a bed of spinach and potatoes that was tasty and complimentary.

We washed down the entrees with glasses of the Fisticuffs Cabernet Sauvignon and the Segromigno Sangiovese. I hemmed and hawed between the Cab and the Tierra Secreta Malbec. Should have gotten the latter, as I felt the Cab was a bit sweet for the steak. The tannic Malbec would have made a better pairing.

We finished up with Lemon Cheesecake Parfait and one of those boozy floats. The French 125 featured Prosecco, lemon sorbet and maybe a splash of bourbon. The parfait tasted every bit as good as it looked. Marvy.

The waiter was fairly friendly and certainly knowledgeable. The wait staff overall was attentive without being ever-present.

The noise level here is lively, encouraging you lean in a bit to hear each other. It's not however so loud that you can't hear yourself think.

The bill plus tip had us shelling out just over two bills. Not surprising given the environs and quality of the food, but also not something that we could do very often. I'd give Park Tavern five stars if the bill was 15% less.

We did like the decor and the ambiance of the place, and the wall of windows were great to take in the beauty and charm of Washington Square Park.

I'm sure that we'll be back, provided that they don't lose that valet parking...
author: Steve R.

description: My partner and I had a delicious dinner to ring in the new year on 01/02. I am gluten free and had no problems whatsoever having my order altered to suit my needs. I appreciated their cocktail selection. We loved the fresh cheese and persimmon appetizer. The pole beans were garlic-heavy and delightful. I got the sole and was licking my plate. My partner's pork chop rivaled the sole. For dessert we went with the Almond Joy and some coffee, which was just enough food to feel full and spent. The view of the park is nice also. Service was sufficient. The seating was a bit tight for my taste (though luckily I was with a sexy man, so getting close wasn't as much of an issue). I would recommend a dinner out at Park Tavern!
author: A. L.

description: I think this is such a great restaurant. The ambiance and location is fantastic. The staff is very professional and they always do their best to find a table for guests. The food is great (especially brunch). I'd highly recommend.
author: Karina S.

description: This place is great. Came with a girlfriend and had some awesome appys. Highly recommend the brussel sprouts!
author: Teresa L.

description: Great place!  Love the wine and aperitif selection.  Awesome brunch selection - burger was great, the corn beef hash with red wine jus was awesome, baguette with various jam - great!  Was a nice place to visit after a run in the Marina.
author: Koalie W.

description:
Grab a seat at the bar or the communal. Bartenders got the service to the T:-)
Ordered the burger and  the whole chichen both were solid.  Great selection of wine. Dont understand the hype with the Brussel sprout chips...they were just meh..
If you're looking for excellent service and solid food def give it a try.
author: Sofie Z.

description: This place is classy. The food is amazing. The atmosphere is high class, but inviting to all. There is a wait, but I think it was worth it. They welcomed  my child in right away. Now about the food, amazing. This is high class food. I ordered a duck egg sandwich. Never had one before, but amazing. The breakfast cake and French Toast delicious. The drinks were a little pricey (coffee and orange juice). The prices were high, but we loved the food, so much that I would treat my self again and go back. Our check for 2 entrees, starter bread, 2 Coffee, orange juice, side order of bacon was $60 w/o tip. FYI you will probably have to wait, but I thought it was worth it.
author: Cory M.

description: My current favorite by far.. as if the dinner wasn't amazing enough, the brunch is unreal. The polenta cakes, fritter, avocado toast, nut butters, pancakes- you name it! The drinks are fantastic as well. Park Tavern never lets me down.
author: Kate M.

description: Park Tavern is definitely in my top tier and several things - the burger, the Brussels sprout chips, the deviled eggs, the lemon chips - are all on my must order list.  However, last night something was just a bit off.  I wanted to impress my friend's husband as he runs a club on Cape Cod but, for some reason, everything was just okay.  Of course, Park Taverns' just okay is still about 10 notches above everyone else, but I just can't do that fifth star.  I'm sure it will be back, not giving up on my favorite space just yet.
author: Robert M.

description:
Came here with a group of friends and had such a good time we ended up staying until way past my weeknight bedtime. We shared a variety of appetizers (brussel sprout chips and deviled eggs were amazing) with our cocktails (both Washington Square and the McKinley were perfect - not too sweet but fresh and different). 

I had a pork belly and oyster special for dinner and tasted bites of a nice roasted chicken dish and indulgent steak. The waitstaff suggested some great wine (can't recall the name) to go with our mains. Don't miss the polenta side -- totally worth it even if there isn't really any more room in your stomach.

The restaurant space was gorgeous - warm, inviting and refined but still approachable. A good restaurant when you want to feel a little special but not too stuffy.
author: Allison G.

description:
I Heard good things so I was expecting an incredible meal. The place had Great atmosphere , great cocktails, but I was not happy with the food.
I ordered the NY Steak "Bar Steak"and got 2 half dollar sizes of a very dry steak and a plate full of very salty French fries $34. Granted I ordered it Medium , but a good chef should be able to prepare a good steak how ever you order it. My wife had the "Brown butter brussel sprouts" which were the miniature version 8$. They were good but not like other dishes I have had at other places that make you want to go back for more. She also had the twice backed potatoes which just tasted like some mash potatoes with cheese on top 8$. The other couple in our group pre ordered the "Poulet noir" which looked and smelled amazing , but when tasted also was dry 29$. We all had the "Smoked devil eggs" which were extremely good! 2$ ea.
The couple also ordered the "Braised pork cheeks" which he never finished due to the fact it was cold and he bit into something gritty. 15$ The wait staff was very good and on the ball. If it was not for the food I would have given 5 stars. I don't like giving a bad review , but for the price I expected a lot more.
author: Jeremy B.

description: Came here for Brunch- SOOO DELICIOUS.  I had the corn beef hash, and avocado toast.  Also really great mimosas!  Me and my friend had to wait a bit to get our order taken, and they ended giving us a discount on our bill.  I will definitely be back!
author: Susan H.

description: This is a place where you can come to indulge in decadent brunch food and mimosas after partying hard the night before :p.  My group of friends was STARVING and after we told the waitress that, the food came out wicked fast.  Service was excellent and friendly.  Parking kinda sucks, but it always does in that area.  Worth a revisit.
author: Pam S.

description:
Park Tavern is new.  And it shows in some things that will get better with time.   Water was replenished with the liquid ending in my glass and the ice on the table.  Timing of some plates coming out of the kitchen was a bit off.  As I say, things like this work themselves out.  Likewise the menu.  A bit more trial and error.  One point of improvement would be the rolls served with dinner.  Unexceptional to the point of being what you find in the supermarket.

However, they don't need to do anything to perfect the deviled eggs with jalapeno and bacon.  Wonderful.

A Waldorf salad was also really good although more of the early autumn greens on the plate would have been welcome.

I ordered the caramelized onion and wild mushroom soup that came with a poached egg and brusselkraut knowing that I don't particularly care for onion soup. I was curious.  As expected, I didn't care for the onion soup but loved the mushrooms.  The egg added nothing to the soup and I couldn't taste the brusselkraut.  

A main of grilled pork chop served medium came with butter bean pistou, dinosaur kale, toasted garlic & chili flakes.  The pork was tender but the stars of the plate were the beans and kale. These were just wonderful.  I felt that some of the spicing (perhaps the pistou) detracted from the taste of the perfectly tender pork.  

All in all a very good addition to the food scene.
author: David D.

description: This place is perfect.  They somehow got everything right.  The decor, the tile, the ambience, the vibe, the lighting the clientele, the bar, and last but not least, the food.  This is a special place for a romantic date, or a great place to witness the SF scene in full swing.  Must order the poulet.  I've had Poulet Rouge, Poulet Vert, and recently Poulet Noir.  All very different and all 3 are superb.  Must have appetizer: demons on horseback.  Smoked deviled eggs are a slam dunk.  Cocktail creations are also worth exploring:  LOVE the Mclaren and the Country lawyer best of all.
author: Isaac F.

description: I still dream about the deviled eggs....We got drinks at the bar first.  I liked the vibe and layout of the bar.  We waited an hour for a table on Thursday night, and it was well worth it.  The food was scrumptious.
author: Catherine T.

description:
I am still full from my meal at Park Tavern yesterday night. This is slightly uncomfortable, but I will chalk it up to the fact that I couldn't stop eating despite that my body was definitely telling me that my stomach was already too full to go on.

What's to love about Park Tavern:
- Lovely decor and great location central to North Beach and across from Washington Square Park
- Hostess was super friendly, which is so important as they make the first impression. I mixed up the dates for my reservation and came in on the wrong date (seriously, this is the only time this has ever happened to me!) and the hostess was able to accommodate us on a friday night. THANK YOU! 
- Since we were sharing the two entrees that we ordered, the server offered to split them up for us, which honestly never happens as an offer from other restaurants. 
- We had been waiting for a while on the Marlowe burger and our server came over to us to tell us he had checked on it and it was being plated. Thanks for taking the initiative. 
- Grilled pork chop was absolutely amazing! Wish it had more yellow peaches though. 
- They have cocktails named for SF landmarks. Love love love. 

Now the not so great things:
- WOW parking is so terrible around here. They do have valet ($11), so use it if you are terrible at finding parking or just take MUNI.  
- Had high expectations for the Marlowe burger and only thought it was OK. Not a burger to write home about

I would highly recommend this restaurant. Next time, I'll have to try more of the items from the smoked/cured/fried sections. I can't believe I didn't order the deviled eggs!
author: Pauline S.

description: A friend and I had an awesome breakfast here. The food was excellent and our waiter was very attentive, friendly and funny. We did order 2 deviled eggs just because we saw them serving it a lot. It was so good, I highly recommend getting one to try it, even if you're having something else. Will be back.
author: Laila B.

description: this "update to my update" is long overdue. i'll keep it short and sweet. i've been back to PT about a half dozen times since my last review, for brunch and dinner. and... BOOM! we're back in business! across the board, everything has been excellent - the food, the cocktails, the service. so happy my favorite go-to spot is back and better than ever. thanks to the PT team!
author: Connie S.

description: Made a random decision to stop in for brunch after searching for interesting options on OpenTable. One of the best decisions I made during my time in SF. The deviled eggs are HEAVEN, yall. Also, service was amazing and my server always made sure my glass was full and our food was to our satisfaction. My friend had the avocado toast, which was amazing for a light lunch. I got the burger. Great hangover cure because all I could think about was how awesome the burger tasted. Great experience and has all sorts of food options!
author: Ross L.

description: Great place for happy hour or to take visitors if you're in North Beach. Gotta get there early to grab a spot at the community table or bar. Definitely gets busy and people start eyeballing your seat in the evening. Nice wine list and cocktail menu. The truffle fries, brussels sprout chips, and the deviled eggs are memorable! Will be back for brunch!
author: Cindy A.

description: This place is amazing and has wonderful staff. The food is great and cocktails are delicious. My friends and I got there before our reservations and though there wasn't any table available, the hostess Adrian did her best to accommodate us. She checked on us to make sure we were okay and when a table became available she informed us right away. Though I live in LA, I will make sure to come visit Park Tavern soon and I recommend this restaurant/bar to everyone visiting the beautiful city of San Francisco.
author: Nicole R.

description: Food was terrific, service was attentive and atmosphere was awesome. I just wish they did not try so hard to turn tables.
author: Michael C.

description:
We recently had our wedding reception in the Eden Room (32 guests) and we can't speak more highly of our experience. The food was incredible, the service was even better. There was always someone there to take care of our requests happily and without hesitation. Montana, the private events director, was very helpful and took care of everything on the day of the event just as we had discussed. 

My mom is vegan, so we requested a special entree for her (we were eating family style). Not only did they give her a special entree, but every other dish that they could modify for her, they did. They really went above and beyond to take care of us.

The nice thing about the Park Tavern menu is that it is accessible to a lot of people with different tastes. It balances familiar comfort food with interesting and innovative combinations so that there's something for everyone and people can explore without feeling out of place. We heard positive feedback on the food from everyone in our group!
author: Danae M.

description:
Reservations were made weeks in advance for a friend's birthday dinner. Staff were a half hour late seating us and then to a round that would comfortably seat five set up for six (which was tight) until we reminded them we were seven. They reset the table for seven--it was ridiculous. I got nowhere with the host staff "if you want to wait another hour we'll have something". Are you kidding me? Finally the floor manager came and offered that we could start our night at the round and once the two fours behind us finished dessert, we could move. We agreed. She sent over a couple of appetizers, which was a much appreciated gesture, and had the rest of the evening gone well, that and switching tables would have been enough to save the evening. As it was, the service at the round was poor and /beyond/ slow, but at least we got to move before the main course came (over an hour after we ordered it). I will admit some of the food was delicious (Brussels sprout chips! Pumpkin soup!) but my salad was meh and awfully small for twelve bucks, my NY steak was tough as shoe leather, but at that point I had to just eat it and go because the birthday girl was late getting to her party because we spent three hours at the fricken restaurant! I couldn't wait to leave anyway. The place was /so/ loud and crammed.

I felt bad for our second server. I give her top marks. She was no-nonsense, efficient, and did her best to recover the evening for us. I wish I had gotten her name. Management if you read these? Hang on  for dear life to the 40ish bleach blond with the glasses and ponytail who worked the dinner shift on Friday the 25th. 

Note: after we were moved they crammed /another/ party of seven into that small round. It was a bunch of very young women who were clearly cramped but either too timid or otherwise unable to manage to get their party moved. We watched them elbow each other and constantly shift in their chairs as staff tried to move around them and thought, "well, at least we got to eat our dinner without getting hit in the teeth".

Will not go back.
author: Miz J.

description: The place was loud and busy in a good way.  I had a couple deviled eggs, an awesome blue cheese salad and the best poultry dish I have ever had.  The stuffing that was part of the roasted hen was the best I have had in my life.  No more stuffing just for Thanksgiving.  Also- how cool to be right in the middle of North Beach looking at a stunning church and park.  My wife and I stayed in the Financial District and it was a great walk to Park Tavern.
author: Sean P.

description: Awesome buttermilk pancakes. Can't remember any better. Carlos was a great waiter as well. Really great service.
author: Conor N.

description:
we came here on a sunday night and the place was full!  from the bar and communal table to the dining room.  people were drinking, sunday night? eating and having a good time.  it was a bit hard to hear in there.  looks like they have acoustic soundboard on the ceiling but the noise was quite loud.

we started with the melon salad which we split.  but they split it for us and it looked kind of sad split.  some slices on melon and greens on a place.  with pickled grapes.  also tried the duck liver pate and it was very liver-y.  warm bread and softened butter.  

for main, i had the seafood special which was octopus, calamari, scallops with carrots and potatoes. i didnt like the octopus. but i think its an acquired taste.  they did the bay scallops in two little soy sauce dishes which was weird for presentation.  they were overcooked and i didnt like them.  an uni nage covered all the seafood and i couldve licked the plate clean of the sauce if we had not been with company.  also im not a huge fan or uni but the sauce was rich and tasty.

to finish we had the peach cobbler which came out piping hot. yum!

service was good. they kept our water glasses full.  stabilized our teetering table and started to get our car for us from valet when we got the bill.

this place is bigger and better than marlowe.  they have the full bar. an extensive menu and less of the salt.
author: claudia y.

description:
There isn't too much to say about this place other than it's a must try. 5's all around from service, atmosphere to food and the food is as good as it gets. 

I have been for dinner and brunch, both are amazing. 

Tip: If you go for brunch you have to check our their selection of "toasts", our table only ordered two and wished we had tried them all!
author: Jessy B.

description: Went here for brunch. Definitely make a reservation for this place on the weekend to avoid a wait.  I booked the day before and was able to get the time I wanted.  The inside is open and spacious and they have outdoor seating for a warm day.  The polenta and poached eggs is the go to item.  And the chalah cinnamon & sugar toast is delicious.  They have fun, creative twists on cocktails.  I usually get the burger which is good, but this time was a little on the salty side.  Our server, without me asking, immediately took it off and offered up something else.  Awesome customer service!
author: Paige D.

description: I have been to park tavern multiple times and there is not one thing on the menu short of amazing - dishes and cocktails. Amazing service and the patio on the park is a brunch must on a beautiful sf day.
author: Chelsey S.

description: The food here is extremely salty.  Also BEWARE when you eat here and pay with credit cards... I wrote in a tip amount and they added more to my final bill... good thing I double check my receipts with my credit card statements!!  -THEY TRY TO RIP YOU OFF!!!
author: Jen L.

description: Soo good!  Our server was so nice/helpful, and the polenta cakes/avocado toast were absurd.
author: Renee E.

description:
I'd heard nothing but great things about this place and was prepared to love it but, meh.  The brussels sprouts chips are ok. The lemon chips are amazing as are the fried sunchokes. Butter lettuce wedge was swimming in a puddle of sweet watery dressing (couldn't taste anything but sweet).  Chicken was tasty but the stuffing was completely burned...stuck to the skillet and not in a good crispy way, just completely burned on.  The service was GREAT.
Not sure I'd bother to make the trek to N.Beach to give it another go.
author: Ann B.

description:
The decor that was once Moose's was comfortable and appealing. If you're dropping in just for a drink, good luck since the whole bar area was filled with diners and this is not the watering hole like Moose's or Washington Square Bar & Grill was.  

As for the food, the deviled egg was simple and delicious ($2 each for a small egg) and the brussell sprout chips were good. Since we were pressed for time we ordered the Marlowe burger which was good, but I've had better gourmet burgers for less than $14. 

Overall the food was good and the service was excellent, making for a nice dining experience. I will have to come back to try their pork chops, other appetizers, and sample some of their unique cocktails. 

FYI...reservations are hard to come by on a short notice so plan ahead.
author: Gary T.

description: Been here 4 times since it opened.  This place never fails us.  The food is always great, the ambiance is warm and the restaurant is well-staffed.  My favorite dishes are the deviled eggs and pork chop.
author: Sharon C.

description: This review is just for the EDEN LOUNGE upstairs. What a cool find this was! We walked in without a dinner reservation & of course, couldnt get seated right away. But we were directed to the lounge upstairs, which was really cozy, had a swanky feel & you could order some of the appetizers & the burger (which is really what we came for) while having your cocktail. The room is really cool, with plump, velvet tufted or leather seats and a vintage feel. I felt bad for the ONE bartender who was trying to mix drinks AND serve them at the seats, as they were short staffed. But if you are in the area, stop by. Its cool way to start or end your night, and you will feel like you know a secret bar in town.
author: Jen S.

description: Ten yips for the crowd! Before entering the restaurant  a line of good looking people seated outside under heating lamps can be taken in. The space inside is vast but not cold. The menu has  a diverse enough range of items that anyone could be happy, yet it's a small menu. Out of 7 dishes 5 were excellent, one good and one whatever. I loved the atmosphere and the crowd. Anna, one of the owners, hand delivered a special drink to us. It was packed (definitely need a reservation) yet not noisy. Great experience- especially for the eye candy! Deviled eggs are so good!
author: Sarah A.

description: Great brunch with a unique menu.  Lived the (unsweetened) fruit dish and husband enjoyed his bruleed grapefruit.  Entrees were also good.  Top notch service.
author: Ottis M.

description:
amazing brunch.
great open front restaurant, sunny, airy, great park across the street.
crab toast was amaazing.
fruit plate apps were amazing.
salmon benedict was very average, only one egg.
french toast was good, nothing special. 
great service, very roomy with awesome decor.
author: Robbie B.

description: I visited Park Tavern on a Saturday morning after finding the line at Mama's wrapped around the corner. It was an especially gorgeous, clear, and sunny day in SF, and there happened to be one table open outside, so we grabbed it. My partner and I grabbed a couple Hummingbird cocktails, and they were delicious (St. Germain, grapefruit, and bubbly). We ordered the cinnamon sugar challah, pork confit hash, and the burger. All items were very good, but the absolute star of the meal were the potatoes. The fries with the burger and the homefries with the hash were super SUPER CRISPY. Which is exactly how I like them. So between that (good fries can really make my day, you know?), nice weather, friendly service, and tasty cocktails, I had a great time.
author: Terry N.

description: Since I saw Park Tavern on "Check Please", it has been high on my list to try.  We made a reservation and had a nice table in the front room facing Washington Park in North Beach - nice!  We started with the brussel sprout chips, which were highly recommended - lightly fried, crispy and tasty, loved it!  We shared a dungeness crab salad which was just right, refreshing and light with good-sized pieces of dungeness crab - yum!  Also, recommended on Check Please was the poulet noir (allow 30 minutes) - tasty, juicy and tender and very dramatically displayed propped up on a stand so you can easily carve the meat from the bone.  I got full so I took half of it home, but there's always room of dessert!  We got the TCHO chocolate creme brullee - creamy chocolate-y, nice.  Service was very friendly, helpful in giving recommendations for wine and entree choices.  Great location in North Beach and very solid food and service.  I will be back!
author: Maile N.

description:
What a disappointment.

Coming from the San Francisco Symphony's show, I was starving; and when I'm starving, I'm not picky.  We started off with the trout dip appetizer that came with their own chips which was only so so.  I'd rather have some unhealthy onion dip with kettle chips.  We also got the deviled eggs which are supposedly a "have to get"  item.  It was pretty good, but I don't understand what all the hype is about.  It comes with a piece of bacon on top that is just WAY too salty and it overpowers the egg completely.  I didn't really mind that these were only average dishes because I was so hungry.  Then, I ordered their black cod.  When the fish came, it looked shriveled like an old grandma's toe.  It tasted even worse.  It wasn't fresh at all; it was almost as if they let it sit in the corner of the kitchen floor for days!  And plus, they charged us up the hoo-hah for it! We sent it back immediately and instead of receiving a new menu to decide what I wanted, the waiter just said, "What do you want to order now?" pressuring me to make a last minute decision.  My dad piped in and said I'll take a burger.  Luckily I didn't have to wait long for it-- keep in mind that I was famished.  It was a just an average burger: nothing special and somewhat under seasoned.  After we all finished our entrees, I figured that maybe they could redeem themselves with dessert.  Nope.  However, I've complained enough, and you can probably figure out what I'm going to say.  I'll spare you, Park Tavern, from my rage.

Never again.
author: Stefanie T.

description: If your house burger is mediocre in a "Tavern" you have a problem. Poor service and a very limited menu. Stay away and save some money.
author: Sergio D.

description: Great staff, wonderful ambiance, unique dishes and great drinks.  What else can I say, Park Tavern is just 'solid'!  Wonderful outdoor people watching with a great view of the park.  Great to just stop in and hit the bar and the bar staff is friendly and quick.
author: kevin a.

description: Cristo offered the best wait service I have ever experienced! The recommendations he gave from everything from food to drinks were spectacular.
