Wish we could have sat outside with the view of Washington Square, but the bartender kept us very entertained. This place deserves its great Yelp reviews. Even the hostesses were friendly and professional.
author: Emily B.

description: We had a party of six and had a wonderful experience.  Our server did an excellent job and the food was excellent.  We had "Demons on Horseback" - bacon wrapped prawns - awesome! , Pork Chop - multiple people raved about this dish, Black Cod , Steak & Halibut.  Everyone loved their meal!  We'll  be back!
author: Kim D.

description: Cute atmosphere.  Everything is delicious.  Especially loved the fried pork belly bits and the chicken!
author: beverly l.

description: Had dinner at the bar a few nights ago and was served by Brian - a cracker for Jeremy Piven. The place was super busy, but he was more than happy to have a chat a share a few laughs - though not suer that just because I am grey I look like Taylor Hicks. Met a lovely bloke who runs a bar down the road and the fella who owns Toast in Noe Valley. Great food, lovely beer on tap and a good crowd. Can't wait to go back, and push this rating up to a 5.
author: Tony H.

description: Pros: Excellent food & great service! The PT fries are a MUST! Cons: Gets crowded fast & is loud! Be prepared to spend some cash because this place isn't cheap. Two drinks + two appetizers = $75 eek! Still worth it for the overall experience!
author: Erin R.

description: Everything that we had here was amazing--Wild arugula with mushroom conserva, porcini & charred onion vinaigrette, Demons on horseback, Brussels sprout chips. Everything was full of flavor. I'm a huge fan if SPQR's Brussels sprouts, but I must say Park Taverns are really good! Parking is a pain in north beach...glad they offer valet.
author: Valerie F.

description: Food was great! It was in a great spot and we had a good time until.....the valet service ruined my night. First it seems like they took my new Benz for a joy ride. Second I had a gps in my backseat and only when I got home do I realize it went missing. So I call the manager of that valet service and was only rude and incompetent. He told me that he couldn't do anything and basically to go F*** myself. So I lost a GPS and I had my car abused. Never going back there again.
author: Daniel M.

description: Lovely, for brunch and dinner. The venue is gorgeous with amazing woodwork and staff. Beautiful bar. Enjoyed a great brunch here with a friend, had reservations and I was absolutely delighted with not only how delicious the food was bud how friendly the staff was as well! Right by the park--when my family comes to town I plan on bringing them here for a treat of a meal. Prices are on the higher end, but well worth it. I'm excited to come back here for a fancy dinner with my girlfriends soon!
author: Rachel S.

description:
Park Tavern is amazing! A great addition to SF! I have nothing but great things to say about the place, staff, and food.

For starters, Anna was the first to greet us. She was very friendly and eager to seat us. Anna made us feel like important guests despite the fact that they were extremely busy with a full house. 

The wait staff was very attentive, we never had an empty glass! Our appetizers and entrees all came out in perfect succession of each other, we were never overwhelmed or waiting. And when the plates were finished they we were gone and out of the way.

The food was DELISH!! I still rave about and crave the brussel sprout chips, fried green tomatoes, homemade beef jerky and the burger and fries. Everything was so good! 

The wine director, Casey, was very knowledgeable about the wines and pairings and never steered us wrong. 

Great location, great service, great food, and an overall great experience. 
I cannot wait to get back as soon as possible!!
author: Chelsea D.

description:
I have such mixed opinion about my visit tonight that I wasn't sure that I should a review as it may be incoherent.

I think the experience started out on the wrong foot. We arrived 15 min before our reservation and the hostess had just left her station to seat another party.  Someone else asked us if we had been helped to which we said no and that we had reservations. He asked if we'd like to sit at the bar and wait for a few minutes or if we'd like to be seated right away.  We said we'd like to be seated.  He left and the hostess came back. I don't think there was time for the guy and the hostess to talk so she naturally asked us about our reservation. She then asked us to the bar area until our table was ready. Strange. Well, we did.  We barely ordered and got our drinks (5 min maybe?) when she came up to us to tell us our table was ready. Really? Why did you bother to tell us to go to bar? We asked if our bar tab could be transferred to the table and she said it was preferable that we take care of the bar tab first.  So, I had my husband go get seated white I paid the bar tab.  When I got to our table, I saw that most all the tables around us (about 6?) were all empty.  So, why did they make us go to the bar first only to come get us 5 min later?  Mind you, everyone (including the bartenders) was super friendly and nice.  They just created a slight inconvenience right up front.

Our server at the table started off a bit odd too. Just as she started to explain the special to us, she abruptly excused herself to help serve the food to the next table.  She then came back to finish explaining the special.  Really odd.  After that experience, service was almost flawless (almost because we asked for more bread but had to ask again before we got some).  If it weren't for the experience right up front, we would have rated the service at Park Tavern 5 stars (I'll explain later).

Deviled eggs, PT fries, and steak tartar (special of the night) were had for appetizers.  We really had come prepared to eat!  All were all great as we had expected and hoped.  We finished off the drinks from the bar and had the 2000 Caymus Cabernet that we brought with us decanted during appetizers.  (Corkage is $20, by the way.)

Dinner was seafood plate and filet mignon.  Both were completely forgettable and were a bit on the salty side (and I tend to eat a bit salty usually!). Filet wasn't what I expected (to melt in my mouth).  The twice cooked potatoes with the filet were too salty and creamed greens a  bit too mushy.

The real disappointment was the dessert.  Hubby had birthday cake because it was his birthday.  I ordered raspberry blueberry crisp and I couldn't take more than 2 bites (hubby took 2 bites too).  It was so salty and that flavor mixed with meyer lemon curd just made it inedible. The server offered to take it back and see if they could bring me another one without the sea salt (I asked no lemon curd either).  A different person (maitre d maybe?) came  by to tell me that the breading on top (the crisp par of the crisp) had salt in it already so he didn't think I would like it without any topping either.. He asked if I wanted another so I got the panna cotta.  (He was so nice and gracious!)  It was plain and a bit... yes, salty.  When the guy came by to ask how my dessert was, I didn't have the heart to tell him I didn't like it (hubby ate it b/c he hates to leave leftovers).  He was so genuinely nice!

When the check was brought, the server let us know that they didn't charge for either desserts.  Again superb service. 

How to rate?
author: Amy Y.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and eat at the bar quit often.  Last night I came in and there is a new menu which I absolutely it's easier to read and I wanted to try everything.  There is a classic selection from the Chef with stuff like beef jerky and deviled eggs which were delicious.  For my mains I wasn't super hungry so I went for the crab salad :-) which was light and fresh and delicious... My BFF went for the poulet noir which comes with stuffing and black truffle, WOW -:)

We sat at the Bar and Brian was just amazing.  Keep up the good work Park Tavern.
author: Hilma V.

description: I came to the City for the weekend, and stopped by Park Tavern for a mid afternoon cocktail and snack. The Paloma was delicious, and both appetizers we had (a flatbread and cottage cheese, avo, & watermelon plate) were divine. I will stop in the next time I'm in the Bay.
author: Sarah G.

description:
This place has potential, but it currently still has teething pains. Arrived on time for a Friday 9PM reservation, but the table wasn't ready yet. Instead of giving us a spiel about how it would only be 10-15 minutes, they gave us some free drinks. The drinks arrived fast, but our table was already prepared so they comped us the drinks. Nice!

Out of the deviled eggs from the appetizer list which bummed out the GF since she wanted to try them. Wait, out of deviled eggs? How can you run out of eggs? Anyway, by the time the table next to us ordered, they were out of 2 other appetizers. So yeah, teething pains. The raw halibut was great. The brussel sprouts were tasty, but had way too much lemon. Tell Juan to chill out with the lemon bottle. Appetizers came out quickly and promptly.

It took a while (20-30 minutes after apps cleared) for the main course. After arrival, the food was cold and my pork was undercooked. The GF's scallops were coldish, too. Dunno if this was a kitchen screwup or waitstaff, but I'm guessing kitchen. (The table next to us had similar delays). My pork was undercooked. I'm ok with the new pink-in-the-middle trend, but my pork was cold and red. Not medium, but more on the medium-rare to rare side. That aint cool. Luckily, the waiter came to check on us, I told him, he took it away and fixed it up. Upon returning he said he should have told me that's how they serve it and that it's "brined." I don't care if it's been irradiated. You can't serve pork that rare in a dark restaurant. Everyone will think it's way undercooked (mine was and it was cold). Plus, pork that rare doesn't have the same texture as beef. PT staff if you're reading this, make sure they cook the pork to medium! Food was good, once it was recooked and the GF's scallops were tasty.

Overall the ambiance is weird. It feels like a NYC boisterous alphabet soup lunch spot....yet they're mainly going after the dinner crowd. I can't quite put my finger on it. There are some great restaurants which are loud and dynamic like Galatoire's in NOLA. I just can't say what's off about this place, but something is. GF and I both think that we'll be going to Marlowe instead of PT in the future.

Service was excellent, so keep up the good work there.
author: Richard H.

description:
This weekend was my second visit to Park Tavern for brunch and the second time that I ordered the Confit Chicken and Potato Hash. Both times delicious. Already knowing what we wanted to order we skipped a starter... I wished that we would have ordered something because our food took longer than expected. Last month we started with the challah cinnamon and sugar toast. This would have been delightful to nimble on as we waited. Regardless of the food wait and PT running out of green tea, I will still be back to order Confit Chicken and Potato Hash or not ;)

We have also dined at the bar several times for dinner. My favorite part of our dinner meal, well dessert of course. PT has a birthday cake of the month based on the employee/s birthdays. Not a good place for me to go if I am trying to kick my sweet tooth.
author: Rachel S.

description: I have attended this amazing establishment several times and was never disappointed. It IS crowded, and all that (like most other places in North Beach), but the food is phenomenal: I will drive down here from Mountain View for the fries alone... On a more serious note: what makes the food great here is not just the fresh ingredients but the meticulous detail that goes into every dish; The above mentioned fries have the standard fancy restaurant truffle oil and some greens, BUT they also come with three dipping sauces: something truffle oil based (yummy), egg yolk (yummy-yummy), black caviar (foaming at the mouth yummy), this great attention to detail and thoughtful preparation extends to all other items on the menu I have tried. If you are in the area and the wait time is less then 30 minutes you simply owe it to yourself to try this place out. Period... oh, and whatever you do, don't forget to order the fries ;)
author: Alexander P.

description: Excellent drinks, food, and service for brunch. If you are looking for a stylish place that is worth the money, look no further than Park Tavern!
author: Geoffrey A.

description: Park Tavern offered to have us return for a "re-do", on their dime.  This time our experience was much better.  The food was excellent, the right temperature, and brought to us at the right time.  There's a nice energetic ambience and the restaurant is tastefully designed.  The overall service was much better, and the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and were very attentive.  However, Park Tavern, like many contemporary restaurants in SF, has a service format that is annoying, in that you have no single, high quality server responsible for your table.  So you get asked the same questions over and over.  We kept on having to repeat to different staff that "no, we are not ready to order" and "no, we are not done with our plates or our cocktails".  In this way we again felt a bit rushed.  And again, we were not asked if we wanted drinks or wine in conjunction with the arrival of our food.  The table service is the only reason I didn't give Park Tavern 5 stars.  All things considered, we would definitely return for another meal or cocktails.
author: Jonathan H.

description: Just an overall excellent meal!! We both had the filet of beef and it was deeelish!!! Served on a bed of these amazing potatoes with crispy skins and yummy creamy greens. And the prawns w pork fat app was equally excellent. We will certainly be back!!
author: Susan S.

description: Park Tavern is my favorite weeknight restaurant in the city. The place is always busy, in a good way, but I've never actually made a reservation, and only sat down at a table a couple times (all outside). More than a dozen times I've walked in with a couple friends and found space at the huge communal table, or at the bar. The drinks are great, this gin drink called the Maclaren is my go to, and the food has never disappointed. It can be incredibly rich so I've learned to order a bit less than I'm tempted to get. The bday cake is a fun touch and the staff is always great. The bar and hostess staff in particular is good. The waiters/waitresses that service the communal table seem to rotate a lot. Despite going often I rarely recognize them. Park Tavern gets me to North Beach than anything else there.
author: Tucker H.

description: Great burger. Brussels sprout chips good too. Wine list OK. Service good. I don't like eggs but my friend said they were good. And they had bacon on top which is always a plus! Oh, not great acoustics - hard to hear when it's busy.
author: Teresa B.

description: Went here for brunch. Nothing you couldn't do at home in under 30 min but nothing tasted bad. So pretty meh.
author: Soyan M.

description:
I love what they've done with this space. It's restored to an upscale place for dining. That said, I prefer dining at the bar, because I like the look of a large, well-done bustling dining room but the feel of a cozy bar dining experience. 

The cocktails are fun and really well done, and the bartenders are professionals. 

The menu has a lot of delicious options, and great items for sharing.  Some of the standouts I've tried include the crudo preparations, a sweet summer corn soup, the burger, the brussel sprout chips, and a spinach egg dish (which is part of an amazing, decadent weekend brunch menu).
author: Grace R.

description: I visited this restaurant for a brunch tasting, and it was incredible. The menu is beyond creative--it redefines delicious. The environment is hip without being overbearing or snooty. A definite 5 star!
author: Brianna S.

description:
This restaurant is soooo yummy and the staff is amazing.  My friend was visiting from out of town and his flight was delayed twice. Both times I called the hostess and she accommodated my new time and even asked my friend how his flight was when we finally arrived. 

We got the deviled eggs (delicious and I don't usually like deviled eggs), beef jerky (YOU HAVE TO ORDER THIS- you will never be able to eat non-wagu beef jerky again), the marlow burger (even better than the original at Marlowe), and the whole chicken.  I will admit the chicken was kind of intimating being on a stand looking like it was going to start dancing at any moment, but it was so good.  Lastly we finished up with the almond joy dessert.  ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!?! I have been dreaming of it since.  

Everything about this place was fantastic and I cannot wait to go back!
author: G A.

description:
Really fantastic food and service in a cool restaurant with modern twist on classic San Francisco decor.  

We had:
Deviled eggs - Highly recommend.  Get 2!
Maclaren cocktail - refreshing like green river
Lobster Bisque - very rich and decadent
Filet Mignon - fantastic
Birthday cake for dessert - soft and moist, among the best slices of cake I've had.
author: Green B.

description: Made a reservation for a large group. Food was overall good and so was the service. I ordered the brussel sprout chips, corn soup, and the rosted cornish hen with black truffles. I was worried that I had ordered poultry, but it ended up being really good. I thought it was funny that they gave me option of having it cut for me or if I wanted to carve it. I'm going to carve it myself. Duh. Cornish hen was moist and falvorful and yo could taste the truffle. This was rather large for me though. All I probably ate was one breast. I was not that hungry to begin with. My friend's pork I thought could be better. It would have been better if it was marinated in a citrus or vinergette, rather than just the chili rub that it came it. The fattier parts were better though. The corn soup was good, I would recommend it. I liked the oil that was drizzled on top of it. Also, order the gnocchi. It's the best gnocchi I've had.
author: Hazel F.

description: this place is by the same owners of Marlowe, but it bigger and much more classy. As everyone has mentioned you have the have the  deviled eggs, they are sooo good. I tried the seared tuna and the taste was really great
author: Greg D.

description:
heard this was the new spot to go now and it's true!  I'm a fan of this place for sure.  I can't wait to come back to the North Bay and try more food.  The place was super busy, but we managed to get bar seating within 5 minutes.  You can be put on the bar list if you don't have a reservation or there's a communal table in the bar area which is first come first serve.  It's modern decor with dark wood, but not a stuffy place at all.  More relaxed, but vibrant vibe.  People were super friendly and bartender makes fabulous cocktails.  
Met a guy who goes there frequently and had me order the bartender's special cocktail since I love bourbon.  It's not on the menu so you would have to ask for it.   It was real good, not sweet which is right up my alley.  Also tried the McKinley (a whiskey cocktail) and that was good as well, but I like the bartender's special better.  
For food, we had small bites.
deviled eggs with bacon, pickled jalepeño, and chives.  So good.  Full of flavor and just right.  
kampachi (raw fish) with kaffir, grapefruit and finger lime.  This is good, but not the greatest crudo dish I've had.  Very light.
fried oyster "caesar".  Who doesn't love fried oysters!  Came with a side a caeser salad and dipping sauce.  Def. would nosh on these again.

Next time I come, I'd like to try the apps and entrees.  

We finished off with espresso and a some grappa, which came from a fellow gentlemen we met sitting nearby.  Never heard of it, but was super strong and good surprisingly.  

great place, must go to
author: Elle Y.

description:
this place was pretty exciting. 

great decor, service and food. the food are something you would expect and they deliver it. personally i enjoy more inventive and adventurous dishes but after a long day at work and school, this was a real treat!

demon on a horse: it was okay, the dish doesn't live up to its intriguing name.. it's just prawns with somes sauce.

dungeness & lobster bisque: very good, very good bisque..  all the ingredients were fresh and nicely served in good portion.

brussel spouts chips: the same ole Marlowe's greatest chips!! amazing.

pork chop: a lot of people recommended this dish and it was great! tender, nicely seasoned and good portion

tombo tuna: i thought this dish was great.. perfectly cooked fish is hard to beat. 

overall, i had a very pleasant experience.
author: Sung C.

description:
Very High Recommendation for this delicious new spot in town! Everything on the menu looks absolutely delicious and I was impressed with the items I ordered a month ago. 
Just some reasons why I rate this spot one of the top in SF: 
1. perfect wine menu
2. incorporate raw, fried and smoked in their menu - can they spoil you anymore?
3. beautiful decor (including the pretty wall decor in the Women's bathroom, which believe it or not, the style and cleanliness of a bathroom can tell a lot about the upkeep of a restaurant)
4. serve a melt in your mouth bread and butter - which is not what you will expect, but so much more

Highly recommend:
- steamed mussels & fennel sausage Entree
- their ever so popular Marlowe Burger
- Fried oyster caesar 
- have heard great things about the sea scallop entree, and the clam chowder sounds yum!
Do yourself a favor and check out this scrumptious establishment! classy, GORGEOUS and most importantly friendly to your palette.
author: Michaela w.

description: Amazing. The atmosphere is great, the service was impeccable, and the food was delicious. I had the Creamy Cauliflower Bisque,  Grilled Pork Chop with sauteed baby turnips and caramelized apples...and omg...it was delish.
author: Lidia Z.

description: The food is creative and amazing. The service is over the top. Literally over the top. There is such a thing as too much service and I found myself fighting with the staff to keep plates on the table that I had not finished. Otherwise, it's a great spot and much needed in the NB hood.
author: Kim H.

description: atmosphere is awesome, the vibes of the place reminds me of NY.  They have great appetizers and fairly good cocktails.  we had brussels spout chip, devil eggs, and many other dishes.  How can u say no to a place that has beef jerky on the side.  Overall experience was very delightful.
author: Gsk A.

description: The food is here is very good. I really like the ambiance inside and the service is prompt. The only negative thing I can say is the price here is pretty high. Not sure if it's worth the quality of food that they serve.
author: Scoot S.

description: We really enjoyed this restaurant. Have eaten here twice. The décor is really nice with available bar seating, chef's table seating as well as the regular dining room. Service is top notch, knowledgeable and attentive. And the food is so fantastic. One item we haven't seen elsewhere on any menu are the deviled eggs. YUMMY! How can eggs taste so heavenly and light with such complex flavors? But they're here. We also shared the cheese plate and a burger, and yes it sounds so ordinary, but the flavors are so unique and complex. The chef has a very developed palate. We also had their wedge butter lettuce salad which was dressed with a light, fruity sparkling dressing. I don't know how they made it so light and so different from the typical thick, heavy iceberg wedge salad, but they did. The only issue I had was when we were waiting at the bar for our table, I asked the bartender if they had a Moscato d'Asti, and he said they didn't. But his bartending partner corrected him. They did have my favorite Moscato, but it had already been opened and was flat. I could have sent it back, but why? I'll be going back for more good food.
author: Richard S.

description: Went for brunch. The Marlowe burger was amazing and the perfect hangover cure! I enjoyed their bloody mary. I enjoyed the tequila mule cocktail, the ginger beer in this cocktail was the perfect touch!
author: Jasmine S.

description:
I love this place!  I went for the first time about a month ago with a friend spontaneously.  We did not have a reservation (it was a weekday night) but were seated at a nice table right away.  We started with the deviled eggs which were to die for!  Then we both had the burger and agreed that it was one of the best we had ever had.
I went back this weekend with my mother who was visiting from out of town.  We did have a reservation but when I called to add a 3rd person that day I was told they would have to push back the reservation a half hour or seat us at a communal table.  I was not thrilled about this since neither option was appealing. If it was a Friday or Saturday night I would not have minded waiting a half hour but it was Sunday at 8pm.  I ended up calling back and they said to just come in and they would seat us as soon as they could.  Upon arrival we were seated within 10 minutes which I appreciated.  We had a fantastic server (I wish I could remember his name) and all 3 of us loved our dinners.  We started with the brussel sprout chips which I personally think are overrated but they certainly didn't taste bad.  Just greasy and overpriced.  I had the Poulet Noir which was very flavorful. My mother had the sole and my cousin had the scallops.  They were good but she only got 4 and was still hungry.  We shared the October birthday cake (coconut) to complete the night and I thought it was dry and boring.
Overall, I love the decor and vibe of this place and think the service is fantastic.  But giving it 4 stars as opposed to 5 because of some of the food items (just not worth 5 stars) and for what you get for your money.
I think I may go back and just sit at the bar and get the burger.  If I did that every time I'm pretty sure it would be a solid 5 stars!
author: Dana D.

description: I wrote Park Tavern an e-mail about my experience. I received a prompt response by the owner. She then personally contacted me and my grandma and rectified the situation. I am very pleased with Anna's attention to customer service, and her willingness to 'right' things. I firmly believe what I experience is a fluke, and I will definitely go back again.
author: Hilary G.

description:
Location is great - right in the heart of town.

We came early in the day for some business and the smells in the restaurant were amazing.  Made me want to come back for dinner, which I did.

Place was packed and there were lots of energy in the room.  Met a bunch of nice people at the community table.

Wine list is very diversified.  Love it when I find wines I have not heard about before.  

Started with the rabbit and lardo terrine which had great flavors and a nice presentation.  Continued with the pork chop which was very tasty - loved the turnips and bacon chuncks.

Service was very friendly as well.  Ill be back!
author: Peter W.

description: Park Tavern is a welcome addition to North Beach dining.  Finally, a new place with some style, good food and drinks and a lively, non-touristy set of clientele!  I've enjoyed it every time I've visited, and it's one of the few restaurants in North Beach I would recommend.  The brussels sprout chips are very tasty and one of my fave items from sister restaurant Marlowe.  I really enjoyed my scallops with cauliflower, and my friend raved about the burger.  The cheese plate featured some very good cheeses paired with flavorful jams and nuts.  The only item I tried here that I found disappointing was the fried oysters dish.  Service is great, especially considering how busy it often is (and particularly in the bar area).  I will definitely return :)
author: melita s.

description:
After reading about Park Tavern and having loved Moose's and saw it decline, it was so nice to see this space back to such a high caliber restaurant once more.  We had the carrot pesto salad, peppers as a side and the amazingly moist chicken that is cooked on a Staub cast iron pan with greens and potatoes beneath it.  AMAZING!
On a Sunday evening the place was packed.  And for good reason.   Keep up the great work!
author: J H.

description: Great break. Had the hash & he had oatmeal (too much for one person) but totally fab. Thumbs up
author: Pam C.

description: Great food, wonderful service, cool ambiance. The duck liver was fabulous, the pork shop juicy and the deviled eggs were creative. The wine was paired well. The waiter was attentive, laid back, knew the menu and paid us great attention. Problem? ...he literally forgot about us the second the restaurant became crowded (yes I eat at 5:30pm - restaurant became crowded at 7:15). From the moment we ordered coffee, it took 35-40 minutes to receive our bill. (Why I knocked off 2 stars). I love a long dinner with friends, but we had already been sitting for 1.5+ hours before "he forgot" about us. Besides that it was a nice experience. I really did love the food.
author: Brooke S.

description:
This was my second time to Park Tavern. We went again last night for my birthday dinner. I had very high expectations given my first dinner at Park Tavern.

Dinner last night exceeded my expections. The very finest dining in San Francisco in every respect. 

Bravo, Park Tavern!
author: Bill G.

description: Service excellent. Food excellent. Coconut cake excellent. Atmosphere excellent.
author: Scott M.

description:
Had hear a lot of good things about Park Tavern.  I usually dig the New American style food.  I feel like it's the best type of menu to read my mind and present me with something that I want before I know what I want.  Also, this new place looked a bit out of the ordinary from the usual restaurants in North Beach.  So yes, I was sold, had to check it out, and finally ventured in with some friends this past weekend.   

Now one item in particular that I had heard about:
*Deviled eggs, bacon, pickled jalepeño & chives  $2 ea

This is supposedly a must order item.  Upon deciding to go here I immediately started thinking about them.  How good could they be?  Would they literally be the best deviled eggs I had ever had of all time?  Would I potentially eat 100?  They are only $2/each.  Would we all have a deviled egg eating contest with the winner getting 1 million dollars in Monopoly money?  Literally anything could happen...

That includes the plot twist of sitting down and upon opening my mouth to order them, the server said, "sorry to interrupt, but wanted to let you know we are out of deviled eggs."  He explained that they give these complimentary to tables that have a longer than normal wait.  I asked what they were going to send us complimentary for being out of the one item we were all desperately been wanting to try.  He stared at me blankly...Holy #$%&, the night was ruined...

But then life went on and the following was ordered among the various folks at the table...

*Kettle One/Soda with two orange slices $10 - It looked like they had a lot of good cocktails, and normally I would have gone for something like the PT Old Fashioned, but I was in a vodka/soda mood, so continued on with that simple order and made it just high maintenance enough by throwing in the two orange slices thing.  Cocktail next time.
*Demons on horseback  $13 - Deliciously tasty prawns.
*Housemade beef jerky  $7 - Really? Beef Jerky? Ok, whatever, it was damn good.
*Lemon chips, dill pollen, burrata, & Shelley's pea tendrils  $13 - Not enough lemon chips to go with the burrata, but I guess that is ok, I managed to finish it off.
*"Marlowe" burger, caramelized onion, cheddar, bacon, horseradish aioli & fries  $14 - I didn't order this, but of course I tried a bite.  This burger alone is worth a trip back.  It was delicious!
*"Poulet Rouge" Bloomsdale spinach & Peewee potatoes  $25 - This was my epic order and this game hen rules.  I honestly enjoyed this more than the uninspired chicken at Zuni Cafe.  Throw in the delicious spinach and pewee potatoes and this was simply a homerun. Not to mention they serve it upright in this giant iron skillet type thing.  We were sitting in the middle of the dining room, so I'm assuming that anyone on the fence of what to order saw what I had and followed my lead.   This obviously most likely lead to soaring profits that night, which I'll take credit for.  

So I wish I had room for dessert, but that game hen won.  I was stuffed.  Good times, and I plan to be back.  Hopefully they will deliver complimentary deviled eggs based on this incredibly sad story about being out the first time I visited.
author: John R.

description:
Despite the parade of Maseratis and Jaguars at the valet stand, the place did not feel entirely like a posh country club.  We had delicious wine and appetizers - a tiny bit pricey but not completely unreasonable.  The service was friendly despite the incredible rush of business.  Liked the decor although it was all a bit dark compared to the old Moose's.
And NO TV. Tha god.
author: k a b.

description:
I don't know how many times I've eaten here, trying to make myself like it. The menu and ingredients are promising, and it's in a gorgeous space -- and it serves beautiful food to beautiful people.  Service can be disjointed, though always friendly. But the food is uneven.  Some dishes in the same section of the menu are very small, some are pretty big, most are rather oily, and quality varies between visits.  And it's all a tad pricy for being often less than stellar.

I've had one perfect Marlowe Burger here. Other times, the bun has been stale (even after sending it back -- though, I got it, I was there on Stale Bun Day), the patty mis-prepared, or it was too salty.

Loved the spiciness and juiciness of the Poulet Rouge, but I only had it once and its vegetables were so salty and oily that I can't quite bring myself to order it again.

The deviled eggs, with pickled jalapeno and bacon, have always been perfect, and the build-your-own Fried Caesar Salad is fun and tasty.

The Grilled Sea Scallops dish has a cool combination of flavors, but the scallops were overcooked.

The brunch dish with kiwi and strawberry w/ whipped coconut milk is refreshing, and the avocado toast is, as well, as long as too much oil isn't poured onto it. Many of their main brunch dishes seem to involve lots of eggs on top.

Drinks are consistent and the wine always at the perfect temp, though the brunch Boozie Smoothie really should be served in something larger than a coupe martini glass.

I love the idea of the Birthday Cake dessert, and it's always superbly airy, but sometimes bland.

I'll probably still come here -- it's really the only modern SF restaurant of its kind in North Beach -- but I still hope that it lives up to what it wants to be.  If I didn't live close by, I would never go out of my way to go here.
author: Nina W.

description: My family and I went to The Park Tavern for our very first time and had the most amazing experience ever. The appetizers were the best ever...deep fried brussel sprouts and deviled eggs. For my entree I had the sole..cooked perfectly with the sauce. Our waiter Christo was so attentive and helpful. He recommended a couple bottles of wine for us that we absolutely loved. Overall our experience was a 5 star from start to finish!!!
author: Victoria C.

description: My favorite place to eat in San Francisco. Their food is creative, flavorful, and difficult to make at home--my kind of restaurant! I've been here 20+ times (I live 2 blocks away), and I have never been disappointed with a single dish or cocktail. Things you must try at dinner: deviled eggs (GET THEM!), poulet noir (and I don't usually order chicken at restaurants), PT fries, brussel sprout chips,  bar steak, and cheddar apple crisp. Things you must try at brunch: avocado toast, cod cakes, and polenta cakes with mushrooms. The only downsides to PT are the prices and crowds. It's easy to rack up a hefty bill when you're ordering multiple dishes to share and $13 cocktails. Plan to make a reservation well in advance, or go early to grab space at the communal bar and table. IMO, the best way to experience PT is to make a reservation for brunch, sit outside on a nice sunny day, and watch all the tourists wait in line at Mama's while you dine on far superior food. :)
author: Alison S.

description: Park Tavern is essentially Marlowe on steroids.  Compared to the much smaller Marlow, Park Tavern is an expansive restaurant with a fully vibrant bar scene.  I went on opening night and had a great experience.  Standouts include the Halibut, Steak Crudo and Deviled Eggs from the small bites section.  I would skip the Buratta because the lemon chips that come with them are over-seasoned and too overpowering.  The scallop entree was seared perfectly and delicious.  Drinks are great too, they have a great beer and wine selection.  Definitely a solid restaurant that warrants repeat visits.
author: Wei K.

description:
I'd love to come back for dinner one day!  Do make reservations if they take it because the place does get packed.  

We had drinks at the bar on a Saturday at 6 and it was busier than most places during weekday happy hour.  The bartenders were very attentive.  We munched on brussel sprout chips (individual sprout leaves deep fried) and deviled eggs.  The chips were really greasy but retained it's brussel sprout flavor well.  I loved the pickled jalapeno on the eggs but the yolk was a little too smooth and pureed for my liking.
author: San N.

description: Couldn't resist the Marlowe burger served here at her sister restaurant. Didn't disappoint. Hate Brussels sprouts? Me, too- until today. Our friends/dinner companions introduced us to an appetizer item that amounted to chips made from deep-fried slices of sprouts. I'll never come here again without ordering them.
author: Paula H.

description:
5 stars for:  Best deviled eggs in town.  Next time I might just sit at the bar and eat 8 of these.  Brussels sprouts chips are guilt-free munchies.  Lemon chips with fava hummus were different and delicious.  Watermelon with feta - refreshing and tasty.  Service was good.

4 stars for smoked burrata with heirloom tomatoes.  The burrata was excellent but the tomatoes were underripe.

2 stars for the cheese plate.  The accompanying items were interesting and good, but the cheeses themselves were dull.  They should at least have the option of a robust, flavorful cheese, but all of these were for beginners.
author: Sumomo O.

description:
food is good, starters more than the entree's. but the main thing here is the atmosphere. 

This place is where it's at right now. Seriously.

I almost felt not blonde enough to be there! 

Their wine selection is amazing - prices are really fair - I strongly suggest you will give it a thorough look before ordering - there are some hidden gems in it. 

Enjoy it while the buzz is still there.

Oh, and don't miss the chocolate creme brûlée 

Notice: we had a reservation - and still we waited for 17 min. to be seated.

Also service can be more attentive - we had to ask twice for the bread (which was really good with good butter).
author: Too M.

description:
This restaurant is wonderful in all the important fronts - service, food and ambiance.

A large, spacious dining hall with good cocktails, a straightforward all-American menu and a fun scene. The restaurant is loud and busy but it's a great place to go out to with friends.

Our group ordered the following appetizers: 
Deviled eggs - awesome smokey flavor, a must have!
Brussel sprout chips - really taste. Takes a healthy food and makes it into a lovely snack that is sinfully crispy and salty.
Smoked fish dip - a bit underwhelming, leave this to your Jewish deli
Lemon & basil leaf burrata - the burrata is like any you've had before. The draw here are the awesome lemon chips for dipping!
Charcuterie board: definitely underwhelming. Leave it to a charcuterie/salumeria


For dinner we ordered:
The roasted chicken which is served on a cast iron sticking up in the air and very juicy. It was a delight.
The creekstone steak. Buttery and soft, the sauce was lovely too but the steak lacked a deep meaty flavor.

Would go back - very fun restaurant with friends.
author: Steven H.

description: Highly recommend for brunch. Food was great and the ambience is nice. Nice location in the city to walk around after as well
author: J P.

description: Nice place.  Probably the best pork chop I have ever had.  Brussels sprout chips were very interesting.  Very flavorful!  Upscale, gastro pub with a great view of the park.
author: Michelle D.

description: Park Tavern is a great venue if you're going for a fun social evening...but don't go there if you're looking for great food.  I went on a Sunday night with 3 other friends for an early 5:30 dinner reservation and were able to to enjoy the esthetics of the very chic, upscale bistro.  My party of 4 all started with Martini's and I was served my drink in a very chipped Martini Glass. When I showed it to my waiter, he took my drink away and I had to remind him 10 minutes later that I was waiting for the return of my cocktail. The Brussel Sprout Chips were ok...but I certainly don't understand all the chatter they're getting on these YELP pages!  The Poulet Noir which I saw on a YELP photo as a HUGE Rotisserie Chicken bursting with herbed stuffing was neither HUGE or BURSTING with stuffing...In fact, it was a sad little cornish game hen with no stuffing, served on a bed of burnt sauteed spinach.  A very sad looking dish...Brad had the Mussels which were served in a tomato garlic broth and was very tasty.  My other friend and I each ordered a C.A.B. NY Steak--which was 3 or 4 pieces of Steak served with fingerling potatoes and it was just ok...when I order a steak at a bistro, please serve it hot, sizzling and WHOLE...what's this piece meal crap?  Didn't want to chance a mediocre dessert as it certainly wouldn't be worth the calories if it was anything like the dishes we received up til then.   Prices seem very high for the quality of food--I'd rather spend the same amount of dough at House of Prime Rib when I'm in a carnivorous mood.  Probably better to go there for Cocktails before heading elsewhere in that fabulous North Beach Location.   What a disappointment...I really was hoping Park Tavern would be great.
author: Elayne L.

description: The food is awesome!  Appetizers: Brussel sprout chips make me okay with eating vegetables, the deviled eggs melt in your watering mouth.  Entrees: The burger is one of the best in SF.  Have had the pork chop at Marlowe (sister restaurant) which has an almost identical menu and its gooood (better than NOPA).  Great place to take a date.  The atmosphere looks like a trendy hipster place in NY.  They take reservations.  The service is impeccable.  5 stars for sure.
author: Joe L.

description: Came here on opening night and this place has great potential.  I can really see the poulet vert becoming a signature dish.  Definitely worth trying.
author: Roger H.

description: This a fun place to go !! Heart of north beach and they have valet which is key.Great cocktail selection. Light pour on the wine though.I was with 2 other friends and we tried alot of items on the menu. The deviled eggs a must try!! Truffle fries not so much for 20 bucks ? very clean plates well thought out on entrees. I look forward coming back. the place is going off. I would tell my friends to come check it out!!
author: james m.

description:
We visited Park Tavern on a Friday, Jan 13th. Overall I would say it was very good, but as the other reviewers have mentioned, it's just noisy. It has a very busy feel to it, so I would take someone on a romantic date. It would be good for fun nights out but it's so loud that you end up having to almost shout at one another. We felt slightly rushed by our server but not horribly so.

Aside from the noise and busy ambiance, the food was very excellent and fun. We had the raw steak and raw salmon for our appetizers - both very good. We had the chicken and the pork chop - both very great flavors. And then we had the cheesecake for dessert - which was just okay - tasted more like a panna cotta then a cheesecake but still very good. 

Over the food was excellent - and maybe if we had a different table (we were seated right by the pathway to the kitchen) then the servers rushing around and busy feel of the restaurant would be less distracting.
author: E G.

description:
Horrible brunch, way overpriced. Dutch baby was like a flat pancake, but half the size of a normal pancake. they don't have normal breakfast/brunch options, or even a wide array, and their prices are ridiculous for the small amount of food they give you, mind you, food that doesn't even taste that good. their orange juice is also horrible it tastes like (five dollars for a small small glass) sunny d, coming to a five star rating restaurant and getting weird sunny d orange juice is perhaps the most depressing of all. 

on the other hand, the manager saw our sheer disappointment and paid for the drinks and sides at least.
author: Samantha J.

description:
We were staying next door to this restaurant and it was recommended by one of the people staying there.  We tried a walk-in the first night, but found out the reservations fill up a couple of nights in advance

This is the first place I would label as "Hipster Trendy" on Yelp. Super packed, loud ambiance,  The tables are very close together, and things are even closer at the communal bar table.  We heard some very interesting conversations our neighbors were having that night.

We started with the PT fries, which were served with a spicy remoulade sauce, and a soft boiled egg with a little caviar. The fries were double dropped, so they were very crispy.  They were a little expensive at $20, so I probably would try something different next time.

I had the Poulet Rouge. It was a very juicy small chicken, server upright on a cast iron dish, with spinach and baby potatoes server in the bottom.  My wife had the scallops, which were cooked perfectly.

For dessert I had the "Birthday Cake" which was a chocolate pecan cake.  It was actually very good.  My wife had the TCHO creme brulee, which was also very good.  It was my wife's birthday, but all they did was put a candle in her dessert (actually mine by mistake).

The food was very good.  The service, not by fault of the servers, was a little thin.  Our empty wine glasses sat on the table after we finished the wine at dinner, and  I had to ask for water refills.  If the food hadn't been good, and the waiter's attitude good, I may have given a rating of a three because of this.  At least for me, service is very important, especially at a nicer restaurant such as this.

We'll go back next time we are in San Francisco.
author: Stephen S.

description: One of my favorite things about living in SF is the great food and service at restaurants. That all changed with my experience at Park Tavern. Ordered a Moscow Mule- it was like drinking straight lime juice!!! Yuck. My friend ordered a McLaren that tasted like club soda- WTF?!? The wait staff was terrible...a waiter dropped a whole plate of fries on my back. Our waitress was not very friendly. The food was just ok..the apps and dessert were good (Brussel sprout chips, gnocchi, February birthday cake, and chocolate creme brûlée)...entrees were terrible (pan seared sole was overcooked and the clams were missing a lot of seafood and was all broth. The best part was sitting near the kitchen and watching a dude taste test all the dishes before servers took them to the tables with his bare hands after wiping sweat off his face and double dipping his spoon on a few occasions....puke....I can't believe this is a 4 star on yelp....why did I give 2 stars after such a terrible experience? I went there for brunch and had great food and drink- maybe only a good brunch spot? Suffice to say...I will not be going back.
author: N B.

description: Very disappointed with the service and food.  Took colleagues from Denver and waited at least 10 minutes for anyone to came the table.  We were never offered a cocktail.  We ordered two appetizers after discussing the need to be gluten free, but they never showed up.  One of the four entres was halibut and it was raw.  When called over another waiter he responded "your right."  No apology, no reduction, no intention going back.
author: Buz S.

description: The food is great, but the music doesn't fit. Maybe you shoud hire the company I use- www.mixtemotions.com
author: Sanfrancisco O.

description: Tast, greasy, expensive. Good for any time of the day cuz of the location. Short menu,  friendly staff.
author: Laura S.

description:
Probably closer to 3.5 stars, but since I have to choose, 4 versus 3. We were excited to try this place after hearing a lot about it so my group of 6 girls friends met for dinner. Cocktails are good and we were seated on time. We had a nice table and service was overall good and in general, the space is pretty cool.

Food is where this place is lacking. The bread they served was rock solid, several of us commented on it. They brought us another basket which was fine. The fried pork belly sounded divine but was the most disappointing thing we tried. Even with a group of 6, no one liked it enough to have another one. What was delicious was my basil, burrata and lemon appetizer. Very innovative and clean. 

I made the mistake of ordering the mussels which after reading Anthony Bourdains book, you should never order mussels unless you know the chef. They were fine, but for the price, it wasn't much food and it wasn't anything exciting.  Talking to some of the girls after, everyone thought the same thing, the food was fine, but nothing great and not a place that we'd go out of our way to go back to.
author: Lauren M.

description:
A gorgeously themed -- huge open dining room kind of place.  The brussel sprout chips were wonderful -- and the filet mignon, may just be, ONE OF THE BEST STEAKS I've had in my life... simply amazing.

Have to shave 1 star off the perfect score of 5.  We had reservations for 8:45 and didn't get sat until almost 9:40.  That was no good...  And the dessert.  The creme brulee was almost inedible.  Something wrong with that dessert.

But that said, I'll be back.  Entrees and the vibe are awesome.
author: Chris O.

description: came here again on fri night and ate like a little pig.  the PT fries and brussels sprout chips were AMAZING.  we also tried the duck liver mousse, which wasn't my fave.  the pork chop and trout dip were also good, but the fries and brussels sprout chips were the biggest hit.
author: Helen T.

description: We had my daughters wedding dinner at The Park Tavern.  The food was excellent and different enough to be very new and exciting.   Everyone told us how much they enjoyed the food.  We booked their upper room and had outstanding staff helping us out!!!!!
author: Janet M.

description: Great location gets revived: the Poulet is sublime...
author: Mick G.

description:
Dinner out with the girls.  Wait staff were wonderful, all starters were amzingly good.
My grilled Scallops were undercooked for my taste, but maybe just right with those who go for sushi scallops.  Finally, there was one desert that was inedible, the apple crisp.  I am not sure what the problem was, salty, burnt, just off?  The attention to service during the dinner was great.  I'd like to try it again.
author: Susan B.

description:
we have been going here since it opened in 2011..  unfortunately, we have been noticing a steady decline over the past few months.. inconsistent quality with regards to the cuisine, and disjointed service... 

we have always enjoyed the atmosphere and cocktails offered, and the menu LOOKS great, however the actual dishes have become disappointing..

PLEASE get your act together and get back on track..
author: A R.

description: Beautiful space and bar.  We enjoy sitting at the bar, good drinks and friendly bartenders.  Love the brussel sprout chips, deviled eggs and the Marlowe burger.
author: Danny M.

description: one of my top 5 favorite spots in sf. make sure to get the brussel sprouts to start so yummy and the pork chop or the filet are both to die for !!!!!!!!
author: Lexi B.

description: I rarely write Yelp reviews, but Park Tavern deserves it.  Not only is the food great (love the deviled eggs, lemon chips and petrale sole), but  the service, specifically the hostess, Kiele, went above and beyond the call of duty.  I had dinner reservations for a Sunday night and my dinner companions were extremely late.  Kiele was very accommodating and made sure there was a table available for us. Did I mention their mixed drinks are fabulous?  It's a great place to take out of town guests too.
author: Michelle S.

description: great food and vibe. right outside from the park, nice place to eat and drink on a Sunday morning
author: Adrian P.

description: So had to try this place with all the hype it has. Made reservations several weeks in advance for Saturday night. When we arrived we seated very promptly. Just like most SF restaurants tables are right next to one another so you feel very intimate with the other patrons of the restaurant. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu and provided some good insight for a firs timer. We started with of course the deviled eggs....I thought they were good- not sure if they are top 100 good- but oh well something different. We also had the venison carpaccio since it was so different. I thought this dish was very tasty and we enjoyed it quite a bit.  Also had the brussel sprout chips which were difficult to stop eating. I had the Poulet Noir which was amazing! they let you know up-front this will take 30 minutes to cook but totally worth it. Love the stuffing and the sauce, everything about it is delicious. It is very filling though so I recommend splitting it or taking it home. We also had the cheesecake which was deconstructed and not sweet at all, so more like a cheese plate desert. Overall it was a great meal. It was a tad loud in the restaurant due to the crowds at the bar, so I wouldn't say its a romantic spot- but fun for a night out.
author: Nicole S.

description: Food could be better... much better... the highlights were the brussel sprout chips and the game hen.  Low points--the twice baked potato is really really really greasy and the chanterelle side is overly salty.  Burger and sole were OK (could have been better).  Service is excellent.  But for the price and location... I'd rather be at the other Tavern--Wayfare.
author: F S.

description: OK on fried brussel sprouts and salad.  My entree was supposed to be a pork chop, but tasted weird.   Very vinegary if that makes sense.  Not crazy about the change in decor from Mooses.   Everything is out in the open which makes the room seem too busy.    I will try again.
author: Deborah T.

description:
We called Park Tavern last night at 8pm to see if they could fit us in and luckily enough, they could take our party of four at 9pm.  We got there about 8:30 to enjoy a drink at the bar while we waited.  The bar staff was friendly and helpful even though the place was packed.  

We were seated and our waitress quickly introduced herself, got our drink order and answered questions about the menu.  We started with the deviled eggs, brussels sprouts, and saikou salmon.  All were delicious, the deviled eggs were some of the best I have had.  I asked our waitress to suggest her favorite main course- she said either the pork chop or the ahi.  My husband got the ahi, I got the pork chop and we split them.  The ahi was well prepared but not really my think, the pork was out of this world.  A friend got the clams, which were the best I have ever had.  

The atmosphere was lively and fun, the decor was beautiful and the food delicious.  We will definitely be back again soon.
author: Caitlin D.

description: Tasty cocktails and awesome brunch. Conveniently located by Washington square park.
author: Kari G.

description: Great cocktails and delicious food. We ordered a charcuterie plate, and creamed seasonal vegetables to share. The Marlowe burger was to die for, and the mussels and sausage were also pretty good.
author: Danielle B.

description: Had dinner there shortly after their opening.  OUTSTANDING!!!  Glad to see they revived the space from Mooses and whatever was there after that.  Great time and we'll definitely be back!
author: Gino T.

description: amazing.  atmosphere is fantastic, food is even better!  great staff.  would prefer a few additional cocktails not so exotic, but definitely worth going!  would go back in a heartbeat!
author: L C.

description: Ate here like 8 months ago, but am finally writing a review. We came on a weekend and wanted to have a nice lunch here, but to our surprise they were still serving brunch at 1pm. We decided to go with it and got a nice table outside and enjoyed the view. Service was extremely slow. I mean the slowest I have ever had while dining. It took like 15-20 mins to get us iced teas! All and all, I think we were there for a little over two hours for a burger and a salad. Kind of ridiculous. I heard nothing but good things about this place too so I was totally shocked by the poor service. We sat for like 35 mins after our meal waiting for the check. Plus, my salad was just okay and nothing I could've made at home. The burger my husband had was good though. I'd like to try the place again. I'll just make sure I have nothing going on that day.
author: Kristin R.

description: Not a fan of the food as its overly salty and at times heavy/rich (the exception being the devil eggs). Lounge for drinks is great.
author: around town e.

description: Terrific food, great service. Loved the fried brussel sprouts.
author: Eric F.

description: Great burger, fresh on-tap ale, attentive service; overwhelmed kitchen.
author: Buck B.

description:
This place was so not worth it. The only good thing going for this place is the ambience, provided you have a good table. 
For starters, we got stuck at a 2 person table up against a wall and squished up against another table. I can understand that table for a walk-in but with a reservation - I expect better. Then the service was totally slow. I am in no rush but don't take my drink order and walk away for 25 minutes to come back for an appetizer order. If these guys consider themselves upscale then they should offer those services. My husband and I decided to share the soup of the day. To serve us the soup, she brings a large bowl with two spoons and expects us to share that way. Come one...split the soup into 2 bowls like every other "upscale" restaurant. I had to ask them to do this. The wild arugula mushroom salad was incredibly salty so don't get that. Lastly, my husband's entree which was the steak was COLD. This place is OVERRATED.
author: Padma K.

description:
Excellent food, cocktails, service and atmosphere. My friend and I had a wonderful meal. Everything arrived promptly but we didn't feel rushed. We had the mussels, Marlowe burger, brussel sprout chips and twice baked potato. All were delicious. 

(my only suggestion: perhaps a sheer window treatment for the glass front door. At about 6pm, I was keeping an eye on the door for my friend from a seat at the bar and the glare through the window off the floor was ridiculous. Your hostesses might go blind.)
author: E.B. A.

description: Worst service I've ever had in my entire life. If I could give this place zero stars I would. After waiting an hour after our reservation to sit down, our waiter was extremely condescending and made us feel like it was an inconvenience for him to serve us.  There were countless examples where the waiter was extremely cocky and unwelcoming. At the end of dinner we had some issues with our bill and the manager that spoke to us also had an attitude. This place was highly recommended to us from the Ritz Carlton concierge. Upon our return, we told them that they should not recommend this place to any guests.
author: Brett C.

description: Ok other than not being able to get a table on my anniversary, it was great in all respects.  Food we had Brussel sprouts and they were too salty  so changed out for a tomato caprice type tart which was excellent. Split a burger next which we loved and the split a pork chop which had excellent flavor cooked right and we really liked the potato side. Drinks were great and service was tops.
author: michael d.

description: We went there for brunch and got a great table outside.  The location and service were great, but the food was definitely over priced for breakfast. It would have been nice if they had at least one traditional item on the breakfast menu.
author: Emily M.

description: Came here for lunch.  Food was good but too expensive.  Service slow.  Valet parking was a plus.  I won't be back.
author: Mary H.

description: Love it, the brussels and the burger are the best. My one and only complaint is the dessert- they suck. Tell me why in a chocolate cake would you ever, EVER, put raisins, that's just cruel.  They always sound great and never fail to disappoint me entirely.  Jack the bartender is the MAN!
author: Angie S.

description: So good.  Perfect brunch.  Loved the crab toast appetizer.  My main course was a smoked cod cake with a perfectly poached egg on top.  Great service, great meal.
author: Brenda And Tommy M.

description: Love Park Tavern! The roasted chicken is amazing, as are the brussel sprouts!
author: Katie S.

description: We hit up Park Tavern for a somewhat last minute Sunday night dinner.  Unfortunately there were no tables for at least two hours, but we were able to grab seats at the communal table.  We had a great spread of some of their menu staples, like the PT fries, pickled vegetables, duck liver mousse, and steak tartare, as well as all of the more seasonal "last chance" items (the deconstructed BLT, the figs and cheese, etc).  Our server did a great job staggering all of the items, so were not too overwhelmed.  The food was both thoughtful and tasty.  The presentation was also top notch.  On the note of presentation, the space is very hip, almost as if the restaurant was airlifted out of NYC.  In fact, much of the clientele looked and were acting as if they were from NYC (and I don't mean that in the good way).  Very odd, compared to many of the other more low key SF outings I had that weekend.  I guess this place must be very "in" right now.
author: Julie M.

description: Excellent brunch. Great food and beautiful setting. I went with the baked eggs in a skillet with spinach and prosciutto and it was very tasty. Service was a bit slow - maybe that was due to the fact that their seemed to be multiple people assigned to our table (which was only a 4-top).
author: Peg W.

description:
This was our second visit to Park Tavern and since we live in the neighborhood we thought we would try it again.  This time when we made our reservation we asked for a table by the window since we heard it was less noisy.  The very nice hostess said our table was still occupied and offered us two choices.  We took a booth for two in the center of the restaurant.  Big Mistake! 
 We were seated by two couples that either had way too much wine or were very giddy being in a restaurant.  They shrieked and laughed so loud and with that added to the already loud noise level in the restaurant it almost made sitting there unbearable.  We ordered our drinks and then the waiter took our order.  Within five minutes our entrees arrived.  McDonalds could not have been that fast.  My scallops were arranged like a small snake on the plate ranging in size from the size of a nickel to a fifty cent piece.  Fortunately I was not all that hungry.  My friend had the steak and fries.  I love salt but the french fires were so salty even I could not eat them.  Three different bus boys asked to clear our plates.  My friend literally had his fork in mid air and was chewing  and had food on his plate.  I know they want to turn the tables but that was ridiculous. There wasn't  anybody waiting for a table and there were even some open tables.
Why we ordered dessert is a mystery but we did.  That took fifteen minutes to come.  They only had to slice the cake not make it from scratch. The carrot cake was not as good as the one Neiman Marcus used to have.  That one had shavings of carrots, walnuts and raisins in the moist cake and the frosting had wonderful cream cheese.  This was not even close.  
The manager knew we were unhappy and took it upon himself to take care of the food charge and we paid for the drinks.  Between the very loud noise level, the feeling that we were being rushed with the entree and then delayed by the long wait for the dessert I can assure you we will not return.   There are far too many restaurants in San Francisco where you do not  have to put up with a loud noise level, inconsistent service and so so food. Too bad since Park Tavern is convenient for those that live in the neighborhood.
author: Sally F.

description:
We arrive 10 mins early on a friday night for a 10pm reservation. Hostess told us to wait since there are no tables available even though when we looked around there were a couple of tables free. Went to the bar and grabbed couple of cocktails which sounded interesting. It came almost devoid of alcohol. 15 mins go by and no one has sat in any of the tables, so we went up to her and told her it's past 10pm. She then said "oh, I was actually looking for you". Surprising considering she was standing there the whole time clearly not looking for anyone and we were a foot away from her the entire time. Fine whatever.

Sat down. We were actually excited since we live in the neighborhood and finally someone has opened a decent looking place with what seems like a good bar scene.  

We usually are price insensitive when going to restaurant's food and cocktails. But this restaurant takes the cake. The bread given to us albeit tasty was stale.  I ordered the uni for an appetizer which was a big mistake, it was more like lettuce with a taste of uni. A quarter of an uni was divided by six, so it looked more like dots on top of lettuce. Having worked with the restaurant industry in New York, this was really insulting.  My husband ordered the burger and his fries were fried to a crisp that it just tasted like oil. My scallops were good, but again for the price you'd think you're eating at french laundry except you will actually be full at french laundry. We skipped on dessert after that meal. When we looked around us, the table of 3 to our left is sharing one side dish. And to our right, a group of 6 girls, didn't order alcohol and had 2 burgers between them. That means the place is too pricey for the hood. 


The only thing they really have going for them is the ambiance and the fact that they look over the park. After we got the bill, all alcohol we ordered had hidden charges on them so a cocktail really came out to $14-16. If you want to get robbed and lied to, go to this place!
author: nyleres M.

description: Ehh. Salty and overpriced.  Service was okay, wasn't very attentive and didn't seem too knowledgeable.  Glad I tried, probably won't go back for dinner.  Might go back to check out the bar if around the area.
author: Lauren S.

description: I've been here many times before and I like that it's a neighborhood place. If you come in early enough, you can order cocktails and meals in the communal table by the bar, I've also been able to get seated reservations but had to do it a couple of weeks in advance.  I crave for the following: crispy brussels sprout chips (I can eat an entire order myself), smoked deviled eggs and the truffle fries! It's time to go back.
author: Flaneur E.

description: North Beach has a slew of new restaurants and this is by far my new favorite in the hood. Amazing cocktails, great wine selection and delicious food. It's also got a great vibe that fills a niche NB was lacking. Welcome Park Tavern!
author: newintown k.

description: We had our first but certainly not our last dinner at Park Tavern last night, and it was near perfect! The deviled eggs, fried green tomatoes, pork chops (not actually listed on the menu), polenta, and both desserts could not have been any better.  Prices are reasonable for what you get. Noise level was very high -- a carpet would help that.  I like the interior better when it was Moose's, but all else was wonderful!
author: Bill F.

description:
service was good but . . .
that's about it
food was mediocre, food was overpriced, ridiculous noise level for no purpose
they should wall off the bar area and stop piping in pointless, loud music that only adds to the din that makes it impossible to converse with whomever you went with to have dinner
would not return, as there's better food at better prices in better environment elsewhere
author: S K.

description: Yes, yes, yes! Amazing evening we had a party of five, shared a few starters, let me tell you the reviews for those deviled eggs are true! You must have them, little egg heaven! Same goes for the  brussels sprout chips.  Caramelized onion & wild mushroom soup, oh yes! Full of flavor and so comforting. Entrees at our table were; grilled pork chop, poulet rouge and the burger. I had the burger and it was great, very reasonably priced at $13.00. I tasted each entree finding pleasure in all I would say the most amazing would be the poulet rouge. We were here the day after Thanksgiving so a burger was my craving.  Cocktails are generous in strength, I can recommend the Washington Square, we enjoyed a few bottles of wine found to be fairly priced as well.  This place is sexy and fun, love the bar area, fun spot to eat at with a smaller party. Service was excellent. I will go back. Check it out, Cheers!
author: Patricia L.

description: Way overrated.  I barely Yelp, but I felt I had to deter others from choosing this place over all the great restaurants in SF.  Biggest problem....no vegetarian plates on the menu.  Not one.  I had to put together a veggie plate by choosing sides off the other plates.  Was given a scoop of greens, cauliflower and mashed potatoes, all of which were inedible.  So much butter and salt, disgusting.  I left ravenous and irritated.  Note I was with a party of 6, and 2 others (both ordered the halibut) could not eat their plates either.  Lots of uneaten food was cleared.  Service was mediocre.  Place was loud.  This is definitely a spot for unsuspecting tourists or those who are merely attempting to "keep up with the Jonses."
author: Stephanie B.

description: Best restaurant in town!  Favorite dish was the Brussels sprouts, but really everything was amazing.  Very good wine list.  Incredibly attentive staff, the chef even came out to make sure everyone was enjoying the food.
author: Kevin T.

description:
Disappointing.  Went with in a group of six, we had reservations.  The restaurant is beautiful, the cocktails were good, and some of the food we ordered was good.  But much of it was overpriced and poorly executed.  

Our server was okay but bad about taking drink orders.  When we ordered our first round they took a long time to arrive, and this was true for every round we ordered.  The bar area is busy and the drinks are creative so I understand that it takes time to put them together, but it's important to get drinks on the table and keep them there when a party is seated for dinner.  Our server was not prompt about taking our drink orders when our drinks were empty or near-empty, and at one point took the drink orders of the rest of the table but not mine.  The drinks were so slow in arriving that there was a time between courses when the entire table of six had finished their cocktails, the empty glasses had been cleared, and we were without drinks (or food) for a good fifteen minutes.  It's very unusual to sit at an upscale restaurant mid-meal with nothing but water glasses on the table for so long.

We ordered a bunch of appetizers, some of which were okay, but when we asked the waiter for a recommendation for a vegetable appetizer he recommended the raw vegetable plate.  I expected something more creative than the unseasoned carrots, cucumber, radishes, and dip that arrived.  My first thought when it arrived was that it must be unbelievably cheap for the restaurant to prepare but very profitable.  I couldn't help but wonder if the waiter was instructed to recommend the dish because of the margin.  I'm still shocked it's actually on the menu (not to mention that it was recommended), because it was essentially the equivalent of veggies and spinach dip.  

One other thing about the appetizers--they came out very quickly.  Too quickly.  As though they were all sitting somewhere pre-prepared and had just been loaded onto plates when the order came in, rather than made to order.

I should have learned my lesson about taking recommendations from our waiter, but I couldn't decide between entrees.  I asked the server whether I should order the tuna or the sturgeon and he recommended the sturgeon, so I went with it.  It was a huge mistake.  It arrived cold and bland, with an unpleasant chalky taste.  The accompaniment didn't add much, as it came with sad looking vegetables in the exact same sauce that had been on one of our appetizers. 

Someone at my table ordered the scallops and offered me one when she noticed I wasn't eating my fish (although she noticed this, the waiter did not).  The scallop had sand in it.  Someone else ordered the burger, which was good but not spectacular.  The truffle fries were very good, the Brussels sprouts were good but not particularly unique, and a prawn appetizer we ordered was very good but mostly because it was cooked in bacon fat.  The deviled eggs were okay, but I've had better at Wayfare Tavern.

All in all I had the impression that the restaurant's mission is not to make excellent food and provide a high quality dining experience, but to do its best imitation of doing so to earn as much money as possible to pay for that enormous, beautiful space on Washington Square Park.  When I first walked in I was struck by it and commented on how they could have possibly afforded it.  I guess it's by recommending the veggies and dip.
author: Meredith H.

description: Although it's tough to get a table at times...and the loud, drunk women at the bar can be a bit annoying, Park Tavern is a total delight!  We were there with friends after having a wonderful experience at PT months before.  The wait staff were very attentive without being overbearing.  The beautiful Aileen (General Manager) greeted us and even had delicious deviled eggs brought to our table.  The soups were delicious and the entrees were delightful.  Atmosphere transports you to brasseries in NYC without the pretension.  Definitely recommend this spot on Washington Square!
author: Randy M.

description: Reserved a large table for a family wedding celebration.  I was able to use the private dining room upstair with not only a private bar but also a "living room" like setting next to the table with couches and chairs.  The bartender was very helpful and creative in drink and wine orders and service.   AAAAA+++.  Good variety in the menu and the management was so very accommodating.  The restaurant is obviously very popular and we had a great time.
author: Reid E.

description: Awesome service, great food, no reservations, ate at the bar, had the poulet rouge, pork chop, brussel sprout chips, bur rata with lemon chips and basil, and pork belly bites.
author: Michael C.

description: I love everything about this place. The women running the show behind Park Tavern got it right in so many ways, combining comfort food with gourmet in the most unexpected ways. I had no idea egg could be used as a side dip to truffle french fries, or done up to taste like a bomb of delicious crunch and silky smooth in a deviled concoction from the gods. Wagyu beef jerky is just the perfect muchy snack to have with your green tea infused bourbon cocktail in an old fashioned brandy snifter.  I have loved cornish game hens since my grandmother made them for me as a kid and given her passing this past February it was heart warming to see the bird perched on cast iron pan served full with roasted potatoes and spinach. When I say I love everything about this place, I'm also including the high energy bar crowd who reminded me exactly why I miss living in San Francisco so much! (also praise for amazing service (better than Gary Danko's), great wine list, and our corner booth seating was perfect for boisterous conversation and general dinnertime merriment).
author: Nicole S.

description: We think Marlow has the best burger in the city but they are closed on Sunday so the hostess sent us to Park Tavern.  Not to impressive...The bu was hard...the meat was well done and we requested medium rare..the fries were cold...and we had the deviled eggs for an app and there were 3 of us and we had 2 eggs..strange.  Staff and bartender were nice, but will not go back.  Marlow is so much better.  The friend we took loves burgers so we felt bad because it just was not to good, but we had a fun time any way.  Drinks were good.
author: Karen M.

description: Went here this past weekend with my girlfriend. We had the concierge at our hotel make us a reservation. We arrived about 45 minutes early and asked if we could be seated. The hostess bumped us up but while looking for a spot at the bar I spotted 2 seats near the kitchen line that I thought were the bar. Turns out they were dining seats, and one of the staff kindly offered them up if we were interested. Excellent service. I got the bar steak and she got a burger. Both were quite delicious. The truffle fries that came with the burger were excellent. The bar steak was a fillet, but came out pre cut into slices which I was not a huge fan of. The meat was a bit tough for what I would expect of a fillet, but still delicious. I saw many people order the cast iron skillet chicken, and wish I would have tried it since its their specialty. Definitely would go back and recommend it to anyone. The service was top notch, the atmosphere was great and the food was quite delicious.
author: Justin B.

description: Single handedly the best meal I've ever had in my life. To begin with, I could LIVE off their bread it was so fantastic and the steak was the most delicious thing I've ever tasted. The seated us quickly and the service was impeccable. The waiter was very friendly but didn't come over and ask us how we're doing ever 2 seconds. Everyone was very respectful, well dressed and it was a great experience.
author: Shannon H.

description: Tonight we walked through pouring rain to go to a restaurant in SF - upon getting there and learning there was a 2.5 hour wait though, we decided to check out Park Tavern instead. It had good reviews and we had considered going there earlier in the trip and never got to go. Let me just say, I am so happy we did. They took us even though we didn't have a reservation and it was only a 5 minute wait before we were seated. The service was great and the food was excellent!
