We shared the deviled eggs (delicious), my boyfriend had the ahi tuna, and I got the burger (one of the best burgers I've ever had). We also shared the apple and cranberry crisp - so yummy! The food is a little on the pricey side but not too bad considering the fast service and the quality of everything. I definitely recommend putting this restaurant on your list of places to check out in SF.
author: Lisa H.

description: This new "hot spot" will burn out within the year. Noise level is intolerable and the food was mediocre. Excellent deviled eggs could not make up for poor charcuterie, cold hamburger, tasteless roast chicken, appetizer-sized scallop entree, and generally immediately-forgettable cuisine. If they find the right new chef, they might be able to save the considerable investment. The bar is busy with those who will disappear to the next happening place in a few months, leaving Park Tavern to the unfortunate tourist looking for good food in North Beach. Very, very disappointing place that can't compete in San Francisco.
author: Robert F.

description: Absolutely sensational. Chicken worth the wait. Also the pork chop is a good choice
author: Al G.

description: Came for Sunday brunch. Great food, super decor but NOISY! Whew! Service also outstanding. Excellent place.
author: Beth D.

description: Everything was delicious. Deviled egg blew my mind! Fried lemon slices with burrata cheese and fresh basil, divine. Carrots with pesto danced on my pallet. Would love to go back and just get drinks and apps. Yum!
author: carolyn a.

description: Great atmosphere, decent food, fabulous wine list. I say the food was "decent" because it was a little too salty for my taste. However, the kale appetizer they brought us was divine.
author: Ali B.

description: I went to Marlowe's awhile back and I enjoyed it so much I decided to try their sister restaurant, Park Tavern.   Just as I expected, there was not one disappointment.   The ambiance is sexy traditional American, the service -impeccable.   And don't even get me started on the food....AMAZING!  I am really into restaurants that offer snacks in addition to the usual appetizer/entree/dessert categories.  The cuisine is innovative and there are some traditional items on the menu like twice baked potatoes and deviled eggs but these are not your grandma's deviled eggs.   Well, let's just say don't even think about leaving Park Tavern without having one or two of these eggs and you will know what I'm talking about.
author: G A.

description: Delicious food, great service!  I've been here four times now - twice with reservations and twice without.  The times I've come without reservations, the wait was long (over an hour each time), but the complimentary drinks they offered for our trouble and the delicious offerings made the wait worthwhile.  Try the deviled eggs - I do not like deviled eggs, but I LOVE these.  Brussel chips were light, crunchy, and perfectly salted.  The steak tartare special is ridiculously tasty, and the burger deserves a spot on the top-burgers-in-sf list for sure.  Will be coming back for a fifrh visit soon!
author: n k.

description: The food here is SO salty. We had the deviled eggs, brussel sprout chips, a burger and the filet mignon and the entire meal was so salty that I left thirsty and more bloated than ever. Their prices are a little high for the quality of food.
author: Joanna B.

description: This is officially my new favorite restaurant in SF! Their steak is TO DIE for, and I've brought a few friends from out of town here and they claim it was the best meal they'd had in SF! Great service, very attentive waitstaff. Pretty expensive food, but you're really getting what you pay for!
author: Emily P.

description: great, bustling atmosphere: love big restaurants, reminds me of new york!  hard to get a resi, but really easy to grab a spot at the communal table or chef's corner.  obsessed with the lemon chips and burrata.  i am also a fan of the polenta (ask for extra cabbage), deviled eggs, and brussel sprout chips.  great cocktails and boozy shakes.  my one complaint is that the food is very heaaaaavy.
author: Anna V.

description: We had our 15th wedding anniversary dinner last night and loved nearly every morsel.  Our waitress was lovely and comped us a piece of Black Forrest cake, which wasn't our favorite. But we LOVED the deviled eggs, chicken liver mouse, brussel sprout chips and "demons on horseback." We will definitely go back again!
author: Sarah T.

description: All in all, it is a good place to dine at from food, service, location and ambiance.  I took a friend out for her birthday.  She did not really want to have a heavy dinner thus we ordered only 4 appetizers and a soup each.  That stuffed us.  The only disappointment I had was one of the appetizers and the Lobster Bisque were salty.  I can tolerate salt but even me find it difficult to finish the dish as it was really salty.  The floor is in tile and it gets a bit slippery as I think the servers got the grease under the sole and walked to the dinning room.  I almost slipped.
author: Perry H.

description: The food is delicious, the room has a wonderful ambience and the staff are warm & friendly. I love this place!
author: Victoria W.

description: Food was good but not amazing.  I personally was not a fan of the beef tartar as it tasted a bit bland, but the kampachi was delicious.  Others in my party were happy with the filet and I had the fish special which was good.  Service here is very good - super nice and attentive.
author: Colleen B.

description: I took a client and stuffy co-workers there for a work dinner on a Wed night.  6:00 reservation.  We were seated, fine, ordered a $115 bottle of WHITE wine, order a few apps and four main courses.  About 10 minutes later they're putting down the mains, telling us that they were ready before the apps. Uh, no.... just settling in, $115 bottle of WHITE wine, "please bring the appetizers first.  We'd like to have a sort of nice dinner, thanks."  Well did they make us pay for that!  Twenty minutes until the apps appeared. 40 minutes before mains that had been warming under lamps.  yuck.  and then I get my brand-new car from the valet --- they'd left the window open in the rain.  I ask for a towel, still being nice..."uh, dude, I don't really have one." I'm a dorky business woman in my 40's -- don't call me "dude".  And they kept the change from the valet parking.  Overall -- don't waste your time.  Food was "fine"; service was not.  and did I mention we'd ordered a bottle of white wine for $115? I want them to service me -- I would have ordered two more bottles!!!!
author: Kerry L.

description: You MUST get the Roasted Brussels Sprouts. These were fabulous. I will come back just to eat those! I also enjoyed the upscale tavern ambience.
author: Avid E.

description: I came to Park Tavern last night on an impromptu man date and was pleasantly surprised.  Gastropub meets restaurant in north beach, very spacious, nice ambiance and friendly service staff.  I want to give this place 5 stars based purely on their lobster bisque; it was DELICIOUS.  It came with a log of salted filo dough and crab.  What else is a man to ask for?  The rest of the meal, however, was on the 3-star level.  The fillet was just okay and the dessert, birthday cake, was very underwhelming.  We also had the beef tartar for a snack to start and while the first bite was tasty, it was too oily and heavy for my taste.  the price was right for me to come back, if only for another taste of that delicious bisque!
author: Albert B.

description: Went to Park Tavern with a group of 4.  Ordered a number of appetizers and entrees.  Everything was very good and the servers were extremely friendly.  Fried lemon slices and burrata stood out to me.  I wasn't as big a fan of the burger but it was mainly due to personal taste
author: John S.

description: love the Brussels sprout chips!! So much so I recreated them at home... Though nothing beats park's!
author: Ashley G.

description: I had dinner with a girlfriend at Park Tavern earlier this week and everything was incredible. Upon arriving, I was greeted by two very friendly hostess and took a seat at the bar while I waited for my friend to arrive. Ordered the McLaren at the bar -- right up my alley! It was super refreshing and tasty. Our server was amazing, attentive, and friendly and offered really great food recommendations. We ended up sharing the brussel sprout chips, the scallops, and the twiced baked potatoes. All the dishes arrived quickly, which was awesome since we were both so hungry! I highly recommend Park Tavern and will be back.
author: Ashley C.

description: Dinner was great! Had the deviled eggs, Brussel sprout chips, homemade beef jerky, mussels, twice cooked potatoes, and crab and lobster bisque. Carafe of wines are a great deal and permit sampling of wines. Lively atmosphere and they were super nice to our picky 13 year old. Will definitely go back.
author: Hayley T.

description:
Really looked forward to my night here, loved the food, delish! Had the pork belly bites, brussel sprout chips, and fried oyster caesar for apps, the scallops, mussels and a side of polenta for entree. Like I said delish! 

Why not 5 stars than you ask....Got here a couple minutes early for my reservation. Told out table was not quite ready...no problem, I will have a drink. Person who was community table server was at the other end of the table but never bothered "looking" down his station to be aware of the whole picture (major pet peeve of mine) After trying to get his attention several times my friend and I went to the bar at which time our other friend finally waved him down. So we got our drinks and were sipping them and he comes over and asks us what time our reservation was for 8p he says, and I say no it was for 7:45p (it was a bit after 8p) and proceeds to give us a check and asked us to get up as there were several people hovering around for our seats...OMG, are you joking??? especially since the drinks were close to $40. I was very turned off by that and did something I never do at a restaurant, I went to the manager and asked if it was OK if we sat there till out table was ready (especially since we were on time and it was going on 30 min at this point)...she said absolutely and asked who said it wasn't...I had to tattle on this guy as it was some of the worst customer service I have encountered in a restaurant in a LONG time. About 10 minutes later they sat us at a nice table by the line ( I love watching the action, I have been in the business for my whole working life). Thank you manager/head hostess (gal with blond hair, wearing a gray sweater, sorry I forgot to ask your name) as you changed the sour taste in my mouth that your ridiculous acting server put in it...then also the food helped.
author: Kim C.

description:
Went to Park Tavern for the second time last night.  My first visit was about a month ago and both dinners were excellent!

For our first dinner, we shared the brussel sprout chips, the pork belly bites, the deviled eggs, the steak crudo, and the burger.  Even split, that was WAY too much food for 2 people!  Everything was very good.  Although, if you're going to order the pork belly bites, be sure you're a party of more than 2.  They are so rich and you can only have one or two.  The brussel sprout chips were thin and crispy, with just the right amount of salt.  The deviled eggs were to die for...the pickled jalapeno and crispy bacon marry very well with the egg.  The steak crudo was nice, but nothing to rave about.  And the burger was fantastic!  They ask if you want it medium rare, and they mean it.  It's very pink inside, so if you don't like it that way, be sure to have them cook it longer.  I am a fan of medium rare and it was just perfect for me.  You can't beat a burger with crispy bacon and melty cheese.  The fries were perfectly crispy and salted as well.

Last night we enjoyed the beef jerky, the deviled eggs (seriously so good!), the halibut crudo, the porcini salad, the clam chowder, and the burger again.  If you are a fan of beef jerky, you must order this.  It's got fantastic flavor and texture.  The halibut crudo was just lovely...small bites of raw halibut, jalapeno, avocado, sweet corn and chive.  Yum!  And the porcini salad was fabulous...the mushrooms were to die for.  We ordered the clam chowder based on the rave reviews it's gotten and it was delicious!  Be forewarned, it is very rich and I think it would be difficult for one person to finish by him/herself.  And just as it was last time, the burger was fantastic.

My one gripe is that I felt rushed...both times.  The bus boys came around 3-4 times asking if we were done, when I clearly wasn't.  I hate the feeling of being rushed at a restaurant.

Other than that, Park Tavern is quickly becoming one of my favorite places to go to!
author: Las Y.

description: Started with drinks at the bar - a generous space that was hopping, which I imagine it does most nights.  The makeover from Moose's is awesome and the restaurant feels good.  Hamachi crudo with sea salt and grapefruit juice was delicious and served on a cool, dark slate dish.  Heirloom carrots were nicely displayed, but I thought the accompanying drizzle was too sweet, overshadowing the natural goodness of the veg.  The polenta could have been the best I've ever tasted.  The deviled eggs were also very good - nothing crazy or game changing here.  Tombo tuna main was perfectly seared raw and was excellent.  We chose a 2001 Rioja Reserva that just got better and better through the meal.  Nice pick whomever built the list - and a decent price, $70.  Our server was a bit frazzled, but bought us dessert and made the experience a great one.
author: Steven B.

description: I first dined here when they were first opening, so while the service still had some kinks to work out, the food, drinks, and atmoshere won me over.  I will definitely be back to enjoy a sit down dinner, but it may also become my 'go-to' spot for happy hour drinks with friends.
author: M G.

description: The atmosphere was great, the staff was super friendly, and the food was both creative and delicious.  The cocktails were also fantastic - definitely try the McLaren.  Can't wait to go back.
author: Will H.

description:
elegant space, brussel sprout petals are delightful, burger is killer. 
as expected and perfectly executed 

Welcome to the neighborhood, Park Tavern!!

and a special acknowledgment to brussel sprouts for your presence on menus all over town.  I've always loved brussel sprouts.  

Why did they get such a bad rep during childhood??  I grew up in the era of Cabbage Patch Kids, you would think these little baby cabbages would have been a huge hit...
author: Jen S.

description: I happened upon this place by accident after seeing the dishes of the people sitting outside. I sat at the bar on a Sunday afternoon for brunch. I wasn't expecting much but the food just blew me away. I have never had such good brunch food ever. The drinks are equally as impressive. I had the Boozy Smoothie and the standard Bloody Mary.  The depth of flavor of the bloody mary was very surprising. I have never tasted one like that. Again, very impressed. The garnish was so delicious that I wanted to steal a few while the bartenders weren't looking but I held back.  I had the Avocado Toast appetizer... In one word Incredible.  How the heck do they get that much flavor in a piece of toast with avocado on top??  I followed with the chicken and the egg or something like that. It came with a deviled egg purée. WOW! I couldn't get enough! I had to talk myself out of going here for dinner the next night so I would try out another place. I will definitely return.
author: Aaron A.

description: it's cold by the windows and even though it's packed they find space by the kitchen. a place to watch them create. the place feels busy and fast, action and excitement. will not forget the bird, came out like a sacrifice and a warning and it tasted great.
author: Fzarond K.

description: Great atmosphere, beautiful design, amazing menu.  BUT...the food was not at the same level of the space or even the printed menu.  We ordered the brussel sprout chips- excellent, but they are served in a bowl, which makes eating them with others a little unsanitary and messy (it should have been served on a long rectangle plate with no recycling of licked fingers on my soon to be eaten brussel's).  We also had the mushroom soup which was delicious.  We ordered the game hen, and the presentation was fantastic, but the bird was heavily over salted which translated into extremely salty spinach at the base of the bird.  The thing is I am a salt lover, so if it was too salty for me, it must have been totally unbearable for the average diner.  We also had the pork chop and the Marlowe burger.  The chop was a healthy size, but it was cooked unevenly.  Some parts of the chop were cooked through and others boarder too rare (and not along the bone which was the strange part).  Overall this is a great addition to the dining scene in SF, with just a few tweaks, this could be my new favorite place.
author: Ashley K.

description: I am a big fan of Marlowe so was looking forward to checking out Park Tavern. This last weekend, I went here with a friend. The valet parking is perfect since as most of you know this neighborhood is almost impossible to park in after 7 PM. The space is really nice and we scored a corner table where we were able to see the entire dining room and also the open kitchen. Our server seemed very green - he had a difficult time telling us what the specials were for the evening. He wasn't able to remember what they were exactly. Seemed a bit odd, but not a big deal. He took our drink order and then came back a few minutes later saying they would be right up and took our order. We of course ordered the much talked about deviled eggs which deserve all of the praise that they get! But strangely these came to our table first, then a few minutes later, our drinks arrived. After we polished off the eggs, then the bread arrived. Just a very strange order of things. For starters, I ordered a salad with white asparagus, hearts of palm and avocado - it was delicious and had a nice refreshing taste. Exactly what I was looking for. My friend had the warm chicories which was also very tasty. Then our mains arrived - this is sadly where our meal took a turn. I ordered the petite poulet rouge. The presentation was impressive but I noticed that the bird looked a bit burned and the vegetables also were overcooked as well. The dish was a bit bland and needless to say, I was disappointed. My friend ordered the "Marlowe" burger and it was also unimpressive. Not bad or anything but nothing really special either. We ordered the lemon cheesecake parfait to share for dessert. There was barely any lemon flavor to the dessert. I have to say that I probably won't  be rushing back here anytime soon. But if I do go, I might just stick to their starters!
author: M S.

description: We tried Park Tavern after seeing a glowing review of it on KQED. The restaurant is charming and the staff is really excellent. But the three of us felt the food really fell short. My husband and I each ordered the standing game hen perched on spinach. The hen was moist, but was devoid of flavor, just no wow factor to the dish. Another person in our group had the strip steak, a big disappoinment as the meat was thin and flavorless. The deviled eggs were tasty as were the brussels sprouts chips even tho they were awfully salty. We ordered two desserst,the fig/toffee/cheese plate and the "almond joy." Nowhere had I ever seen such tiny desserts, really just miniscule to the point that we just had to laugh. For the price, the food was mediocre (although well conceived) and the dessert presentation just has to be a joke. With so many restaurant choices in SF, this one will not be on our list again.
author: Willow R.

description: This is my new favorite place!  With a gorgeous classic with a twist brasserie design, overlooking Washington Square, it's an easy walk from my office downtown.  I arrived a bit early for my reservation, but the host kindly seated me in a prime spot, where I had a lovely, if slightly sweet drink, while waiting for my husband.  Just as he arrived, our waitress brought the drink that I had requested for him--perfect timing!  Do have the deviled eggs--two halves for each of us made a great appetizer, full of creamy-crunchy-spicy (with the jalapeno) flavors and textures.  We also had the lemon chips (yum!) with green hummus (pretty darn good), steak tartare (really good and generous portion) and NY strip steak with fries.  The sommelier was very engaging and helpful, and we ended up ordering a wine that I had thought about earlier in the evening, by coincidence.  All in all, a wonderful experience.
author: Meredith B.

description: Maybe I built up the how amazing the food was going to be, but found the whole dining experience to be a bust. Our waiter flat out stunk...ignored our table for the first 20 plus minutes and then for the rest of the evening seemed to be rushing us out of there. I was so excited for the deviled eggs but what a disappointment, I've had better store- bought deviled eggs. The lemon chips and burrata were decent, but not the most tasty burrata I've had. My pork chop was pretty yummy, but again not something I'd rave or crave to go back for.  My friends who had the Poulet chicken were disappointed as well.  One of them claimed the rotisserie chicken you can buy from Costco is moister and tastier (ouch).  The warm bread was delicious (redeeming quality??) but overall a very disappointing experience.  Perhaps it was just an off night, but definitely won't be clamoring to return anytime soon.  Oh, and don't even get me started on the fact a man had his little dog crawling all over the booth the next table over....really?
author: Kristen S.
